loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel is 43 years old, and at 18 years of age he started working at his uncle's upholstery business as his uncle's assistant. After several years of apprenticeship, Miguel began perfecting his skill and saving money to be able to open his own business.

Today, Miguel, along with his brother, owns one of the most renowned upholstery businesses in his city. He has all types of upholstery for cars, chairs, armchairs, and couches.

Several months ago Miguel decided to participate in a bidding by a public firm dedicated to the construction of economy housing for those with limited resources. Miguel won the bid to make 100 chair, armchair, and couch upholsteries. In order to follow through on this work, Miguel needs to purchase fabric, foam, glue, and staples in large quantities. So that he may begin this project, Miguel asks for a loan of 500 dollars to aquire these necessary elements.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel tiene 43 años y empezó a los 18 años en el rubro de la tapicería, trabajando como ayudante de su tío en su negocio. Tras varios años de aprendizaje fue perfeccionándose y ahorrando dinero para poder independizarse y abrir su propio negocio.

Hoy día Miguel es dueño junto con su hermano de una de las tapicerías más renombradas de su ciudad, realiza todo tipo de tapizados para vehículos, sillas, sillones y sofá.

Hace unos meses él decidió participar a un llamado de licitación de una empresa pública que se dedica a la construcción de viviendas económicas para gente de escasos recursos; Miguel ganó la licitación para realizar 100 tapizados de sillas, sillones y sofá por lo que para poder cumplir con el trabajo requerido necesita comprar telas, espuma, pegamento y grapas en grandes cantidades. Miguel solicita un crédito de $ 500 para poder adquirir los elementos que necesita para poder empezar su trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, foam, and glue in large quantity

loans.name: Roni

texts.id:
Currently Roni works for a lamp cover factory owned by his sibling that pays him $70-$100 per month. Seeing the growth and profitability of his sibling's business, he wants to challenge himself by starting his own business with loan from DINARI and some additional funding help from his brother. With his skills and 5 year experience from working for his sibling, Roni is well qualified to start similar business, except that he still needs to secure funding. With $100 per month capital to buy raw materials like bamboo, Roni expects to earn $15 per week. Roni plans to use some of those profit to pay his $175 per year lease for his facilities.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Roni saat ini bekerja disalah satu usaha membuat kap lampu yang dimiliki oleh saudaranya, dengan penghasilan Rp.700.000 - Rp.1.000.000.- perbulan. Melihat perkembangan usaha tersebut cukup mendukung akhirnya Roni ditantang untuk membuka usaha sendiri dengan bantuan modal dari saudaranya dan pinjaman dari DINARI. Dengan pengalaman dan kemampuannya selama 5 tahun bekerja dengan saudaranya Roni tidak mengalami kesulitan untuk membuka usaha yang sama kecuali dari segi permodalan. Dengan modal Rp.1.000.000.-perbulan yang digunakan untuk membeli bahan-bahan anyaman dari bambu dan sapu lidi, Roni dapat meraup keuntungan Rp.150.000 /minggu.dengan keuntungan tersebut Roni harus menyisihkan sebagian keuntungannya untuk membayar tempat yang disewanya dengan harga sewa Rp.1.750.000./tahun.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for his business

loans.name: Gloria Delia

texts.es:
Gloria is a working woman who engages in producing alfalfa for animal consumption for the families in her region who raise them. She tried to support her family through different activities because she could not find a stable job. Twelve years ago, Gloria and her husband decided to dedicate themselves to selling alfalfa. At the time, they made the decision to support their newly born daughter. Both have continued to work hard even till now, since their family and responsibilities have grown and their children are studying at a prestigious school in their community. Everyday, they work up very early to divide up the alfalfa for each home but before this, they amass and store the alfalfa in in large quantities to reduce the workload the following day. They long to increase their production; thus, they request a loan. Make a decision to support this family whose only means of support comes from selling forages. They want good futures for their children so they can contribute back to society one day.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es una mujer trabajadora que comercializa alfalfa para la alimentación a animales pequeños que mantienen en casa las familias de su localidad. Tras varios intentos de sostener a su familia con diversas actividades ante la carente posibilidad de encontrar un trabajo seguro. Gloria y su esposo decidieron hace doce años dedicarse a la venta de alfalfa en aquel entonces para sostener a su hija recién nacida fruto del gran amor que se tienen. Ambos continúan trabajando arduamente ya que ahora su familia y responsabilidades se han incrementado y se encuentran estudiando en un prestigioso centro educativo de su localidad. Todos los días se levantan muy temprano para repartir la alfalfa en cada una de las casas pero antes de ello la cosecharon en cantidad para almacenarla y aminorar el trabajo al día siguiente. Tienen el anhelo de incrementar su producción y por esa razón solicitan un préstamo. Decídete a apoyar a esta familia que tiene como único sostén la venta de forraje y quieren ver a sus hijos en el futuro convertidos en buenos hombres al servicio de la sociedad.

loans.use: Buy seeds for production

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza is a loving and hard working mother. Even though her family has had difficulties due to poverty, she has always tried hard and worked hard to support her family and keep them moving forward. Esperanza runs a small shop where she sells various items needed for every day. She works every day of the week to serve the people in her community. She is also taking care of her young grandchildren, as well as her oldest son who needed a stomach operation recently and now needs a lot of care and help with his children. Her goal now is to grow her small business and increase the number of products she offers, expanding her customer base and increasing her income. This will enable her to improve the health and the quality of life for her family. She is requesting a loan to help her reach her goals. You can be an important part of the growth of her business.

Doña Esperanza, es una mujer muy abnegada, cariñosa y laboriosa, está a cargo de dos de sus hijos y aunque en su familia haya momentos difíciles a causa de la pobreza, ella se ha esforzado y ha trabajado más para sacar adelante a su familia. Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega en el que comercializa diversos productos de primera necesidad para toda su comunidad durante todos los días de la semana.Así mismo se encarga del cuidado de sus pequeños nietos ya que su hijo mayor fue operado de un quiste en el estómago hace poco y necesita de muchos cuidados y ayuda con sus pequeños. Ahora su meta próxima es ampliar la infraestructura de su pequeño puesto de trabajo con el deseo de aumentar la pluralidad de los productos que brinda, a fin de mejorar sus servicios e incrementar la cantidad de clientes para obtener mayores ingresos económicos que le permitan mejorar la salud y nivel de vida de su familia. Y para concretar este anhelo solicita un préstamo. Vosotros podeis ser parte importante del crecimiento de este negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INCREASE THE STOCK IN HER SMALL SHOP AND GROW HER CUSTOMER BASE, INCREASE HER INCOME AND BETTER CARE FOR HER FAMILY.

loans.name: Gladys Doris' Group

texts.es:
Gladys, Ilda and Marcial have been part of the Virtud Communal Bank for 1, 2 and 1 year respectively. Since they join Virtud Communal Bank they’ve learned to be responsible, punctual and how to encourage their children to save money.

Gladys is 35 years old and has 2 children. She's been selling potatoes in Nery Garcia's produce market for the last 13 years. Ilda is 30 years old and has 3 children. She has been selling emollient for the last 8 years. Martial is 35 years old and has 4 children. He has been working as a construction worker for the last 10 years and he works in Lima city.

Gladys, Ilda and Marcial need a $134 loan each. These loans will be invested in the purchase of potatoes, tile cutter, linaza, herbs, sugar and firewood. Gladys, Ilda and Marcial’s dreams are to send their kids to college, build their own house and expand their businesses.

Emollient: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emollient

Translated from Spanish to English by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer

Gladys, Ilda y Marcial pertenecen al Banco Comunal Virtud desde hace 1, 2 y 1 año respectivamente. Ellas nos dicen que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, puntuales, cómo educar a los hijos y a ahorrar. Gladys tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, y vende papa en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza desde hace 13 años, inicialmente era ambulante y ahora ya tiene un puesto. Ilda tiene 30 años y 3 hijos y vende emoliente ambulatoriamente en un grifo, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años. Marcial tiene 35 años y 4 hijos y es albañil; realiza trabajos de construcción, actividad que aprendió hace 10 años cuando trabajaba como peón en la ciudad de Lima. Gladys, Ilda y Marcial necesitan préstamos de 400 soles cada uno, que serán invertidos en la compra de papa, cortador para cerámicas, linaza, hierbas, azúcar y leña. Los ahorros de Gladys, Ilda y Marcial son para el futuro de sus hijos, para comprar su terreno y construir su casa. Los Sueños de Gladys, Ilda y Marcial son sus hijos sean profesionales, construir su casa para alquilar y que sus negocios sean grandes.

loans.use: Gladys, Ilda and Marcial need a $134 loan each. These loans will be invested in the purchase of potatoes, tile cutter, linaza, herbs, sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Brenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
A friend of Brenda Elizabeth invited her to help sell toys at the marketplace and Brenda jumped at the offer. This is how she learned the vitals skills needed to manage a store in the marketplace. She decided to open her own business. She put some money together and bought a bulk of used clothing and started her business with these items. Brenda has been able to help her husband with living expenses and to provide for her young 2 year old daughter.

However, Brenda thinks it is imperative to buy new bulk of used clothing and products to have more variety of items, which in turn will attract more customers. Brenda is requesting a loan of $600 which will be paid off in installments over the course of 6 months. With this loan, Brenda will be able to buy the necessary merchandise. Brenda will be able to support her family with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Una amiga de Brenda Elizabeth la invitó a que le ayudara a vender juguetes en un mercado y a Brenda le gustó mucho el oficio. Fue así como aprendió lo necesario para poder mantener un local en un mercado. Y decidió abrir su propio local. Juntó un poco de dinero y compró una paca de ropa usada y con esto comenzó. Poco a poco ha ido incrementando otro tipo de productos hasta los que ofrece hoy. Gracias a este negocio Brenda ha podido ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de su pequeña de 2 años.

Sin embargo Brenda considera que es necesario comprar una nueva paca de ropa y productos para poder tener más variedad en sus productos y así tener más clientes. Brenda está solicitando un crédito de US $600 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Brenda podrá comprar la mercancía necesaria. Con tu ayuda Brenda logrará sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: to buy package of clothing and toys

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en: My name is Zahida P. from the second largest city Lahore, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of six: four daughters and two sons. My husband is a welder and runs a welding workshop. He works very hard from morning till noon everyday. He hopes to expand his business further and therefore needs a loan. Last year, he bought me a TV and fridge with his earnings. I request  loans for my group members who are: Noreen B. wose husband repairs cycles. Nargis B. who sells ready made garments. Gulzar B. who needs to buy cloth. Shamshad B. is borrowing for her husband to buy him iron for his welding business. I have been their Group Leader for last three years and help them so that they can completely escape poverty and earn decent livelihoods for their families.

loans.use: Expand auto workshop

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane O. is a 46-year-old community health worker (CHW). She lives in Kisumu, Kenya, with her husband and seven children (3 sons and 4 daughters). In the year 1988 she started her butchery business. In 2002 she was then trained by KMET in home-based HIV/AIDS care. Through hard work and perseverance aided by four previous KMET/ KIVA microfinance loans, Jane has managed to expand her business and build a successful community pharmacy. Her reputation and friendly approach to her clients and customers has earned her respect in the community. Jane requires an additional US $800 in order to further expand her pharmacy and butchery business.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Purchase stock of drugs for her pharmacy and also expand her butchery business.

loans.name: Victoria Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida has belonged to the communal bank "Nobleza" for three years. She is married, is 33 years old, and has one child. She runs a drug store where she also sells various gifts and vanity items. Zoraida is a professional obstetrician, and a few days ago she opened her own medical center in the same location.

Zoraida needs a loan for $1075 which she will invest in purchasing antibiotics. She will use her savings to increase her capital as well as to open another drug store.

Zoraida dreams of having her own clinic and making sure her son studies at a good university.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Zoraida pertenece al Banco Comunal Nobleza hace 3 años.

Zoraida es casada, tiene 33 años y 1 hijo, Zoraida tiene una botica donde también vende artículos de regalo, tocador. Zoraida es de profesión Obstetríz y hace algunos días implementó un consultorio médico en el mismo local.

Zoraida necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos antibióticos.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará para incrementar su capital e implementar otra botica.

Los sueños de Zoraida son tener una clínica y que su hijo se eduque en una universidad buena.

loans.use: Purchasing medicines and antibiotics for her new medical center and drug store.

loans.name: Khac Cuong

texts.vi:
Mr Nguyễn Khắc Cương is 37 years old. He's requesting 2.478.000 VND for his wife. She sells basic goods at the market and works on their rice paddy. He is a construction worker. They have 3 children who are in school. This is his second loan with SEDA. He has paid off successfully the first one.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Anh Nguyễn Khắc Cương (MS: 070006), năm nay 37 tuổi. Anh vay 2.478.000 VND để cho vợ anh đi chợ mua bán phế liệu, ngoài ra chị còn làm thêm đồng ruộng. Anh thì đi làm thợ xây. Anh chị có 3 con hiện còn đang đi học. ( Anh Cương đã vay một kỳ và hiện nay đã hoàn trả hết ).

loans.use: sells basic goods

loans.name: Hadija Nankya ’S Group

texts.en:
N. Hadija is 32 years old, married and the mother of five children who range in age from 16 to 23. She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables, including oranges, bananas and tomatoes, in a market about a mile from her home. She is there seven days a week from first light at 7 a.m. until the end of the day, and reports that her business is profitable.

Hadija is the leader of a group of four. She has been a member of MCDT since 2002 and has received 13 previous loans. With a new loan, she will be able to buy more produce for her stand at the market and pay school fees so that her children can go to school. Her goal for the future is to buy a plot of land and build a house so she will no longer have to pay rent.

loans.use: Buy produce

loans.name: Pak Asadullah Group
loans.use: To buy clothing supplies

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. lives in Igbelerin-Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She sells clothes and drinks, and she is also a hair stylist. Comfort learned how to style hair for 3 years. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. She is a LAPO client. Comfort makes lovely hairstyles with hair extensions for her customers. She needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more clothes and drinks for sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and clothes for sale

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa N. is a 43 year old man who owns a veterinary medicine shop. He started his business in 1992. Musa is married and has 2 children. It is very hard to meet his family's financial needs, so Musa has applied for a loan of $1000 USD to expand his current business.

loans.use: To expand his current business.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is the wife of N. A. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and religious places. Zubaida baji has been living in this city for 40 years. She is a housewife and prefers to do household work.

Zubaida baji’s husband manufactures clothes and bed sheets and sells them in the market. He earns approximately $600 to $800. Zubaida baji is applying for a loan to buy thread to make more clothes and bed sheets and thus be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Buy thread to make clothes and bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Ni Ketut Nilasih

texts.id:
Dalam situasi ekonomi seperti sekarang ini sangat sulit bagi Ni Ketut Nilasih untuk bisa menyekolahkan kedua anaknya yang kini sudah duduk di bangku SMU. Apalagi penghasilan suaminya sebagai petani tidak mencukupi untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga. Untuk bisa menambah penghasilan keluarga maka Ni Ketut Nilasih akan menjalankan usaha beternak babi. Rencananya Ni Ketut Nilasih akan membeli 2 ekor bibit babi. Karena kekurangan modal maka hal ini terus ditunda,sampai akhirnya Yayasan Dinari memberikan pinjaman modal untuk usaha Ketut Nilasih. Selain memberi pinjaman
Dinari juga memberikan pembinaan kepada Ketut Nilasih tentang bagaimana cara beternak babi yang benar serta cara memberi pakan yang baik agar usaha ini dapat memberi keuntungan yang bagus. Sehingga dapat mendukung ekonomi keluarga ,sehingga anak-anaknya tetap dapat bersekolah. Sesuai dengan program ini bahwa pinjaman akan dilunasi pada akhir periode pinjaman.
texts.en:
In the current economic situation it is very difficult for Ni Ketut Nilasih to provide for her two children’s education now at SMU. Especially when her husband’s income as a farmer is insufficient to cover the family’s expenses. To supplement the family’s income Ni Ketut Nilasih will rear pigs. Ni Ketut Nilasih’s plan is to purchase 2 piglets. Because of insufficient funding this project had been postponed until finally Dinari Foundation provided laon to Ketut Nilasih for the project. Besides giving loan, Dinari also provides foundation knowledge to Ketut Nilasih relating to correct methods of pig farming and method of providing good feed so that it will generate good income. This enables her to supplement the family’s financial condition, so that her children can continue their education. In accordance with the program the loan will be repaid at the end of the loan.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets and livestock supplies (Anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Martha Miriam

texts.es: La profesora Martha S. está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 5to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (repellar la vivienda), trabaja como docente desde hace 21 años, tiene 4 hijos, todos estudian y la hija mayor  estudia y trabaja a la vez para ayudar a su mamá con los gastos familiares ya que son muy pobres, a pesar que Martha ha sido madre y padre para sus hijos ha luchado para que a ellos no le falte lo básico en el  hogar, es una docente que ama su trabajo ya que ayuda a muchos niños a leer, escribir y a ser mejores personas para la sociedad, actualmente esta estudiando su 4to año en la universidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. Ella se siente agradecida con la Institución de AFODENIC pues con los créditos anteriores ha comprado electrodomésticos y a mejorado la vivienda donde ella vive, su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y trabajo para así sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Professor Martha S. would like to refinance her fifth loan, in order to invest in home improvements. Martha has been a teacher for 21 years. She has four children, and all of them are in school. Her eldest daughter works in addition to studying full time in order to help her mother cover the family's expenses. They're very poor but in spite of that Martha has been a mother and father to her children, fighting to ensure that their basic needs are met. Martha loves her job, especially helping children learn to read, write, and become better citizens. She's currently studying in her fourth year of university at URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. Martha is grateful for AFODENIC and has used prior credits to buy home appliances, improving her house. Her dream is to own a beautiful home and work so that her children can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Khanbala

texts.en: Khanbala S. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children. He has been breeding cattle since his youth, owing to his father who was a farmer with a rich experience in cattle breeding. He is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, above all getting milk from his cows, which he sells in local markets. Khanbala keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children, along with his wife, who all help him with caring for the animals. Now Khanbala needs a loan to purchase more cattle to expand his business. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita S. is 42 years old and married to Santi who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children who are Roshellin – 25 years old, commerce graduate, and Caren Joy – 16 years old and currently a high school freshman. With a good relationship in the family, Merlita is really inspired in pursuing the business she started because she wants to finance her youngest daughter's college education. They live in Ilagan municipality. Merlita shared also that the village where they live is a faraway rural place and mountainous.

Merlita wants to request loan assistance for her rice vending business, amounting to PHP 5,000 that will be very helpful to her business. According to her, the loan will be used to purchase sacks of rice and animal feed for her business since they are in demand. The products will be sold at retail prices in order to generate more income for her family and money for school fees for her children. She hopes to upgrade her business through her strong determination, for she believes that with this, she will be able to succeed in all her goals in life.

loans.use: purchase sacks of rice and animal feed to sell

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr .Luis J. es soltero  y vive en el Barrio San Francisco de Carapeguà es una   persona joven que poco a  poco  fue  progresando se iniciò desde  de abajo montando  un  pequeño  puesto de venta de comidas ràpidas ,  

Cuenta  con  un  bonito  lugar que reune a mucha  clientela  por que  resulta confortable  por el  buen  servicio y la calidad de sus  productos es unos de 

	Solicita el préstamo para la compra de una  maquina  para  preparar lomitos.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis J. is a bachelor and lives in the neighborhood of San Francisco of Carapeguà. He is young and has prepared, little by little, to set up a small fast-food stand.

He has a beautiful place that collects many customers and allows for a comfortable, good service and high quality products.

He asks for a loan to buy a machine that makes lomitos (a type of sandwich.)

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new products for making food

loans.name: D. Nicole

texts.fr:
S.  D.  Nicole est née vers 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Nicole est mariée et mère de trois(3) enfants dont deux(2) scolarisés. S. Nicole est une vendeuse de divers: biscuits, chocolats, fromages,sucres, laits, etc. Nicole arrive à faire face aux charges de sa famille grâce au revenu que lui procure cette activité. Cependant, Nicole manque de fonds pour diversifier son activité qu'elle veut plus prospère. Nicole a donc recours à ALIDé pour son besoin de crédit afin de développer son commerce. 
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Ms. S. D. Nicole was born around 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She is a retailer of various goods: cookies, chocolate, cheese, sugar, milk, etc. Nicole manages to cope with family expenses thanks to the income this business brings in. Yet she lacks the funds for diversifying her business, which she wants to be more prosperous. She has therefore turned towards ALIDE for her lending needs, so as to develop her commerce.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of cookies, chocolate, cheese, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng  52 tuổi, Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm  2005. Chị Hồng hiện đang chăn nuôi tại nhà còn chồng chị làm nghề mộc.Với mức thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng  gia đình chị Hồng đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để  cải thiện cuộc sống.
Vòng vốn tới chị Hà mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và mua gỗ làm mộc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 52 years old, has participated in TYM Fund since 2005. Mrs. H. currently raises livestock at home, and her husband makes furniture. With an income of VND 2,000,000 per month, Mrs. H.’s family increasingly has more financial resources to improve the living condition.

In this loan cycle, Mrs. Ha wishes to borrow VND12,000,000 to invest in livestock raising and to buy woods to make furniture.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in livestock raising and to buy woods to make furniture

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita S. is 30 years old, married to Bonie, and has three children. They live in the town of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has requested a loan amount of PHP 7,000 for the financing of their fishing business, which her husband will manage. Conchita dreams that her husband will catch abundant fish, because she would like to buy a pump boat and fishing accessories. She also has a vision to have a concrete house and for her children to finish their studies someday.

loans.use: For financing of her fishing business

loans.name: Edgar Vicente

texts.es: Edgar Vicente Téllez A. tiene la edad de 32 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Edgar tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de pollos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, Edgar dio inicio a este medio de vida por iniciativa propia y con el tiempo y dedicación a este negocio decide mantenerlo. Los propósitos de Edgar son de ofrecerles a sus clientes la mejor calidad de pollos, y a la mismo tiempo disfruta de conversar y atender a sus clientes. El financiamiento solicitado por Edgar es para la compra de mas pollos, concentrado, vacuna y vitaminas ya que ha demostrado la responsabilidad en todos sus pagos. El sueño de Edgar es incrementar cada día su producción y que su calidad de vida mejore, ya que siempre ha luchado para que su familia obtenga el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Edgar Vicente Téllez A. is single and 32 years old. He has two children who are in school. He sells chickens for a living. He has been working in this field for 3 years, which he started through his own initiative and with time and dedication he has decided to stick with it. Edgar's goals are to offer his customers the highest quality chickens, and at the same time to enjoy conversing with and serving his customers. The loan he is requesting is to purchase more chickens, feed, vaccines and vitamins. He has always been responsible with his payments. Edgar's dream is to increase his production every day, so that his quality of life improves, as he has always had to fight to feed his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
KARINA Z. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RUMBO AL EXITO” vive en la Urb. Municipal. Mz F. Lt.2., en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 23 años de edad y no tiene hijos.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de ropas, con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró ropas interiores y  las vendió a sus vecinos.

Actualmente ella continúa con la venta de ropas, además tiene un moto taxi que también le genera ingresos.  Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá  una parte del dinero en la compra de ropas para damas y caballeros, y también comprará repuestos para sus moto taxi.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar, o mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Karina Z. S. is a member of the community bank "Rumbo al exito" and she lives in the municipality of Mz F. Lt.2 in the city of Pucallpa. She is 23 years old and she has no children.

Her business is sellign clothing and with her first loan of S/.300 nuevos soles, she purchase underclothes and sold them to her neighbours.

She continues to run the same business and she also owns a motorcycle taxi that also earns her an income. This loan of S/.1200 nuevos soles will be invested in part in the purchase of ladies' and mens' clothing and she will also invest in repairs to her motorcycle.

Karina says, "Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) is an NGO that supports a vast number of families with small loans that permit women in the region to start or improve their businesses, and I am so happy with this support."


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase articles of clothing. To repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Latifatou

texts.fr: Latifatou S. est une jeune femme de  31 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse de tissus basins à Lomé. Latifatou exerce ce commerce depuis 5 ans. Avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, elle souhaite améliorer la capacité de son activité en approvisionnant son magasin de nouveaux produits. Ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Latifatou S. is a 31-year-old woman, young, married, and the mother of two. She is a retailer of damask fabrics in Lomé. She has been in this business for five years. With this FECECAV loan, she would like to improve her business capacity by stocking her store with new products. This will enable her to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics for resale

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
Gudelia es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida
Gudelia es casada, tiene 62 años y 4 hijos, Gudelia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Gudelia necesita un préstamo D. 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Gudelia son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gudelia is a member of the New Life communal bank group.

Gudelia is 62 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has a store in her home where she sells general merchandise. She works at her business every day.

Gudelia needs a loan of 1250 soles loan money to by rice and sugar. She dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Cruz Trancito

texts.es:
La señora Cruz es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, un grupo de mujeres que reside en la comunidad de Turi, aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Es un grupo de señoras que se llevan muy bien entre ellas; pasan sus reuniones riéndose y haciendo chistes. Si la risa es la mejor medicina, Mujer y Fortaleza es un grupo bien saludable. También hacen pequeñas fiestas y actividades entre ellas para ocasiones como el día de la madre, y son bien colaboradoras. Hasta toman turnos barriendo después de cada reunión en la casa de la socia donde se reúne el grupo cada 2 semanas. 
Cruz tiene 38 años, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos pequeños de 11, 7 y 4 años, el mayor estudia en el colegio Fray Vicente Solano en Cuenca, y el otro en la escuela Francisco Astudillo. Su esposo trabaja como albañil. No tienen casa propia viven en casa de sus padres, sus hijos pasan con sus abuelos ya que el horario de Cruz es todo el día, Ella se dedica a lavar ropa en la ciudad, a veces se hace tarde pero otros días llega temprano para dedicarse a sus hijos y animales.
Cruz tiene un hogar estable y lleno de felicidad, todo lo que trabajan se comparte para los gastos de la familia. Ella cría los animales en su casa y los vende los fines de semana en la Feria Libre, un mercado grande en la ciudad de Cuenca. Va al mercado cada dos o tres semanas, dependiendo de cuantos animales tiene para vender. En este momento tiene pocos animales, debido a que recientemente algunos pollos murieron de una enfermedad y algunos cuyes murieron por el frío. Ella dice que esto es la parte más difícil de su trabajo. Por más que pueda ser muy atenta e intentar cuidarles muy bien, a veces los animales mueren igual. Pero dice que le gusta el trabajo, y disfruta del pasar tiempo con sus hijos y sus animalitos en su casa de campo.  
Cruz Tránsito pidió 660 dólares para invertir  comprando pollos y criarlos para vender. Piensa construir una casa para su familia en este terreno, y también lo ocupará para sembrar algunos cultivos como maíz y lechugas. Su meta para el futuro es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Cruz is a member of the communal bank “Mujer y Fortaleza”, which is a group of women living in the community of Turi, located about half an hour outside the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. These ladies get along well with one another, spending their meeting time laughing and making jokes. If laughter is the best medicine, then “Mujer y Fortaleza” is a very healthy group. They get together to celebrate occasions such as Mother's Day, and they are good members. They even take turns sweeping the home of the group member who is hosting their regular meeting, which takes place every 2 weeks.

Sra. Cruz is 38 years old, married and the mother of three young children (ages 11, 7, and 4). The eldest is studying at Fray Vicente Solano School in Cuenca, and the middle child attends Francisco Astudillo School. Her husband works as a mason. They do not own a home, so they are living with her parents. Her children spend time with their grandparents since Sra. Cruz works all day. She spends most of her time in the city washing clothes, but on some days, she comes home early to be with her children and tend to the animals. Sra. Cruz has a stable home full of happiness. Everything that she works for goes toward the family expenses.

She raises animals at home and sells them on the weekends at La Feria Libre, a large open market in the city of Cuenca. She goes to market every 2 to 3 weeks, depending on how many animals she has available to sell. At the moment, she has few animals because some chickens recently died from an illness and some guinea pigs died from the cold. Cruz says this is the hardest part of her work. Even when you invest much time and care into the animals, they sometimes die all the same. Yet she enjoys her job, spending time with her children, and tending to the animals at home.

Sra. Cruz is requesting $660 to buy chickens to breed and sell. Her future goal is to own a home, so she is thinking about building a house for her family in this area. She would also like to plant crops, such as a corn and lettuce.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens to breed & sell

loans.name: Sandra Zenobia

texts.es:
La señora Sandra, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 44 años de edad, estado civil Soltera, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios superiores (Agropecuaria), vive en el Barrio Bellavista jr. Bellavista 255.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizó para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, los cuales los va a invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas, aceite, etc. Además implementar su cafetín escolar en el colegio Santa Rosa de Puno.

Su deseo es poder agrandar su tienda y ejercer su profesión.

A ella le gustan las reuniones ye que comparte con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the "Third of May II" Communal Bank, which is located in the Puno district of Puno province in the department of Puno. She is 44 years old and is a single mother of three children. She has completed superior studies in agriculture and she lives in the Bellavista Jr. neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the last six years. She received an initial loan of 300 new soles, and she used this money to purchase merchandise for her small grocery store. At this time she needs a loan of 1200 soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, canned food, oil, etc. In addition, she will use it to run the school cafeteria at the Santa Rosa de Puno high school. Her goal is to be able to expand her store and to exercise her profession. She enjoys the communal bank meetings, because she shares them with her companions.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her store

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Letecia Crescencio is 44 years old. She is a client of Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) and lives on a small island in Boholnamed Suba. She is a fisherman and has six children. Although her eldest daughter is already married, her other children are still in school.

She requested a loan of Php 18,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fishing materials and a new boat. She plans to use this second boat to earn money ferrying passengers to and from their small island.

She is enthusiastic about CEVI and likes their interest rate, which is 2% a month.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials and a new boat to provide ferrying services.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Blanca  pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco”  que esta ubicado en la comunidad de San Juan de Tahuaco del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, estado civil viuda y es madre de 02, y estudio educación primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de San Juan de Tahuaco.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años es una socia fundadora del Banco Comunal su préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado porcino y ovino. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, con este préstamo la señora va comprar ganado vacuno para engorde, ella solo vende su ganado los días de feria ósea los domingos.

Su mayor deseo es darles educación a sus hijos, luego poner una tienda de abarrotes en Yunguyo.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y conversar de todo con sus compañeras

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado vacuno

loans.name: Maria Teresita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Hermano Miguel se formó  hace ocho  años en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta es una ciudad muy hermosa y considerada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, ya que tiene muchos lugares hermosos y arquitectónicos para visitar, su gente es cordial y amable, éste banco comunal está conformada por 11 socias responsables,  alegres, colaboradoras y unidas, dispuestas a superarse en la vida  para bienestar propia y de su familia, en cada inicio de ciclo preparan un almuerzos para compartir un momento de amistad y alegría entre las socias.

La señora María Teresita  Y. Aviléz  es socia del banco comunal Hermano Miguel, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 51 años de edad, se encuentra felizmente casada, fruto de su amor concibió 8 hijos de 28, 26, 25, 24, 22, 20, 17, 14 años de edad, sus 3 primeros hijos se encuentran casados y viven independientemente con sus familias y sus 5 hijos estudian en el colegio Antonia Ávila, su esposo trabaja como conserje de una escuela, viviendo allí porque no tienen casa propia.

María trabaja como conserje junto a su esposo en una escuela contratada por los padres de familia por que aun no tiene el nombramiento,  lleva catorce años aunque solo está registrada como 13 años de que ha laborado, encontrándose un poco mal por que el sueldo es muy bajo.

Lleva ocho años trabajando junto a su  banco comunal, manteniendo una buena relación con todas las socias, además nos comenta que gracias  a los  préstamos a podido ayudarse para dar el  estudio a sus hijos.

El nuevo préstamo que realiza en la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR lo va ha invertir en los gastos del regreso a clases de sus hijos, nos comenta que ha trabajado para sus hijos toda su vida.

El sueño de María  es ver a sus hijos convertidos en  profesionales y también llegar a construirse su casa propia
texts.en:
The Hermano Miguel Community Bank was created eight years ago in the city of Cuenca. It is a very beautiful city and is considered a cultural heritage site because of its beautiful architecture. The people are cordial and friendly. The Community Bank has eleven members who are responsible, happy, collaborative, and united. They are aiming to succeed in life for their own well being and that of their family. At the beginning of every cycle, they have a lunch together, to share a moment of friendship and happiness. María Teresita Y. Aviléz is member of the Hermano Miguel Community Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, is 51 years old, and is happily married with 8 children, aged 28, 26, 25, 24, 22, 20, 17, and 14. Her first 3 children are married and live on their own with their families. The younger 5 children go to the Antonia Ávila School. Her husband works as the caretaker of a school, living there because they do not have their own house. María works with her husband at the school. The parents contract her because the school has not yet officially hired her. She has worked there 14 years but has only gotten credit for 13 years, and she is dissatisfied with the low pay. She has been working with the communal bank for 8 years, maintaining a good relationship with all the other members. Thanks to loans from the bank, she has been able to help her children to attend school. María will use this new loan from FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR for education expenses for the children. She has worked for her children all her life. María’s dreams are that her children become professional people, and to build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education expenses for her children

loans.name: Neri

texts.es: La señora Nery, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Angeles”, Distrito D. Picota, Provincia D. Picota, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años, 03 hijos y 02 que aun dependen D. ella. Nery, es una mujer trabajadora y con  muchas ganas D. seguir trabajando, ella se dedica a la venta D. hielo y chicha (Bebida, preparada a base D. maíz). Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta, es ella misma quien lo administra. Se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal.Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio,  es conocida en el barrio; ya que sus bebidas las venD. bien heladitas al gusto del cliente.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará insumos como: maíz en kilos, azúcar y como ingredientes, para dar un rico sabor canelas y clavo D. olor. Se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus bebidas

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
N. Agnes is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 32 years old and married with four children aged 3 to 14, all of whom are in school.

Agnes has been a farmer in Lwera, Nakisunga for ten years, selling her own produce. Her main challenge is the lack of enough capital to boost her business. She is able to make $45 a week in profit, and this helps to run her home and to pay her children’s school fees. Agnes’ friendly nature has won her customers, and she would like to expand her business further. Since she is now renting, she hopes to build a family house in the future on a plot that she and her husband bought.

She needs a loan to help boost her business. The last growing season was not favorable to her, so she needs to buy more produce to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna  es una socia dinámica y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 50 años, es madre de seis hijos y cuatro de ellos son mayores de edad. Ella se dedica al alquiler de moto taxis diariamente (tiene 3 motos).
También vende gaseosas y chupetes, su esposo es obrero y trabaja en un aserradero. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “María Montessori” desde hace tres años.  El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en repuestos para su motocar, ahora ella requiere de un crédito de 1000 soles que le permitirá comprar nuevos repuestos para sus tres vehículos, ya que necesitan mantenimiento. La meta de Reyna es tener su bodega bien implementada y crecer en sus finanzas.
texts.en:
Reyna, 50, is a dynamic, enterprising woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has six children, four of whom are adults. She rents mototaxis (she has 3 of them) by the day. She also sells soft-drinks and popsicles. Her husband is a laborer and works in a sawmill. She has been a member of the “María Montessori” communal bank for the past three years. The first, 300 sol loan, was used to get replacement parts for her verhicle. Now she needs 1000 soles to buy more replacement parts for her three vehicles because they need maintenance. Reyna's goal si to have a well-stocked store and to earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for her three mototaxis.

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married with three grown children. He owns a service station in the small town of Mikhailovka, Eastern Ukraine. His business is flourishing as there are many drivers who bring their vehicles to him for repairs and maintenance work. Yuryi has been in this business for over twelve years and his gross income is about 20,000 Grivnyas a month.

Yuryi is requesting a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to invest in his business development. All of his children actively help him with this business. This enterprise can be characterized as consistent and sustainable. We believe the current loan will benefit it and stimulate its further growth.

loans.use: To invest in his business development

loans.name: Fe Risalina

texts.en:
Fe Risalina S. is from the village of Labinay, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Fe Risalina is widowed and has one grown child. To make a living, Fe Risalina owns and operates a business venture raising crops in the agriculture sector. While it is not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Fe Risalina has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fe Risalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe Risalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Fe Risalina will take this loan out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business raising crops

loans.name: Milton Ernesto

texts.es: El Sr. Milton,  vive en la zona de Munayata de nuestra ciudad tiene el negocio ubicado en la misma zona. El negocio lo atiende junto a la esposa, tiene una pequeña hija, vive en casa de su abuela y solicito el credito para comprar una maquina espiedera, por que vio que su negocio esta creciendo el desea ofrecer a su clientela otra variedad de pollo, el señor tambien tiene una actividad de pintor, el generalmente trabaja bajo contrato y no asi con trabajos eventuales, a pesar de ser aún muy joven el Sr. Milton muestra ser una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Milton lives in the Munayata area of our city and he has a business located there also. His wife helps him with the business, he has a small daughter, and lives in his grandmother’s home. He is seeking the loan to buy a rotisserie because he has noted that his business is growing and he wishes to offer his customers another type of chicken. He also has a business as a painter, he generally works under contract and not with steady jobs. Although very young Milton has shown to be a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a rotisserie

loans.name: Dim

texts.en:
Dim Y. is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She makes and sells cakes in front of the local school to earn a living and is able to make approximately US$2.50 of profit a day. Her husband is a mechanic fixing bicycles and motorbikes. On average, he makes US$5 a day. This couple has four children, two of whom are in school and the other two are farmers.

Dim Y. would like a loan of US$700 to purchase rice. She will remove the husks with the intention of reselling the de-husked rice and turning a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice which she will de-husk and sell

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Somotillo el señor Juan A. se dedica desde ase mucho tiempo a la crianza de ganado con el propósito de obtener los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.
Es padre de tres hijos a los que tiene que mantener y por esto se esfuerza grandemente.  El crédito lo solicita para la compra de una vaquilla para su crianza para extráele la leche y comercializarla en su local.
texts.en:
In the Somotillo municipality Juan A. has reared cattle for a long time in order to earn income to support his household. He is the father of three children who he has to support and therefore he strives extremely hard. He is asking for a loan to buy a heifer to rear for milk that he can sell at his premises.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Sonu

texts.en:
Sonu L. lives with her husband, Chakra Bahadur L., and their three children. Her husband is a taxi driver in the Kathmandu valley. Her two daughters are studying in grades 10 and 4 and her son is in primary school.

Sonu opened her small business three years ago to strengthen the economic condition of her family. She sells different food items in her shop. In particular, she makes Nepali food such as DalBhat (rice). She also sells tea and coffee.

The demand for food is increasing in her area, so Sonu is requesting her Rs 20,000 loan to buy necessary ingredients for her shop.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao K., 41, is a widow and the mother of two children, both of whom are students and dependent on her income. She currently lives with her older mother who stays at home to do housework or assists her in the business. 

To earn their living, Mao K. always buys farming produce (beans and rice) in bulk from the farmers who bring their produce to sell directly to her house. Also, she stores them in her house for a while before selling, thus gaining profit. Mao K. is looking for assistance to increase the financial capital of her enterprise.

loans.use: To increase the financial capital of her enterprise

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Mrs. Saturnina L. is from the village of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old, married, and has two adult and two school-aged children. Saturnina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling home products. She has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In July 2009, Saturnina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 14,995 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional grocery stocks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for future emergencies.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks

loans.name: Monsurat

texts.en:
Monsurat is 47 years old, is married, and has five children. She sells baking items like flour, baking powder, etc., and rechargeable phone cards to make a living. She has been in this business for more than four years. She is determined to make sure that she meets the demands of her customers which she said will also lead to an increase in profit for her.

Monsurat is asking for a loan of NGN 100,000 to buy more baking items to sell as this will enable her to get a better discount and earn more profit. She expresses her love to all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more baking item to sell

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es casada, tiene 33 años, se dedica al comercio (Despensa)y a la cría de cerdos, su marido trabaja como vendedor ambulante; tienen 3 hijos menores quienes dependen económicamente de ellos, pues están en edad escolar.
Ella es muy emprendedora e independiente, habilitó su negocio propio hace 10 años para aumentar su ingreso y brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia, aunque cuenta con el apoyo de su marido, ella trata de resolver los inconvenientes que surgen en el ámbito de su trabajo.
Actualmente exixte una buena demanda de carne porcina por lo que quiere invertir en la compra de cerdo y alimento para los mismo para trabajar también con este rubro que tiene buena perspectiva.
Ademas necesita construir una buena porqueriza de manera a que no interfiera en las otras actividades que ella tiene y el de manera el trabajo solo se trate de dar comida a los animales, ella tiene mucho deseos de prograsar por ello quiere invertir en esta actividad.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old, married, manages a food pantry, and raises pigs. Her husband works as a traveling merchant. They have three young children who attend school and are financially dependent on them.

María is an enterprising and independent woman who started her own business ten years ago so that she could increase her income and provide her family with a better standard of living. She has the support of her husband and always tries to resolve any complications that arise in her field of work.

There is currently a good demand for pork, so María wants to buy pigs and feed for her animals. Working in this field gives her a good perspective. She also needs to build a solid pig sty so that the animals do not interfere with her other activities. This will enable her to work by herself when it comes time to feed the pigs. María wants to invest in this activity because she has a great desire to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs & animal feed

loans.name: Nyoka

texts.en:
Nyoka J. is 38 years old, married to an engineer, and has five children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling green vegetables, such as okra, dodo (leafy greens of the amaranth plant), etc., and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and dried fish to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business by stocking more dried fish and also build a shop.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes and dried fish to sell

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es: María Estela C. J. de 39 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijas de 20 y 14 años de edad, de las cuales únicamente la menor se dedica a estudiar, ya que la mayor le ayuda con el negocio a su madre. Juntas residen en Santiago de María, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. María posee una venta de ropa interior femenina, así mismo comercializa carteras en diferentes estilos, sus precios son muy accesibles, lo cual le beneficia mucho debido a que su puesto esta ubicado en el Mercado de Santiago de María en donde existen muchos otros puestos más, los cuales comercializan lo mismo e incluso otras prendas de vestir adicionales, por lo que María debe ofrecer mejores precios para obtener más clientes. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar ropa interior por docenas, de esta forma podrá obtener precios más bajos, así mismo surtir el negocio con blusas, zapatos y faldas, de manera que pueda ofrecer más ropa a sus clientes. María es una mujer muy esforzada la cual trabaja muy duro por sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
María Estela C. J. is 39 years old and lives with her two daughters, aged 20 and 14. Only the younger daughter is in school, since the older daughter helps her mother with her business. They live together in Santiago de María, which is located in the department of Usulután. María has a business selling women's lingerie, and she also sells purses of various styles. Her prices are very affordable, which is good for her business, since her stand is located in Santiago de María's market, where there are many other stalls offering the same items as well as other types of clothing, so María has to offer better prices to attract more customers. María is requesting a loan to buy lingerie items by the dozen, so that she can obtain lower prices, and also to stock her stand with blouses, shoes and skirts, so that she can offer more clothing to her customers. María is a very energetic woman who works very hard to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying lingerie, purses, blouses, skirts and shoes to sell

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Carolina C. C., es una joven de 32 años que habita en el Barrio Dennis Larios, es casada y su esposo labora como comerciante, con sus 2 hijos menores de edad habitan en una humilde morada puesto que son una familia de escasos recursos que se dedican a la agricultura de piña con más de 15 años  de experiencia.

Dentro de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado en su negocio ha sido la afectación de plagas, tanto así que les tiene maltratada los terrenos, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales que brinden un mantenimiento fitosanitario  y  mejore las cosechas  para brindar optimas condiciones económicas para toda la familia. En otras ocaciones Afodenic con apoyo de los fondos Kiva han podido apoyar a la familia y su mejoraría continua ha sido rápida por la buena administración de la señora, tiene la certeza que esta ayuda será aun mas productiva.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Carolina C. C. is 32 years old and lives in the Dennis Larios neighborhood. She is married and her husband works as a shopkeeper. They live in a humble home with their 2 young children (since they are a family of meager means), and they have 15 years' experience in the cultivation of pineapple. One of the main problems she is faced with in her business has been the effects of plant diseases that have battered the land. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan for the purchase of materials that will allow her to maintain her plants and improve her harvests, in order to obtain the best economic conditions for her family. On other occasions, AFODENIC has been able to help the C. family with the aid of Kiva funds, and their continuous improvement has been rapid because of the good administration of Mrs. C.. She is certain that this help will be even more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials that will aid plant cultivation

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Née en 1965, T. Marguerite vit depuis une quinzaine d’année au quartier Sèdégbé, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Marguerite a quatre enfants à sa charge, dont trois représentent ses propres enfants. Certains de ces enfants sont scolarisés. Marguerite est une veuve. Marguerite vit donc seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Marguerite a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différents besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Marguerite vend divers produits (conserves de tomate et de sardine, pâtes alimentaires, lait, savons, papier hygiénique, piles, etc.) ainsi que des condiments de sauce (piments, tomates, etc.) à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Marguerite achète ses produits. Marguerite exerce cette activité depuis seize ans environs et a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé. Marguerite a bien remboursé ledit crédit. Dans le but de renforcer un peu plus son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Marguerite sollicite un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1965, Marguerite T. has been living in the Sèdégbé neighborhood of the Abomey-Calavi commune for approximately fifteen years. She has four children in her care, three of which are her own children. Some of them are in school. Marguerite is a widow. She lives alone with her children and provides for their needs on her own. Marguerite’s formal education was minimal. To support herself and her children, she sells various products (e.g. canned tomatoes and sardines, pasta, milk, soap, toilet paper, batteries) and sauce condiments (peppers, tomatoes, etc.) from her home. She gets her stocks in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Marguerite has been in business for about sixteen years and has obtained one loan through Alidé in the past, which was repaid without problems. In order to strengthen her activities and better meet her customers’ needs, Marguerite is seeking a second loan.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk, canned sardines, pasta, soap, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Nancy Lucila

texts.es:
Nancy es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de años, Nancy y su esposo venden ropa variada, tiene 2 puestos en el mercado 12 de abril, uno es propio y el otro es alquilado, actividad que realiza desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días, además en algunas oportunidades viaja a las ferias donde también vende ropa. 
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de pantalones, polos.
Nancy sueña con tener una tienda estable y una casa propia.
texts.en:
Nancy is married and has got one child. Her and her husband sell various types of clothing. They have two stalls at the 12 de abril Market, one of which they own and the other is rented. They begin at 7 in the morning and work until 8 at night every day. In addition, on certain occasions, they travel to fairs where they also sell their clothing. Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank Despertar and is applying for a credit of 2000 soles, which she plans on investing in the purchase of pants and polo shirts. Nancy's dream is to have a stable store and her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pants and polo shirts.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita E. is from the village of New Dapitan, Rizal. She is 64 years old, married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital to purchase raw ingredients to make products to sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in hog raising. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Invest in hog raising.

location.town: Calamba-New Dapitan, Rizal, Zambo. Del Norte

loans.name: Bolinchuluun

texts.en: Bolinchuluun J. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Central province of Mongolia. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her youngest daughter attends secondary school. Bolinchuluun operates a retail vegetable business out of a rented stall at a local market in her town. She began her business in 1999 with working capital of 500,000 MNT. Now it has reached 2,800,000 MNT. She would like to begin a new retail business along with her current one. She works hard to provide for her three children and wants to be able to continue to pay their school fees so they can all get good educations and not have to struggle like she has. Bolinchuluun is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase other types of vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase other types of vegetables

loans.name: Bertha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Bertha Elizabeth G.  vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza natural, su centro histórico, la gran variedad de su gastronomía y también por ser la cuna de grandes deportistas.
 
Doña Bertha tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad que  estudia en la escuela de la ciudad, al momento se encuentra muy contenta ya que esta embarazada, tiene 4 meses de gestación, su esposo trabaja en un bar, la casa en la que vive no es de su propiedad por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Bertha es una mujer que realiza múltiples actividades ya que se dedica a la venta de productos YANBAL, lleva l3 años este negocio y nos comenta que le va bien vendiendo estos cosméticos, también se dedica a la venta de ropa en su tiempo libre, además se dedica al arreglo de casas y su horario es de lunes a viernes de 10 a.m. a 11 a.m., en la tarde se dedica a su hijo.
 
Es su sexto crédito que realiza en la fundación y  el nuevo crédito  lo va a invertir en la compra de productos Yambal, su gran sueño es tener un local propio para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Bertha Elizabeth G. lives in the downtown core of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its natural beauty, its historic heritage, the wide range of traditional foods and for being the birthplace of many great athletes. Bertha is 29 years old, she is married and she has an eight-year old son who attends school in the city. She is very happy to report that she is four months pregnant. Her husband works in a bar. The house they live in is not their own. They rent. Bertha is a business woman that carries out many different activities. She sells Yanbal brand products and she has been doing so for the past 13 years. She has found success in selling cosmetics. But she also sells clothing in her spare time, and she works in the private house cleaning industry. Her work schedule is from Monday to Friday from 10am to 11 am, and in the afternoons she takes care of her son. This is the sixth loan she has requested. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of more Yanbal brand products. Her dream is to have her own store from where to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase skin creams, perfumes, fashion jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sempeyo

texts.en:
Sempeyo has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last six years.  She is 28 years old and married to S. Ole Momera. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by her friend and she is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the cash to buy more animals, which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

Sempeyo plans to start selling hides and animal skin in the future.

loans.use: To buy more animals to sell

loans.name: Zorigt

texts.en: Zorigt K. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in a rented yard. His oldest son, 8, attends a local secondary school and his youngest daughter, 5, attends a local kindergarten. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home. Zorigt operates a taxi service in his local town. He began his taxi business in 2006 and has gained a lot of experience since then. In addition, he runs a car repair service center with help of his brother to supplement his family's income. He is a very modest and hardworking man and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to improve the car he uses as a taxi.

loans.use: To improve his car

loans.name: Duval Adolfo

texts.es:
Duval Adolfo C. C. tiene 24 años. Es soltero vive con los papas vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No  Tiene hijos. 
 
Duval pertenece a la Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría siembra maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta ventanilla tiene 13 miembros.

Duval trabaja en la agricultura siembra en ciclo corto el maíz,  arroz y fréjol  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de maiz arroz y frejol.Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar seguir cultivando para tener dinero y comprar un carro.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Duval Adolfo C. C. is 24 years of age.  He is single and lives with his parents.  He lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios. He does not have any children.  
 
Duval belongs to the Nueva Inspiración (New Inspiration) communal bank located in the Anchoveta precinct, which belongs to the Puerto Pechiche parish, Pueblo Viejo canton.  It is a group dedicated to farming crops with a short growing cycle, mainly corn, rice and 'gandul' beans (similar to black-eyed peas).  This group has 13 members..

Duval works in agriculture.  He sows in short growing cycles corn, rice and beans.  He buys seed in Guayaquil and sells his crops in the area surrounding his home and in the market of Ventanas. 

He requests the loan to buy seed for corn, rice and beans. The support of the loan will help him economically to supply his needs.  His dream is to  buy to continue cultivating crops and to have money to buy a car.  He likes to play sports.

loans.use: To buy seed for corn, rice and beans

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora A. H. Margarita tiene 49 años de edad y vive en una casa de propiedad de su madre vivienda que esta ubicada en un barrio de la ciudad de Tarija.  Margarita es soltera y no tiene hijos. Margarita se dedica a la actividad de la elaboracion de masas las cuales entrega en los diferentes establecimientos de la ciudad. Actividad que viene realizando desde hace mas de 20 años.                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Margarita nos dice que como se esta acercando la festividad de los difuntos tiene la necesidad de comprar harina, manteca, azucar, etc. Tambien comprar mercaderia para su tienda de barrio que ella tiene. De esa  forma mejorar sus ingresos para brindarles una mejor vida a su madre,  es por eso que el credito sera destinado para la compra de dichos insumos y mercaderia .                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Margarita nos cuenta que quiere darle a su madre toda la comodidad que pueda, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para mejorar las condiciones de su casa donde vive ella y su madre.
texts.en:
Margarita A. H. is 49 years old and lives in her mother’s house, located in a neighborhood of the city of Tarija. Margarita is single and does not have children. She works making pastries which she then distributes to the different establishments in the city, and has done so for more than 20 years.

Margarita tells us that as the Day of the Dead is approaching, she needs to buy flour, butter, sugar, etc. She also needs to buy merchandise for her neighborhood store so that she can improve her earnings and provide her mother with a better life. This is why the loan will be used for the purchase of the mentioned supplies and merchandise.

Margarita tells us that she wants to give her mother all the comfort that she can. This is why she says that the next loan that she requests will be for making improvements to the house where she and her mother live.

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
Martha  es una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo desde su juventud, con una hija quien ha criado sola, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de su ex compañero.
Su trabajo hoy en día, es de cajera en un almacén en donde lleva varios años laborando. Con sus ahorros y financiamiento hizo su casa en donde todos sus créditos lo ha invertido en la mejora de la casa. Como solo una hija tiene, y cursa la universidad. Alquila un cuarto en donde tiene una entrada fija. Logrando pagar gastos básicos.
Con este préstamo tiene como meta el comienzo de dos cuartos con el fin de poder alquilar dos más y lograr a futuro mejores entradas económicas, lo que comprara materiales de construcción para comenzar la obra al fondo del patio. Contenta una vez más por el apoyo económico de Afodenic.
texts.en:
Martha is a woman who has worked very hard since she was young.  She has a daughter who she has raised alone without any support from her ex-partner.

Martha currently works as a cashier in a store.  She has been working there for several years.  With her savings and financing she has built her own home.  All of her loans have been invested in improving her home.  She has only one daughter who is studying at university.  Martha rents out a room which has its own fixed entrance.  This way she manages to cover her basic expenses.

Martha's goal for this loan is to begin building two more rooms which she can rent out and thereby achieve better income in the future.  She will use her loan to buy building materials so that she can start the work at the end of her yard.  She is once again happy for the financial support provided by Afrodenic.

loans.use: To buy material such as stone, sand, cement and iron so she can begin building two rooms at the end of her yard to rent out

loans.name: Ibragim

texts.en:
