A. Ibragim is 47 years old and married. Together with his wife, they have six children who are still young and attending school. They are farmers who own a plot of land in their village to grow different kinds of crops like wheat, onion, rice and watermelon. They have been in this business since 2005. These crops are the main source of income for their family. To alleviate the hard physical labor and to expand the business, Ibragim would like to apply for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana A. is from the village of Commonwealth, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 61 years old. Juana is married. To make a living, Juana owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Juana is just starting this business.

In 2009, Juana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Juana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Juana is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will again be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Juana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Lluvia De Oro Group

texts.es: Banco de emprendimiento  que se encuentra en su 2do ciclo integrado por 8 integrantes los cuales todos viven en la zona de San José  La Presidenta la Sra. Paola vive en esta comunidad hace 4 años ella es empleada educadora   en Santa Cruz, su estado civil es soltera y cuenta con 1 hijo ella sola mantiene el hogar, es una señora muy amable y preocupada por el bienestar de su hija, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de electrodomésticos para su casa, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora,  todos los clientes se sienten muy agradecidos con la entidad financiera por  haberles otorgado el crédito y depositar su  confianza en ellos y abrirles las puertas cuando ellos mas lo necesitaban.
texts.en: This borrowing bank is in its second cycle, made up of 8 members who all live in the San Jose La Presidenta zone. Mrs. Paola has lived in this community for 4 years and is employed as a teacher in Santa Cruz. She is single and has one child. She maintains the household on her own. She is a very likeable woman who is very concerned for her daughter's well-being. She will use the money from this loan in the purchase of home electronics for her home. She is a very responsible and hard-working woman. All of the members are very grateful to the financial institution for having authorized this loan and put its confidence in them, opening doors when they most needed it.

loans.use: the purchase of home electronics

loans.name: Esthere

texts.en:
Esthere U. has been in the business of selling spare parts for eight years. She is 33 years old and is married with two children. Esthere works hard every day in order to expand her business. She works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Esthere has requested a loan in order to expand her business and purchase more spare parts to sell. She really hopes that her sales will increase as well as her profits. Esthere will keep reinvesting the profits in her business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a thirty-three year-old married woman, with six children.  She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.  She has been dealing in secondhand clothes for the last eight years.  She saved money from goat-rearing and started the clothes business. Her hardships include losses during the rainy season and high rent.   Rehema needs the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta B. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 29 years old. Loreta is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Loreta owns & operates a business buying and selling seafood products such as sardines & milk fish in the local community. Loreta has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Loreta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital.  

Loreta is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fish like sardines & salmon to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Loreta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria G. vive en la urbanización “Los Robles “ y desde allí se dedica a la elaboración de productos para decoración de fiestas, negocio que en  su condición de mujer  casada y madre de tres hijos en las edades de 6, 10 y 16 años,  le ha permitido responder a su obligación familiar mientras genera ingresos para el crecimiento y desarrollo de su familia; ella con su maquinaria elabora muchos productos , desde vestidos de fiestas como matrimonios, grados y quinceañeros, hasta adornos y detalles que impactan estos escenarios festivos, y llaman poderosamente la atención de los invitados a estos eventos.  Todo lo que Maria G. fabrica  depende de la solicitud de sus clientes y   están ligados generalmente a cada temporada, porque siempre está atenta a complacerlos, para que continúen comprándole y referenciándola a otros, así  ella  ensancha  su negocio y logrará en un futuro  llevar a sus hijos a alcanzar  sus objetivos educativos. Su sueño  es establecerse en el mercado para la cual está armando su carpeta promocional, porque  ella  planea  exhibir sus productos mediante una especie de catálogos  de ventas , que en futuro manejarán vendedores de sus productos, mientras ella produce. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y el primer credikiva con el que comprará Bomboneras, chocolates, telas y accesorios de decoracion pues está contratada para eventos festivos que requieren una decoración acorde a la temporada carnavalera que se avecina..
texts.en:
Maria G. lives in the Los Robles housing development and there, she works making party decorations. Being a married woman and the mother of three children (6, 10, and 16 years old), this business has allowed her to respond to her family obligation while earning income for her family’s growth and development.

She makes many items with her machinery from wedding, graduation, and 15th birthday dresses to decorations and small gifts that have an impact on these celebrations and attract the attention of the event attendees. Everything that Maria G. makes depends upon her customers’ requests and it is generally tied to each season because she concerns herself with pleasing her customers so they continue buying from her and referring other people to her. This is how she expands her business and will have her children meet their educational goals in the future.

Her dream is to establish herself in the market and she is currently preparing her promotional folder because she plans to present her products in a sales catalog. In the future, she will have sales representatives while she makes the items.

This is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva and she will use it to purchase candy boxes, chocolates, fabrics, and decoration accessories, as she has been hired for celebrations that need decorations for the approaching carnival season.

loans.use: Candy boxes, chocolates, fabrics, and decoration accessories

loans.name: Lourdes' Group

texts.en:
Lourdes U. is from the village of San Carlos, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Lourdes is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lourdes is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling peanuts in the community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lourdes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make peanut products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lourdes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make peanut products for sale

loans.name: Eider Abad

texts.es:
Desde hace 3 años Eider Abad se desempeña como profesional de la Belleza, el estudió en una academia de belleza del municipio, esta labor le ha permitido tener el sustento diario de él y su familia. 

Eider trabaja en la sala de su casa y su trabajo está siendo tan reconocido que ha decido montar su propia sala de belleza y así podrá generar nuevos ingresos además de poder atender a todos sus clientes, es por esto que al tener el crédito Eider tendrá lo necesario para dotar su centro de belleza.
texts.en:
Eider Abad has been working as a Beauty Professional for the last three years.  He trained at a municipal beauty academy.  This work is making it possible for him to support himself and his family.

He works in his living room and his work is being recognized to such a degree that he’s decided to set up his own beauty salon to earn new income and also be able to tend to all his customers.  This is why Eider will use the loan to provide all that’s needed to equip his beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace M. is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and to maintain her motorcycle for her tricycle business.

Mary Grace has been in this business for seven years, and she earns additional income from fish vending.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten members. Mrs. Hun, born in 1960, is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members. 

Mrs. Hun is a winter-melon seller in the market who is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to improve her business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more winter-melons for selling. Aside from her winter-melon business, She also earns by selling fish.

Mrs. Hun is widow with four children: one is a wedding beautician, one is a winter melon seller, and the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more winter-melons for selling.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice has been a farmer for 25 years in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is currently running his farm with the help of three farmhands and producing eggs, tea, sugarcane and vegetables. He is married with seven children aged between 15 and 5 years and all schooling. He earns additional income from his tailoring business in the local market.

 He has made a 30,000 KES loan request with Juhudi Kilimo to help him boost his poultry business by buying more birds. He is  focusing on improving his production capacity by threefold in five years and believes this will adequately cater for the family well-being. 

He notes that the Juhudi loan initiative was timely to uplift smallholder farmers, but adds that competition and poor markets for the produce are making returns minimal.

loans.use: To pay for more poultry in the farm.

loans.name: Serevina

texts.en:
Serevina is a dairy farmer from Litein town in the Rift Valley Kenya. She has been in the farming business for 20 years and sells her milk to Kokiche dairy plant in Litein town. She earns additional income from her poultry farm and her small-scale farming of tea. Serevina is 52 years old and is a widowed mother of 8 children, four of whom are currently attending school.

She has made her first loan request through Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kes to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children and to provide for their basic needs. Lack of enough land for expansion and poor weather conditions have been her greatest challenges. However, she plans to acquire two dairy cows and construct a zero grazing unit in the next 5 years. She further requests Juhudi to help in training farmers on dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is married and has two children.  She sells Fante kenkey, fermented corn dough wrapped in banana leaves, at Elmina. Augustina has a junior high education. Her husband is a driver. She  assists her husband in paying the household expenses and educating their children. Her loan will be used to buy maize in sacks to cook to sell. She hopes to use the profits from her business to save to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase maize to cook.

loans.name: Jose Filadelfo

texts.es: Jose trabajador, honesto, junto a su esposa tiene los planes de que sus hijos se profesionalicen. Tiene como proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. El préstamo será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, perlines, bloques, piedras cantera, camisa, piedrines, golosa, ladrillo, tablones, hierro, persiana entre otros materiales. agradeciendo a la institución por el apoyo al desarrollo del nivel vida, mejorando la comodidad, seguridad de su familia.
texts.en: Jose, who is a hard and honest worker, has plans with his wife to make sure their children become professionals.  He wants to improve his home's infrastructure and will use the loan to buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, profiles, blocks, quarry stones, liners, gravel, studs, bricks, planks, iron and blinds, among other things.  He is grateful to the institution for the support which will allow him to improve his lifestyle and ensure his family's comfort and safety.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 27 years old, married and a mother of four children. Rehema runs a posho mill for grinding maize into flour in Kilifi. Rehema’s business has been in operation for the last four years. 

Rehema is a KADET client, and this marks her third time borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase maize and diesel for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to maintain her family. Her dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase maize and diesel.

loans.name: María Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramad, vive por la comunidad de Nabon, esta comunidad es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad.

Doña María tiene 49 años, es casada y ha concebido 9 hijos, sus cinco primeros hijos son casados, dos de sus hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora María se dedica a la agricultura, sus productos los vende en su comunidad. También se dedica a la cría de borregos, cuyes, gallinas y ganado.
 
Nuestra socia se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas, abono y también para arreglar su casa.
 
Su sueño es tener un negocio propio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Bankito La Ramada. She lives by the community of Nabon. This community is of cold climate and its people are agriculturists and livestock farmers. Much of the population works in the city.

Maria is 49 years old, married, and she has conceived 9 children. Her eldest 5 children are married, two of her children are in high school, and her two youngest attend primary school in the neighborhood. Her husband works as a bricklayer and the house in which they live is their own property.

Maria is an agriculturist and she sells her products in the community. She also raises sheep, guinea pigs, poultry, and cattle.

Her dream is to have a business of her own, such as a store.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and to carry out maintenance repairs on her house.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a 21-year-old single lady, who is also a university student majoring nursery in her last year. Rawan has two hobbies; one is photography and the other is arranging decorative flowers.

Rawan decided to use one of her hobbies and turn it into a small business at home, with the help of her mother; she has a successful start making beautiful decoration plants.

Now Rawan is applying for a loan to buy more materials used in her business, hoping that she will be able to use natural flowers in the future and open her own flower store.

loans.use: To buy more materials used in making decoration items.

loans.name: Joederick

texts.en:
Joederick, who lives with his parents in the village, is now 24 years old and still single. Joederick wasn't able to finish his college education, the reason he finds it difficult to secure employment with a government organization.

Being a responsible son, he therefore began raising crops to generate income, planting and harvesting rice twice a year, usually selling his harvest to local traders in the village. Joederick earned about P30,000 from the last harvest in May, money he used to pay labor costs involved in preparing the farmland for the next planting season. He also pay credits and bills at home.

Joederick wants to improve crop production and achieve bountiful harvests every crop season. Due to insufficient capital, he is now requesting a loan of P12,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to ensure a good crop. In addition to aspiring to a bountiful harvest, Joederick also hopes to have his own family someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 37 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de once y siete años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz,arroz y fréjol compra de semillas, insumos, abonos y fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos fuera de las plagas. 

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio y poderse comprar una moto.
Le gusta bailar y compartir momentos agradables con su familia.
texts.en:
María Elena is 37 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children (ages 11 and 7) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

María is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

María is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, compost, farming supplies, and fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to increase her business so that she can buy a motorcycle.  

María Elena enjoys dancing and sharing pleasant moments with her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and supplies to maintain her crops in good condition

loans.name: Onemus

texts.en:
Onesmus has been operating a general shop for the last five years in Makueni town. He is 20 years old and single.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. He has paid the other loans well and in good time. He intends to use the loan amount to buy sugar, maize flour, and rice and also to bake bread.

In the future, Onesmus hopes to build a house before he gets married.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, and rice and also to bake bread

loans.name: Wilton Rafael

texts.es:
Wilton Rafael tiene 40 años de edad es csado tiene cinco hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de veintiuno, diecinueve, catorce, doce y dos años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 1º de mayo, se encuentra ubicada en la cdla 1º de mayo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos se dedican a labores comerciales.

Wilton se dedica a la siembra de banano.Los productos los compra en comercial kenedy y las vende en el Cantón Ventanas. Con el crédito le ayudaría a obtener ingresos líquidos para poder vivir mejor. El crédito lo solicita para comprar semillas insumos, abonos, urea, liquido para mantener en buenas condiciones los sembrios.

El sueño es  comprar terreno y sembrar más banano, ampliar el negocio y poderlo administrar sin ningún problema. Los desafios al que se enfrenta a diario es la competencia que se da entre comerciantes.

En los momentos libres le gusta ver televisión en es'ecial el futbol.
texts.en:
Willton is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children. He lives with his wife and his children, 21, 19, 14, 12, and 2 years old in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. 

The  V.R.C. 1 de Mayo is located in the district 1 de Mayo belonging to the Ventanas Canton in the Los Rios Province, a commercial district. Wilton grows bananas. He buys them in the commercial area of Kenedy and sells them in the Ventanas Canton. 

The loan will provide cash assets in order to live better. With this loan he will buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, and liquid to keep the crops in good condition. His dream is to buy land and to to grow more bananas and to expand the business and to manage without problems. The challenge that he faces every day is the competition between traders. In his spare time he likes to watch television, particularly soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, and liquid to keep the crops in good condition

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is 28 years old. He lives in Gandzakar village, in the Tavush area, with his wife, his child, his parents and his brother. 

After serving in the Armenian army he has joined in his family occupation: animal breeding and land cultivation. On their farm, Artak and his family breed cows, chickens, turkeys and piglets. They produce cheese and sell it to fellow villagers. Also they grow fruits and vegetables.
 
Simultaneously with farming, Artak and his brother run a fruits and vegetables trading business that they carry out from their car in neighboring villages and Ljevan city as well. They sell both their farm’s fruits and vegetables and purchased production. 

Artak needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy new pigs for his farm, fodder for his farm animals and a lot of various fruits and vegetables for his trading business.

loans.use: To buy pigs for his farm, fodder for his farm animals and a lot of various fruits and vegetables for his trading business.

loans.name: Abduorif

texts.ru: Абдуориф на протяжении 10 лет занимается скотоводством. Женат имеет одну дочь. Откорм крупного рогатого скота приносит доходу семье Абдуорифа. Но для откорма скота нужно много корма и травы. Цены с каждым днем меняются, дорожают. Поэтому Абдуориф хочет получить кредит на закупки 2 тонны корма для скота. Он надеется получить кредит и запастись кормом на зиму.
texts.en: Abduorif is married and has one daughter. He has made a living for the past ten years by breeding, fattening and selling large cattle. It's profitable, but prices are constantly changing and rising, hence Abduorif is asking for a loan in order to buy two tonnes of animal fodder. He's hoping to receive the loan and stock up enough feed to last the winter.

loans.use: To purchase animal fodder

loans.name: Eulilia

texts.en:
Eulilia is 60 years old. She is married and has three adult children. 

Eulilia has a variety store or so-called "sari-sari" store that sells food items, beverages, and daily-use products. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more stock for her "sari-sari" store, like canned goods, powdered milk, coffee, chocolate drink, bottled beverages, and daily-use products such as shampoo and toothpaste.

Eulilia joined as a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, powdered coffee, powdered milk, chocolate drink, bottled beverages, and other daily-use products like shampoo and toothpaste, all of which are intended for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth es secretaria en un periódico de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de un diplomado para secretarias, para así tratar de avanzar en su trabajo. Vive en casa de un familiar la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es soltera y sin hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que Elizabeth solicita que su préstamo sea fondeado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a secretary at a newspaper in the city of La Paz.  She needs the loan to pay for advanced secretarial coursework.  That is how she will try to advance in her work.

She lives in a family member’s house, which is located in the Miraflores area of the city of La Paz.  She is single, and she does not have children.

This is the second time that Elizabeth has requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for advanced secretarial coursework.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El socio tiene 60 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos,el socio sigue trabajando como profesor en la ciudad de Cusco,y tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de equipos de construccion . El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar repuestos para sus equipos de construccion.
     
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member is 60 years old, married, and has three children. He continues to work as a teacher in the city of Cusco. He also has a business that sells construction equipment. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy spare parts for the construction equipment.

The member is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the construction equipment that he sells.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cereales,menestras y verduras,el socio vende trigo,cebada,papa,maiz,tomates,zanahorias,cebollas,zapallo y lechugas,el socio trabaja independientemente llevando los productos a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de cereales,menestras y verduras.El socio solicita el creditoa para comprar verduras,cereales y menestras al por mayor.
texts.en: This member still sells grains, beans and vegetables.  He sells wheat, barley, potatoes, corn, tomatoes, carrots, onions, pumpkins, and lettuce.  He works independently, taking his products to the city of Puerto Maldonado.  Through this business he has been able to provide for his children.  He wants to expand his business selling grains, beans and vegetables.  He will use the loan to buy vegetables, grains and beans wholesale.

loans.use: purchase grains, beans and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Sope Abdou Sarr Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 23 novembre 2011. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce

Madame Aissatou (debout à gauche de la photo et habillée en robe violet et levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 41 ans. Elle est une mariée et mère d'un  enfant.

Elle développe une petit commerce de légumes. Son nouveau prêt de 50000 francs CFA lui permettra d'acheter des sacs carottes, de choux, des paniers de tomates fraîches qu'elle va revendre au niveau de son quartier.

A l'aide de ses bénéfices Aissatou va renforcer son capital, et subvenir aux différentes charges familiales telles que payer les factures d'électricité et d'eau.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on November 23, 2011. It is composed of 11 women living in the same area. Their main business activity is vending.
Mrs. Aissatou (standing on the left in the photo wearing a violet dress and raising her hand) is the group’s leader. She is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of one child.

Her business is selling vegetables. Her new loan of 50,000 West African francs will allow her to buy some bags of carrots and cabbage as well as baskets of fresh tomatoes, for resale in her neighborhood. Thanks to her income, Aissatou will bolster her capital and  take care of  various family  expenses, such as bills for electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage and carrots for resale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has five children. Her husband is a fisherman. Ekua assists her husband to take of the home and she also cooks a variety of food to sell at Ankwanda near Elmina. She also sells cassava and plantain. 

Ekua is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for the food she cooks and sells and also to buy produce to sell. She hopes to use the profits from her business to save toward building a restaurant one day.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and food items to sell

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune, célibataire qui tient une boutique alimentaire dans son quartier. Il vit avec ses frères et sœurs, ses deux parents étant tous décédés. Il n'a jamais connu sa maman, décédée alors qu'il n'avait que trois ans.Il exerce cette activité depuis quatre ans et parvient à générer des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 150000f afin d'acheter 20 litres d'huile, 50kg de sucre, 5 caisses de boisson et d'autres marchandises diverses.Son ambition est d'élargir son commerce.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young unmarried man who has a grocery store in his area. His parents having died, he lives with his brothers and sisters. He never knew his mom, who died when he was only three years old. 

For four years, he has operated his business and manages to generate the revenues enabling him to support himself and to cover the cost of caring for the family. 

To increase his business capital, he is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy 20 liters of oil, 50 kg of sugar, 5 cases of beverages, and various other merchandise. His ambition is to expand his commerce.

loans.use: to buy 20 liters of oil, 50 kg of sugar, 5 cases of beverages, and various other merchandise

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a 34-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from five to thirteen years.

Josphine runs a stall in a busy residential area from which she sells water (previously she was selling sweets). She has been involved in this business for five years and describes herself as customer-friendly. A lack of enough water storage facilities is her biggest business challenge.

Josphine will use a 20,000 KES loan from SMEP to buy more water storage containers. Her goal is to own a lorry within five years to aid in water delivery.

loans.use: to buy water storage containers.

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Sorbeh” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000 SLL each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Gbassay is the leader of this group. Gbassay is a thirty-year-old. She is married to a driver and the couple has one child who is attending secondary school.  Gbassay sells “Bamako clothes” (popular and expensive clothes produced in Mali), lace clothes, portmanteaus, dishes, etc. With the help of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Start another business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her milk selling business.

loans.name: Olga Guadalupe

texts.en:
Olga is a young lady with a desire to excel. She lives in the town of San Nicolas de los Garza in the state of Nuevo Leon. Because she lacked the resources necessary to continue her studies, she found it necessary to obtain a job to bring in extra income. She decided to open her own business selling shoes so that she could work without neglecting her studies, and little by little, her business has grown, to the point that she is receiving a large number of orders.

Olgas is asking for a $250 loan which she will use to purchase merchandise that has been ordered by her clients. She is offering to repay the loan in 3 to 6 months. You can be an important part of Olga’s dreams. She needs your help and sincerely thanks you for your collaboration.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es una joven con grandes deseos de superación, vive en la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza en el estado de Nuevo León, ella no contaba con los recursos necesarios para continuar en la escuela, así que era muy necesario conseguir un trabajo para obtener un ingreso extra, y para no descuidar sus estudios decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de calzado, poco a poco sus clientes se han incrementado y ahora surte un gran número de pedidos.

En estos momentos, Olga necesita de un crédito por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía de esta temporada que ya ha sido pedida por sus clientes, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser una parte importante en los sueños de Olga, ella necesita de tu ayuda, y agradece sinceramente tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Khin

texts.en:
Khin was married in 1969 and has 2 children, 1 son and 1 daughter. He started a romork (a motor taxi with a carriage at the back) transportation business more than 22 years ago. His wife, Mrs. Am Morn, sells groceries at home. Their 2 children are working in a hotel in Phnom Penh. 
The couple is asking for a loan of US$600 from MAXIMA in order to repair their house and purchase more grocery items for sale. Their business is able to make enough money to support the family - therefore, they will be able to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: House repair and purchase of more grocery items for sale

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru:
Farida N. is divorced with three children. Though she has a higher education and works as an instructor at a secondary school, she also has been selling eggs for over 14 years. Since she is raising her children alone, it has not been an easy life for her. She started her business in order to improve her family’s standard of living and pay for her children’s education. She received her first loan of $70 in 2004. After receiving several loans and using them successfully, she increased sales turnover, started selling eggs to small cafes and food courts. In the future, she is planning to acquire another point of sale. The picture is of her sister.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Норматова Фарида разведенная, мать троих детей. Хотя у нее образование высшее и она работает учительницей в средней школе, она занимается также торговлей яиц вот уже 14лет. Из-за нелегкой жизни, поскольку она одна содержала семью Фарида начала заниматься этой деятельностью, чтобы улучшить уровень жизни и дать образование своим детям. Первый займ в размере 70$, она получила в 2004году. После неоднократного получения займа и целевого использования она расширила место своей деятельности, увеличила товар, стал раздавать товар в маленькие торговые точки и кафе. В будущем планирует приобрести еще одну торговую точку товар. На фото её сестра.

loans.use: To open another point of sale

loans.name: Nyoman Gabris

texts.id:
Nyoman Gabris, although living with her child and in law, does not want to depend on them. Her husband passed away in 1995. She started this vegetable sales business with her husband. She continues to do this business. This shows her will of not depending on their 2 married children, although she is 52 years old. Every day she prepared the vegetables that she brought to the Baturiti traditional market. Every week she could earn about Rp200,000.00 (US$22). Per day she spent about Rp20,000.00 (about $2.20), and she could save some. The loan helps her to offer more vegetables. With a loan on hand she could tactically prospects her vegetable sales, since in the market she is not the only one who sells vegetables.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Nyoman Gabris walaupun tinggal bersama anak dan menantunya, tidak ingin menggantungkan kehidupannya kepada mereka. Suaminya meninggal pada tahun 1995 yang lalu. Usaha jual sayur ini ditekuninya bersama suaminya. Sampai sekarang dia masih meneruskan usaha ini. Hal ini menunjukkan semangatnya yang tidak ingin bergantung kepada kedua anaknya yang sudah menikah walaupun sudah berumur 52 tahun. Setiap harinya dia menyiapkan sayuran yang dibawanya ke pasar tradisional Baturiti. Setiap minggu penghasilan yang dia peroleh mencapai Rp 200.000,00. Dengan biaya hidup per harinya yang Rp 20.000,00, dia masih bisa menyisihkan sebagian untuk ditabung. Pinjaman yang dia peroleh membantunya untuk menyediakan lebih banyak sayuran untuk dijual. Dengan modal yang ada di tangan dia berusaha mensiasati prospek penjualan sayurnya, karena di pasar bukan hanya dia yang menjual sayur.

loans.use:
To buy vegetables for resell

Membeli sayuran yang akan dijual.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business and construct a cement floor in her house

loans.name: Ni Putu Budiasih

texts.id:
As a housewife, Ni Putu Budiasih has a dual roles, to taking care of the children and family and also to do the other household chores. In addition to that, she has to assist the family by earning additional income to supplement her husband income who works as a truck driver.

Ni Putu Budiasih has been doing the pig farming for the last 5 years, and this helps her family's economy. She can earn IDR 500,000/ month (approx of US$ 53) from the selling of her 4 pigs. With the loan money of IDR 4 million (approx of US$ 450), she bought more piglets and pig foods. At the moment she has 8 piglets.

She wants to see this business growing so she can earn more money for the family and to finance the education of her children, Kadek Dedy and Komang Ary who are in High School and Primary School, respectively.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sebagai seorang ibu rumah tangga ,Ni Putu Budiasih memiliki peranan ganda yakni mengurus anak-anak dan mengerjakan semua pekerjaan rumah tangga lainnya.Disamping itu ,Istri dari I wayan Wirta ini juga ikut mencari nafkah untuk menambah penghasilan suaminya yang bekerja sebagai sopir truk . Pekerjaan yang di lakukan Ni Putu Budiasih adalah memelihara ternak babi. Usaha ini telah ditekuni sejak 5 tahun lalu dan telah banyak membantu perekonomian keluarganya.bahkan hasil yang didapatpun tak kalah dengan pendapatan suaminya. Penghasilan Ni Putu Budiasih dari hasil penjualan 4 ekor ternak babinya dalam sebulan mencapai sebesar Rp 500.000 .Apalagi saat ini telah mendapat tambahan modal dari Dinari Sebesar Rp 4.000.000,- yang di pergunakan untuk membeli tambahan bibit baru lagi serta sisanya untuk membeli pakan . Saat ini ada 8 ekor ternak babi yang di pelihara oleh Ni Putu Budiasih dalam dua lokal kandang yang dimiliki. Ni putu Budiasih ingin menjadi wanita yang sukses baik dalam menjalankan usaha maupun dalam menunjang biaya pendidikan dua orang anaknya yaitu Kadek Dedy dan Komang Ary yang kini masing –masing telah duduk di bangku SMA dan SD. Untuk itu Ni putu Budiasih sangat tekun menjalankan usahanya dan tanpa melupakan pekerjaan pokoknya sebagai Ibu rumah tangga .

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig foods (Membeli bibit babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en:
I. Shukufa, 46, resides in the village of Mammedabad, which is in the southeastern Saatli region of Azerbaijan. Along with her husband (who is pictured), she has bred cows for 15 years.

I. wants to grow her business in order to support her three children. She hopes to obtain a $1,000 loan to purchase more cows to breed and raise. She then sells them to farmers or butcher shops; most farmers in Azerbaijan own at least one or two cows, and beef is major part of the Azerbaijan diet.

loans.use: To purchase more cows

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy T. is 27 years old with no children. She is a trader who sells clothing materials and slippers around Abura market in Cape Coast. She is requesting $525 to buy slippers and additional clothing materials so she can expand her client base. Lucy is also a member of a lending group called “Faith Group”, which consists of eleven members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: Lucy would like to buy slippers and additional clothing materials so she can expand her client base.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is 27 years old and lives with his family in the Bekaa Valley. Maher is in the construction business, and is applying for his second loan from Al Majmoua. He will use the proceeds to buy the supplies he needs to run his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a small construction business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Mrs. Veronica M. lives in the neighborhood “22nd of January". She is 24 years old, married, and has no children. Her husband works as a cashier and provides for their daily expenses. She has been a teacher of primary school for the past 5 years. She is requesting a loan in order to build a new room in her home. In the future she would like to keep on studying so that she can become a professional worker and that way improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Verónica habita en el barrio 22 de enero es casada con 24 años de edad, no tiene aun hijos y su esposo es cajero. Quien aporta a los gastos de su hogar Ella es docente de primaria tiene cinco años de impartir clases. Con el préstamo que le van a prestar lo quiere invertir en la construcción de un cuarto, a futuro quiere seguir estudiando para ser una profesional y así mejorar su status de vida para su familia.

loans.use: To improve her house.

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en: Mrs. Samorn N. is a subsistence farmer. In addition to this activity, she owns a grocery store in Peam Khlai Village in Kampong Speu Province. Although Mrs. Samorn N. has two business activities, her family's situation has not improved. So Mrs. Samorn N. asked for a loan to buy cows for breeding as well as to plow her rice field. Mrs. Samorn N. is the mother of four children, three of whom are studying in state school, while the youngest child stays at home. Her husband, Mr. Oeurng Bu, is a tractor driver. Previously, Mrs. Samorn N. obtained a loan to buy a big pot to produce a white wine to sell to a middleman and the villagers. Last year, Mrs. Samorn N.’s youngest child got a lung disease and she spent $75 to cure that disease. Her husband is also pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy cows for breeding and to plow her rice field

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Mrs. Julia lives in a well-known neighborhood in the city of Luque and dedicates herself to making collared shirts for men, jeans for children age 5 and up, she creates her works in a small family workshop that she has in her home, where her mother helps her make the clothes. She has customers in the center of the city, the loan she solicits is for the purchase of a sewing machine which will serve her sharpen her work, help her production and better the income of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Julia vive en un Barrio muy conocido de la ciudad de Luque se dedica a la confección de remeras con cuello para hombres, jeans para criaturas hace 5 años, sus trabajos los realiza en un pequeño taller familiar de confección que posee en su domicilio, donde cuenta con la ayuda de su madre en la realización de las prendas.

Posee clientela en el centro de la ciudad, el préstamo que solicita es para la compra de una máquina de coser la cual le servirá para agilizar su trabajo, aumentar su producción y por ende mejorar sus ingresos familiares.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Amina's Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Amina is 36 years old. She is married, and has 5 children between the ages of 15 and 25. Amina sells juices, fish, and bread. She began her business in 2004, and begins work everyday at 6 AM and ends at 6 PM. She earns a monthly profit of around $35 from her sales.

In the past, Amina has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania. She has used the money to expand her business, and purchase more items for her inventory. In addition, she will also share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with charcoal, clothes, and batik making.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her stock

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en: Oluwakemi A. sells wine and drinks in her community. She is a LAPO client. Oluwakemi is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Ogun State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. She loves her business and she desires to see it expand. She is requesting the loan amount of US$ 1200 to buy more wine and drinks. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more wine and drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Djénébou

texts.fr:
Madame Djénébou T. est âgée de 33 ans et vit avec ses 5 enfants et son mari dans une famille monogame au troisième quartier de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali.)
Elle se consacra très rapidement aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment le commerce des articles de fête (tel les boucles d’oreilles). En plus elle vend aussi des trousseaux de clés, des habits et des chaussures. Elle a son étale sis au marché journalier du château de Ségou (situé au centre ville sur l’artère principale reliant Bamako au Burkina).
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de ses activités elle décida de collaborer avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir bouclé 4 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) tous correctement remboursés avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 8 paquets de boucles d’oreilles (autrement appelés garanties en provenance de Doubaï) et 300 paires de chaussures auprès des grossistes spécialisés dans le domaine des articles de femmes à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) Disposées sur une table, les marchandises de Madame Djénébou sont vendues généralement au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA. et ambitionne de se construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djénébou T. ís 33 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a monogamous family in the third district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She quickly dedicated herself to profitable activities, in particular the sale of party items such as earrings. She also sells key chains, clothing and shoes. She has set up a stall at Ségou’s daily Château market (located in the center of town on the main road linking Bamako to Burkina). Wishing to expand her business, she decided to work with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago now. Having successfully repaid four group loans (solidarity loans) with an association from her district, she is now on her second individual loan. She plans to use this loan to buy 8 packets of earrings (labeled as being guaranteed to come from Dubai) and 300 pairs of shoes from wholesalers who specialize in women’s items in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). Mrs. Dejénébou’s merchandise is laid out on a table and generally sold for cash to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make a monthly profit of CFA 40,000 and her ambition is to build a home for herself.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy earrings and shoes

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, de 46 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos maravillosos y súper cariñosos, junto a su esposa Gloria, quién siempre lo apoya en todo, tienen la finalidad de educar, amar y apoyar a sus hijos en lo bueno y lo malo. William implementó un negocio de venta de abarrotes, hace varios años atrás, y su objetivo diario es de dar una buena atención a sus clientes, la fidelidad es estos, hacen que él siga adelante con todos sus propósitos. Desde siempre, William ha aspirado con ser mayoritario en la venta de abarrotes, sin embargo, para la realización de eso, necesita de un capital, el cual lo invertirá en estos gastos. Apoyemos a este padre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
William is 46 years old, father of 3 marvelous and super loving children. Together with his wife Gloria, who always supports him in everything, they strive to educate, love and support their children through the best and the worst. William started his business selling general goods several years ago. His daily goal is to provide the best attention to his clients, whose loyalty he relies on to help him accomplish all of his goals. As always, William aspires to be the best in general store sales. Nevertheless, to achieve this, he needs a loan that he will invest in supplies. We support this strong and dedicated father who continues to work very hard.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increas quantity of products in his general store so that he can provide the best  service.

loans.name: Naseem Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is a wife of N. A. and lives in Pakpattan, Pakistan. She owes a two-room, brick house and has been living in it for the past 10 years. She is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. Her elder son works as a delivery man delivering items to customers. Her younger son is in 3rd standard. Her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Naseem baji’s husband has a vegetable-selling business. He buys vegetables and wheat from the wholesaler and sells it to different shops. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. Naseem baji helps her husband in the packing of vegetables and wheat in sacks. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s business. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Razia parveen baji requests a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Abida baji requests a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable-selling business. Bilquis baji requests a loan to buy spices to pack in small bags and to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and wheat for reselling

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is Daniel D. T., age fifty-five. Daniel was born in Magburaka town, Tonkolili District, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and the two have eight children. Six of his children are currently living on their own and two are in secondary school. Daniel sells a number of items, including palm oil, rice, soft drinks, cigarettes, soaps, toothpaste, sardines, Peak brand powdered milk and more. This will be his very first loan from SMT. He is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to help him strengthen his business.

With this loan, Daniel will strengthen his business by buying a refrigerator and a generator. With these machines, Daniel will be able to sell cold drinks. He will buy the machines from neighboring Makeni (30 miles round trip). The refrigerator will cost him Le 1,200,000 and the generator will cost him Le 800,000.

Business had been moving at a slow pace for Daniel, but he is quite sure that with this loan business will start running faster for him.  Sales will increase with the introduction of the new items in his shop. Needless to say, when sales increase and Daniel generates more income, he will feel good and become a happy man.

loans.use: buying a refrigerator and generator to chill his beverages

loans.name: Primo A.

texts.es:
Primo trabaja de chofer asalariado de servicio publico, la esposa es comerciante de golosinas y masitas en la puerta de un colegio; tienen dos hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad, comparten una casa con su hermano. La casa fue un regalo de sus padres y está ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción para hacer la división de la casa, pues vivir en un solo patio con su hermano le ocasiona diferencias familiares. De esta forma podrá vivir tranquilo con su familia.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Primo works as a salaried public transit driver, and his wife sells sweets and "masitas" at the entrance to a college. They have two children 10 and 6 years old, and share a house with his brother. The house was a gift from their parents and is located in the Pasankeri neighborhood of the city of La Paz. This loan is destined to buy construction materials to split the house, because to live in a single common area with his brother causes family problems. In this way he will be able to live peacefully with his family. This is his first loan through Impro, his completed evaluation qualifies him for the amount he has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bricks and cement to put up a dividing wall in his house.

loans.name: In

texts.en: T., 37, sells a little Khmer cake out of her home. She can make around US$ 4 each day to help feed her small family. She is married to Heang, 46, and he makes a living raising sows to sell their piglets. He normally earns around US$ 4 per day at this work and has been running this business since 1990. The couple lives in Pursat Province with their two children; both of them are daughters and are going to school. T. is requesting a loan as capital for her husband to run another business as a bicycle repairer and to buy more sows to raise.

loans.use: To run another business as a bicycle repairer

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.en:
Olivia del Carmen Rodríguez is 45 years old, married, and has three daughters. All her daughters are students. Her goal is to give her customers the best service. Her business is the rental of small battery cars and the sale of foundation garments, which she does during week-ends. She has had this business for over four years to supplement her income. Her dreams are to obtain a suitable location to better serve her deserving customers. The purpose of the loan is to obtain working capital so that she can buy batteries for the cars, in addition to the purchase of merchandise such as shirts, socks, undershirts and camisoles. The amount requested is C$9,600 for 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde que tenía 20 años ha luchado por forjarse una buena vida y hoy a sus 54 años todavía lo sigue haciendo, vive en una casa alquilada, junto a su familia y lo que más quiere es tener una vejez tranquila. Florentina tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas en una pequeña escuela de la ciudad de Juliaca, vende dulces, chocolates, galletas, etc, a todos los niños que en el recreo concurren a su puesto, ella los atiende con mucha paciencia y cariño, ya que lo que más le gusta es ver su rostro de felicidad cuando compran la golosina que más les gusta.
Son ya 5 años lo que Florentina lleva en este negocio y se siente muy feliz realizándolo, aunque sufre mucho cada vez que llueve y tiene que apresurarse a guardar sus cosas, anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus golosinas y otros productos para mejorar sus ingresos, con los cuales pueda tener una vida digna. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y desea hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa, siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más golosinas y el arreglo de su puesto para atender mejor a los niños de la escuela.
texts.en:
Florentina is a very hardworking woman. For the past 20 years, she has succeeded in forging a good life and today, at the age of 54, she is still doing so. She lives in a rented house with her family, and what she wants most is to have a quiet old age. Florentina has a business selling sweets at a small school in the city of Juliaca. She sells candy, chocolate, cookies, etc. to all the children that congregate around her store during recess. She attends to them with much patience and care. What she enjoys most is seeing their happy faces when they buy their favorite confection. Florentina has been in this business for five years and is very happy doing it, though she suffers quite a bit every time it rains and she has to hurry to guard her things. She hopes to have a store where she can sell her sweets and other products to increase her wages and thus have a worthy life. This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she must make all her payments on time and wants to do so. She is a very active participant in her communal bank, and is always aware of the agreements reached in their meetings. She will use the loan to buy more sweets and repair her post in order to better serve the schoolchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Alakanben (Que Dieu  Nous Unissent) Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Alakanben sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes du groupe se situe autour de 47 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Les membres du groupe Alakanben vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Konda préfecture de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali.) 
Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles excellent dans l’activité de transformation et de vente de sounbala. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Alakanben a  eu une solution à ses problèmes en intégrant  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) le prêt  précédent à été correctement remboursé.
 Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de noix de néré à Sikasso pour les transformer en sounbala (un condiment très apprécié au Mali). Le sounbala ainsi fabriqué  est vendu au comptant en gros à Mopti. (la cinquième région de la république du Mali) 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice  de 65 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant l’importation de poissons de Mopti.
texts.en:
The eight women of the group Alakanben ("May God Unite Us") are all married, and they average about 47 years of age and 5 children. They live in large traditional extended families in the village of Konda in San prefecture (Ségou region, Republic of Mali) and know one another through ties of community and kinship. They excel in the business of making and selling soubala and are in high demand in their field.

To satisfy the needs of their ever-growing number of customers, the group members found that the answer to their problems was to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are now on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan was correctly repaid.

With this loan, the group members plan to buy sacks of néré nuts in Sikasso in order to process them into soubala (a highly appreciated condiment in Mali). The soubala produced in this way is sold wholesale in cash transaction in Mopti (fifth region of Mali).

The group members each hope to realize a profit of 65,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to make loan interest payments, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in business. Their ambition is to diversify their commerce by embarking on the importing of Mopti fish.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy néré nuts

loans.name: Wendy

texts.en:
Mrs. Wendy C., a 21-year-old resident of Maquilao, Tangub City, is a new member of the PDP-LP Program of PMPC- Tangub City. Newly married to a man working as a driver and fisherman and without dependents, Wendy joined this program to enjoy the benefits offered by our co-op and to start a livelihood in partnership with her parents-in-law.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to purchase fishing equipment such as nets and lights. She is hoping that someday they can build a house, own a fishing boat, have children and be totally independent. She believes that KIVA and PAGLAUM will make all of these dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchasing fishing equipment.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia S. es una señora que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos, uno de ellos se sentía mal y lo llevo al lugar donde ella tiene las atenciones necesarias que se le dan ala familia. Pero con el medicamento que le están dando no ha tenido mejoría y quiere llevarlo a un particular. La señora desesperada acude a nosotros en pedir un préstamo a menor plazo para llevarlo con un pediatra uno de los mejores doctores de la ciudad para que revise a su hijo y le de los medicamentos que le quiten ese malestar
texts.en:
Julia S. is a woman who worries about the well-being of her children. One of them was feeling badly, and she took him to the place where he could get the necessary attention. But with the medication they are giving him, he has not improved and she wants to take him to a specialty clinic. She is desperate and is turning to us to ask for a short-term loan so she can take him to a better pediatrician in the city so he/she can take care of her son and give him the proper medication to cure him of his illness.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a specialist doctor for her son.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is single and lives in the Espartillar district of Carapeguá. He is 33 years old and started working as a street vendor in Pilar five years ago. He buys and sells, bimonthly.

He says he has many clients in the area who bring him good products that are accepted by many people.

Edgar applied for a loan with Fundacion Paraguaya to buy seasonal clothes to sell.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Edelio

texts.en: Mr. Edelio B. is from the city of Carapeguá and lives with Mrs. Maria, with whom he has a son.  He is a veterinarian and has been self-employed for more than 15 years. In the rural areas, he carries out vaccinations of animals and has many clients, so he travels for his job. The credit applied for will be used for the purchase of veterinary medicines.

loans.use: To purchase vaccines for animals

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Libertad”  se encuentra en el Centro Focal “Los Andes”, con 14 integrantes, una de las integrantes es Teresa M., que llegó al grupo cuando ya estaba conformado a invitación de una miga  y le agradó mucho la garantía solidaria y los temas de capacitación que imparten, como la mora y el sobreendeudamiento porque les hace reflexionar.
Las integrantes de  “Libertad” tienen diferentes negocios tales como la venta de ropa, guitarras, videos, regalos, cosméticos, tienda de barrio, comida, golosinas y carpintería. Todas aseguran que necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y poder ofertar a sus clientes productos variados.
texts.en:
The “Libertad” group, located in the “Los Andes” center, is comprised of 14 members. One of the group members, Teresa M., joined the already-established group when a friend invited her. She liked the group’s surety bond, and the training topics they give, such as loan defaults and debt overhang, because they make them think.

The members of the “Libertad” group own different businesses, such as clothing sales, guitar sales, gift sales, cosmetics sales, general store, food sales, candy store, and carpentry. They all assert that they need this loan so that they can purchase merchandise and offer their customers a wide variety of products.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa G. is from the town of Roxas. She is 47 years old. Elsa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (about $146 US) a month from these activities.

In 2007, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 pesos from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Elsa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For inventory & working capital

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 28-year-old mother of two who has run a small business selling charcoal for the past year. She has requested her first loan of Ksh. 25,000 in order to purchase additional bags of charcoal to sell. She would like to continue to expand her business, one day becoming a charcoal wholesaler. Janet’s hopes for the future include not having to worry about money, sending her children to school, and purchasing a plot of land on which to build a home.





Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to more than 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Darlita

texts.en:
Darlita Q. is from the village of Taguanao, Cagayan de  Oro City. She is 54, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Darlita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Darlita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Darlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darlita repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI, which she used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Darlita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Taguanao, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta G. is from the village of Alangilan in Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Roberta is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Roberta sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Roberta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Roberta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roberta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Roberta is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Roberta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  Las Caleras está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca al sur del Ecuador, ésta es una ciudad muy hermosa,  tiene muchos lugares turísticos, sus iglesias y su centro histórico, sus ríos, por lo cual  es considerada como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable y educada.

La señora María Margarita O. I.  es una de las doce socias  del Banco Comunal Las Caleras, son señoras muy alegres y dispuestas a salir adelante con sus familias, ella vive vía al Tejar en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 52 años de edad y se encuentra felizmente casada, procreó tres  hijos de 29, 28, 22 años de edad, los dos  primeros son casados y viven en sus casas,  su última hija es madre soltera, estudia Turismo en la Universidad de Cuenca,  su esposo trabaja como taxista. Su vivienda es propia fruto del esfuerzo de su trabajo conyugal.

María trabaja vendiendo cosméticos y productos Yambal puerta a puerta, lleva cuatro años en su negocio y cuenta con  una clientela fija, argumenta que le va bien, siendo muy sacrificado pues tiene que recorrer la ciudad a pie para visitar a sus clientes de casa en casa,  su mayor dificultad es el clima pues cuando llueve no puede realizar sus actividades normales.

María lleva cinco años trabajando con la fundación,  sintiéndose muy agradecida ya que con los préstamos recibidos ha logrado mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar y de su negocio;  con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de un stock completo de cosméticos para incrementar su negocio e ir creciendo día a día.

Su sueño es  remodelar su casa porque le está quedando muy pequeña para toda su familia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Las Caleras is located in the city of Cuenca in the south of Ecuador. This is a very beautiful city with many touristic places, its churches and historic downtown, and its rivers, for which it is considered a Cultural World Heritage site. Its people are kind and educated. Mrs. Maria Margarita O. I. is one of twelve members of the Communal Bank Las Caleras. These are very happy women, determined to get ahead with their families. She lives in Via al Tejar in the city of Cuenca, is 52 years old, and happily married. She has three children, 29, 28, and 22 years of age. The two eldest are married and live in their own homes, and the youngest daughter is a single mom and studies Tourism in the University of Cuenca. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Her house is the product of their work together as a couple. Maria works selling cosmetics and Yambal products door to door. She has had her business for four years and has a fixed clientele. She argues that she does well, through with a lot of sacrifice since she has to go around the city on foot to visit her customers from house to house. Her greatest difficulty is the weather because when it rains she cannot carry on her normal activities. Maria has been working with the foundation for five years. She feels very grateful because with the loans she has received she has been able to improve the financial situation in her home and her business.
