With the new loan that Fundacion Espoir will give her she will invest in buying a complete stock of cosmetics to increase her business and grow day to day. Her dream is to remodel her home because it has become too small for all her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a complete stock of cosmetics to grow her business

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Hin Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan which consists of seventeen people and they all live I. Chong Koh Kor village I. Kandal province. Mrs. Sokha H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Morn Thy, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. I. the vegetables growing, they need fertilizers and pesticides to support them because their field is infertile soil. This couple has two children, one of whom is a construction worker and the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: Need fertilizers and pesticides to support the field.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Mampong in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Rose works to support her husband and provide for the family. She is a trader. She runs a provision store. Her store is by the roadside in her community. Rose procures the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for some years now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. Rose is hopeful about giving her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corn

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 40 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en la casa D. unos familiares.
DesD. hace más D. 2 años se dedica a criar animales, tales como: cerdos, ovejas, cuyes y pollos. Para ello adecuó un espacio en su vivienda para albergar a estos animales, a los que alimenta con la alfalfa que cosecha en sus tierras, D. esta manera tiene a sus animales en buen estado D. salud comiendo pasto fresco. Cada 15 días lleva a sus animales a las ferias ganaderas D. su localidad para su comercialización o en algunos casos sus clientes la buscan en su misma casa.
Adicionalmente, en sus tierras D. cultivo siembra papa, maíz y alcachofa, siendo la venta D. estos productos, un ingreso económico muy importante para su familia.
Elsa desea tener un establo más granD. y mejor implementado para que sus animales tengan mejores condiciones D. vida y eso se traduzca en mayores ganancias para ella.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy entusiasmada con la experiencia D. ser parte D. un banco comunal, pues es novedad para ella; por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. abono para sus siembras D. alcachofa.
texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old and lives with her three children in the house of one of her relatives. For more than two years, she has been raising animals such as pigs, sheep, guinea pigs, and chickens. She converted a space in her home in order to house these animals. Elsa keeps them healthy by feeding them fresh grass and alfalfa that she grows herself. Every 15 days, she takes her animals to the local livestock fairs to sell. In some cases, customers will come to her house to buy the animals.

In addition to raising animals, Elsa grows potatoes, corn, and artichokes. Selling these products provides important income for her family. She wants to build a larger stable so that her animals will have better living conditions, which translates into increased revenues for her.

This is her first loan with MFP. Elsa is excited about being part of a Communal Bank because this is a new experience for her. She promises to make her payments on time. The money she requested will be used to purchase fertilizer for her crop of artichokes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
A 62 year old woman who built her own business for the sake of her family, Minda P. lives in the village of Brgy Chambery, Manapla, Negros Occidental. Her husband works as a fisherman and they are blessed with 9 children with ages from 26 to 37 years old.

Minda knew the hardship her husband went through just to earn enough to sustain the needs of their family. Because of their situation, Minda pursued her plan to get into a business to help her husband even with just a small income.

With a small amount of capital, she started a food vending business. In 1995 she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to have access to a bigger capital so she can expand her business by adding new kinds of food to sell. She would sell the food in the villages and towns near by. She would wake up early each morning to prepare the food to sell and prepare the food for her husband when he goes fishing.

She was able to improve their way of living through NWTF-Project Dungganon because of her continuous loans. She earned Php 15,000 per month that was mostly used for her family and for her children.

Minda's previous loan of Php 9,500 was used as additional capital for her food vending business which was paid on-time without delay. Now, with the same amount of Php 9,500, she would like to purchase additional ingredients and equipment for her food vending business.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for food vending

loans.name: Martina Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Martina P. se ha destacado por vender ropa en el departamento de Masaya ofreciéndola en su propia casa tanto a damas, caballeros y niños. Ella anhela mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para colocar sus vitrinas y así exhibir la ropa y para esto ella ha iniciado a reconstruir su casa de habitación para mejorar las condiciones de tal manera que sus clientes puedan tener un espacio amplio donde ver la ropa y así poder ofrecerla brindando un buen lugar.

Para ello solicita un crédito porque quiere comprar los materiales de construcción y así iniciar la ampliación del local para lograr la satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martina P. sells clothes out of her own home in the Masaya department to women, men and children. She longs to improve the conditions of her house in order to put in her display cabinets and display the clothes. To do this she has started to rebuild her house to improve the conditions in such a way that her customers can have a spacious area where they can see the clothes, and so being able to provide a good spot for them. Therefore she is asking for a loan because she wants to buy building materials and start the extension of the premises to keep her customers happy.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials to extend her premises

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S., 61, is married and lives with four of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about $1 each day and are supported by four of their children who work in the garment factories. 

Leng S. would like to take out a loan of $800 she needs to purchase rice and take off the husk with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living. 

Leng S. is pictured with her grandson.

loans.use: Purchase rice

loans.name: Angela Ramona

texts.es: Ángela Ramona tiene 69 años de edad, su actividad económica es la elaboración y venta de comida. Hace más de 5 años en  donde poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, y nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, hoy ya es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes, por la rica sazón que le pone a sus comidas. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y a través de los tiempos ha mejorado cada día sus ingresos para mantener a sus 2 hijos que son muy importantes para ella. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado en la compra de carnes, verduras, maduro, granos básicos, queso entre otros productos. Su deseo es mantener siempre su negocio activo.
texts.en:
Ángela Ramona, 69, makes and sells food. It has been over five years since she gained experience, little by little, in this type of work. She tells us that her sales are going very well. She is now very well known, and she is well-liked by her customers for the delicious seasoning she adds to her food. She is a very enterprising woman. Everyday she has improved her income to support her two children, who are very important to her. The loan is for working capital to buy meat, vegetables, basic grains, and cheese, among other products. Her wish is to always keep her business active.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ortizer

texts.es:
Ortizer es un hombre honesto y lleno de esperanza, tiene 50 años y vive en su casa propia con su esposa Gloria de 48 años y los hijos de ella: Cecilia de 15 y Excer de 11 años.   

“Cuando llegue aquí de mi pueblo, hace 4 años, no tenía nada de nada, no contaba con el dinero suficiente para sembrar y mantener mi chacra”, menciona. Ortizer empezó a trabajar como peón en diferentes chacras y actualmente contrata personas que le ayudan a trabajar sus propios terrenos agrícolas donde siembra plátano, café, carambola, maíz, yuca y otros frutos nativos. 
Lo que más le gusta de la actividad es limpiar sus terrenos, ya que después le darán buenas cosechas.
En sus planes futuros piensa preparar algunos terrenos que no usaba para incrementar su producción, también participará en un proyecto gubernamental de reforestación, por lo que plantará plantas ornamentales y maderables.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son muy responsables, agradecen por el crédito, pues éstos les ofrecen una nueva vida con mayores oportunidades. Con el dinero que ahora solicita tiene pensado comprar 7 sacos de abono y fertilizante, además de decenas de plantas de café que plantará en las chacras que recientemente compró.
texts.en:
Ortizer is an honest man who is full of hope. He is 50, and he lives in his own house with his 48 year old wife, Gloria, and their children. Cecilia is 15, and Excer is 11. “When I arrived here four years ago from my village, I did not have anything. I did not have enough money to plant and support my farm,” he says. Ortizer started to work as a laborer on different farms. He now contracts people to help him work his own farm land where he plants bananas, coffee, star fruit, corn, yucca, and other native fruits. What he likes most about his work is cleaning the land because afterwards it produces a good harvest. His future plans are to prepare some land that he does not use to increase his production and to participate in a government reforestation project. That is why he will plant decorative plants and wood producing plants. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He and the other members of his communal bank, who are very responsible, are grateful for the loan. They offer a new life with greater opportunities. He plans to use the money he is now requesting to buy seven sacks of natural and chemical fertilizers. He will also buy dozens of coffee plants, which he will plant on the farms that he recently bought.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and coffee plants

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
Exaltacion Y. a is a 55-year old married woman who lives in Galicia Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by her general store. Exaltacion’s 64 year old husband, Rogelio, and the adult children help in running the business. 

Exaltacion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase the family income from their general store. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 5,000 from her business activities.

Exaltacion is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 17,500 was used to fund operations for her general store and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 16th cycle loan, the amount of Php 12,000, which she intends to use on the general store. Exaltacion is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Purity Kadzo

texts.en:
Purity is 30 years old and married to Emmanuel, who is a newspaper vendor.  They have three children. Her business of selling food, from which she gets a monthly profit of 12,000 KES, is two years old and is located at Kisumu Ndogo-Malindi. 

Purity was introduced to KADET by a friend and this is her first loan. She will use 5,000 KES of this loan to add packets of flour and 5,000 KES to add furniture for the cafe. If this loan boosts her business, she will buy a plot with the extra profit. 

A hardworking woman, Purity dreams of building a personal residential home.

loans.use: To purchase flour and add furniture to cafe

loans.name: Soukeye

texts.en: Soukeye N. is a 28-year-old single woman from the region of Thiès, Senegal. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" DIAMAGUENE1 for two years and has always repaid her loans on time. She uses local fruits to produce juice which she sells at a stand. Soukeye N. will use the bulk of this loan to buy fruits and, with the remainder, buy a necessary utensil.

loans.use: To purchase fruit

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
En la Ciudadela 20 de Julio de la cálida Barranquilla, vive Lorena Jiménez M. una joven de 21 años muy emprendedora, que a su edad ya es propietaria del negocio La Gran Estación, nombre que le puso Lorena, porque todo el que pasa detiene su marcha para refrescarse, pues el clima reinante lo hace obligatorio. 
Las actividades de esta joven mujer no tienen límites, ella también vende mercancías femeninas especialmente accesorios en plata, y como cada día en sus negocios ve rotar su mercancía rápidamente, necesita estar provisionándolo de bebidas y todo lo que solicitan sus clientes; con este propósito está aplicando a un crédito por valor de $ 1.300.000 para comprar por volumen cajas de refrescos, bebidas y adornos femeninos en plata como pulsos, anillos, cadenas y tobilleras. Lorena inició su aventura emprendedora sin cumplir su mayoría de edad con pequeñas actividades de venta, luego se dedicó a comercializar productos por catálogos, cuando trabajando como empleada fue retirada  y utilizó toda su liquidación para lograr iniciar este su gran negocio, al que fue añadiendo, con el apoyo en su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, otras actividades como la venta de bebidas refrescantes en la obligatoria parada de peatones y vecinos que por allí circulan, así mismo sus ingresos han aumentado dándole la oportunidad de iniciar una carrera técnica.
Lorena es muy feliz con su pequeño hijo de dos años, sus estudios y su trabajo como negociante; tiene muchos sueños asociados a su crecimiento personal y empresarial, trabaja en la actualidad para terminar su carrera, buscar mejores opciones de vida y fortalecer la sostenibilidad de su unidad de negocios que ahora la emplea y porque suspira por tener una casa propia donde compartir con su pequeño su vida futura.
texts.en:
Lorena Jiménez M. lives in the 20 de Julio neighborhood in warm Barranquilla. She is a 21 year old young woman who is very enterprising. At her age she is already the proprietor of a business, La Gran Estación. Lorena gave it that name because everyone who passes by stops to refresh themselves. The prevailing climate makes it obligatory. This young woman’s activities have no limits. She also sells merchandise for women, especially silver accessories. Everyday in her businesses she sees her merchandise rotate rapidly. She needs to be stocked up on drinks and everything her customers request. With that objective, she is applying for a loan for 1,300,000 COP to buy in volume. She will buy boxes of soft drinks, drinks, and silver jewelry like bracelets, rings, chains, and ankle bracelets for women. Lorena started her enterprising adventure before she was of age with small sales activities. Then she sold products by catalog. When she was working as an employee she was laid off. She used all of her assets to start this great business. She was adding, with the help of her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, other activities like selling cool drinks. She sells where the pedestrians and neighbors who circulate around here must stop. Her income has increased, which gives her the opportunity to start a technical career. Lorena is very happy with her small two year old son, her studies, and her work as a businesswoman. She has many dreams associated with her personal growth and her business. She is currently working to finish her career. She is looking for better life options and to strengthen the sustainability of her current business. She yearns to have her own house in which to share the future with her little one.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy in volume boxes of soft drinks, drinks, and silver jewelry like bracelets, rings, chains, and ankle bracelets for women

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 46 años, es separada y de cuya relación tiene 4 hijos, con los que vive en casa de su familia. La venta de carne de pollo y gallina, es el negocio al que se dedica todos los días, en un puesto ubicado dentro del mercado de su distrito. Su trabajo empieza desde las 8 de la mañana, ya que a esa hora es cuando mas circula la gente para comprar lo productos básico para la cocina; hasta el medio día, que es cuado puede un respiro para descansar. Su esposo la ayuda en este trabajo y juntos sacan adelante su negocio, resultándole muy rentable, puesto que logra vender toda la mercadería que tienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que se relaciona con mucha gente; por ello ya lleva 8 años en esta actividad. En adelante desea cambiarse de puesto, debido a la dificultad de no contar continuamente de agua potable. Este es su décimo crédito con Francisca y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es la socia mas alegre de todas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más javas con pollos, para atender la demanda del resto de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco is 46 years old, is separated and has four children, from that relationship, with whom she lives in her family's house. Selling chicken and hen meat is the business that she is dedicated to everyday in a stall located inside her district's market. Her work begins at 8 in the morning since this hour is when people are circulating most to buy basic products for cooking. She works until noon when she can take a break to rest. Her husband helps her in this work and together they move their business forward, making it very profitable since they sell all the merchandise they have. What she likes most about her job is that she can meet lots of people. She has eight years experience with this work. In the future, she'd like to change her stall, due to the lack of continuous access to potable water. This is her tenth loan with Francisca and she knows that she has to repay punctually and is committed to doing so. In her community bank, she is the happiest member of all. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy more crates of chickens to meet the demand of the rest of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more crates of chicken.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely E. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Emely is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Emely owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is the sale of Avon, Fullerlife, and Natasha products in the local community. Emely has been engaged in her business for over 12 years, and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities. She also has a food stall, where she sells specialty foods and snack foods.

In 2009, Emely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Emely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Emely is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Emely from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Irlanda Carolina

texts.es: Irlanda Carolina de 27 años, tiene dos hijos, su negocio consiste en la venta de golosinas, en un Kiosco que tiene más de 5 años de tenerlo por la necesidad y buscar una fuente alternativa de ingresos decide establecer este negocio que está ubicado en una escuela donde asisten muchos estudiantes que asisten a este centro. Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital, pues este es su primer crédito y está muy emocionada pues espera que el resultado sea satisfactorio. Sueña con incrementar cada día más su capital para que las ganancias le queden a ella para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda. El crédito será destinado para la compra de jugos, golosinas,  pan, galletas y refrescos.
texts.en:
Irlanda Carolina, 27, has two children. She sells snacks in a kiosk. She has had it for over 5 years. She needed to have an alternative source of income so she decided to open this business; it’s located at the entrance of a school where many students attend. She gradually increased her capital. This is her first loan and she is very excited about it because she expects it to have satisfactory results. She dreams with increasing her capital even more each day so that profits will stay with her in order to make some home improvements. She will use the funds to buy juices, snacks, bread, cookies and soft-drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy juices, snacks, bread, cookies and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: A. afi exerce comme activité génratrice de revenu le commerce  de produits d’alimentation génrale, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2004. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre de s’approvisionner avec 20 cartons de boîtes de conserve.  elle a ouvert sa propre boutique qu’elle a appelé « ETS BTS ». sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant avec le revenu de son commerce elle contribue aux charges financières de  son foyer.
texts.en:
A. Afi runs a general food products business as a means to generate revenue. She has run this business since 2004. The loan that she is requesting will allow her to re-stock with 20 boxes of canned foods. She opened her own boutique which she called « ETS BTS ». Her customer base is made up of all sorts of people. She is married and the mother of one child. With the revenue from her business, she contributes to the financial responsibilities of her house.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M., 29, is single and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines.
 
Josephine operates a computer shop. Most Filipino households don’t have computers, so students who need to do research, print typed papers and use computer services rent out units on an hourly basis. It is also a very popular way to socialize through online gaming, chatting and using social networking sites. Josephine mainly caters to students and young people, but her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy needed upgrading software, hardware and accessories. She also will invest some of the loan for repairs needed in the shop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands the business. 
 
Josephine is hoping that she will one day have her own house and lot, courtesy of the profits from her computer shop.

loans.use: to buy upgrading software, hardware and accessories and for repairs needed in the shop

loans.name: Rudilla

texts.en:
Rudilla M. is from the village of Sapang Dalaga. She is 51 years old, married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Rudilla owns and operates a business venture in the food sector in fishing. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from the selling of ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rudilla has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rudilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Rudilla is requesting a new loan of 14,950 PHP which will be used to pawn a parcel of land. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Rudilla from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pawned a parcel of land

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Irish Lee

texts.en:
Irish Lee C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 25 years old. Irish Lee is married. To make a living, Irish Lee owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Irish Lee has been engaged in her business for over 2 years.

Irish Lee joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irish Lee has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Irish Lee is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Irish Lee from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Luz O. vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, en la comunidad  corazón de Jesús lugar en donde se puede admirar unos paisajes sin igual, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 24, 22, 19, 17, 15, 11 años, su hija de 24 años es madre soltera, trabaja para solventar sus gastos, su hijo de 22 años vive y trabaja en el extranjero, su hija de 19 años es casada y vive de manera independiente, sus hijos de 17 y 15 años estudian en el colegio, su hijo de 11 años estudia en la escuela, su esposo es  de profesión albañil, con el sacrificio del trabajo diario ahora la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos de su hogar y a la cría de cuys, ganado, chanchos, los vende en su comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva hortalizas las cuales las vende en su casa y también le sirven para su consumo.
 
Es su segundo ciclo en la fundación, el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.
 
Su sueño es acabar su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Luz O. lives outside of the city of Cuenca, in the Corazón de Jesús community, a place of beautiful landscapes without equal. The people of this region work in agriculture and the raising of livestock. Rosa is 42 years old; she is married and has six children, aged 24, 22, 19, 17, 15, and 11. Her 24-hear-old daughter is a single mother who works to cover her own expenses. Her 22-year-old son lives and works abroad. Her 19-year-old daughter is married and lives independently. Her 17- and 15-year-old children are in secondary school, and her youngest son is still in primary school. Her husband is a builder, and with daily work and sacrifice, the house in which they live is now their property. Rosa does domestic work in her home, and she also raises guinea pigs, cattle, and pigs, which she sells in her community. She also works in agriculture, cultivating vegetables which she sells in her home and also uses to feed her family. It is her second cycle with FUNDACION ESPOR, and she will invest this new loan in the purchase of chickens. Her dream is to finish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens

loans.name: Chu

texts.en:
T. Chu Thị (20213050021) is a 36 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 8,736,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the her from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros M. is 51 years old and the mother of four children. Her two eldest children are both working in a factory. There are two more relatives who she employed as vendors of her business who live with them. She is one of the oldest members of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a partner MFI of KIVA in the Philippines, in their place. She is a very lively and dependent mother. She is engaged in buying and selling ready to wear clothes, fruits and vegetables. Her income in this business meets their daily financial needs and supports the schooling of her two youngest children. She plans to expand her business to generate more income so that she can start renovation of their house. She is applying for a loan of PHP 29,000 to buy more ready to wear products, fruits and vegetables. She hopes that ASHI and KIVA will again support her in this venture.

loans.use: to buy more RTW clothing, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 40 años, es una mujer con ansias de éxito; ella convive con Samuel, de 43 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos; Fred de 18 y Sandy de 8 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Palcamayo. A pesar de las carencias que tiene, Rosa lucha por salir adelante. Hace 22 años que se dedica a la agricultura; actividad que le permite pagar los estudios universitarios de su hija Guisella. Todos los días desde muy temprano, sale a cuidar sus plantaciones de espinaca, papa y hortalizas, los que después de cosechar los lleva al mercado mayorista de la capital; ahí pudo encontrar muchas oportunidades de ganar más; la venta de hortalizas le es muy rentable ya que en la costa no se siembra estos productos y la demanda es asegurada durante el mes. Pero los planes de Rosa es abrir una ferretería donde pueda adquirir mayor ganancias sin dejar de sembrar. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y está contenta de pertenecer al banco comunal más respetado de su localidad; donde los miembros, son personas activas y trabajadoras. Con el crédito que obtendrá comprará semillas de arvejas para las 4 hectáreas de terreno que sembrará.
texts.en:
Rosa, 40 years old, is a woman with great hopes for success. She lives with Samuel, who is 43 years old. The have 3 children together, but only 2 of them live with them; Fred is 18 and Sandy is 8. They live in their own house, located in the rural area of Palcamayo. 

Despite some hardships, Rosa works hard to get ahead. She has been working in agriculture for 22 years. This business allows her to pay for her daughter Guisella’s university studies. Every day, starting very early, she goes out to fields of spinach, potatoes, and vegetables. After harvesting them, she takes them to the wholesale market in the capital. There she is able to find many opportunities for earning more; vegetable sales are very good business because these products are not planted on the coast and demand is guaranteed during the month. However, Rosa’s plan is to open a hardware store where she can achieve greater earnings without giving up farming. 

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is happy to belong to the most-respected communal bank in her area; the members are all active and hardworking. With the loan she will buy pea seed for the 4 hectares of land that she will plant.

loans.use: To buy pea seed.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa  de 36 años de  edad, tiene una niña de 12 añitos la cual esta en su sexto grado de primaria en la Escuela Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell, su esposa labora como albañil, ambos son bien trabajadores y comparten con los gastos familiares y los compromisos adquiridos.  labora para el CETA INATEC  desde hace 5 años  desempeñandose como responsable de cocina de donde obtiene sus ingresos mensuales y garantizar el bienestar familiar.  

Solicita su tercer crèdito para acondicionar la habitacion donde ella duerme asì gozar de mas privacidad y un ambiente mas agradable en su hora de descanso. 

Se empeña por tener estabilidad laboral ya que es muy dificil encontrar trabajo, que su hija estudie y que su linda familia permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Teresa  is 36 years old. She has a 12 year old daughter in sixth grade in the Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell elementary school. Her husband works as a bricklayer. They are both very hardworking and share the family expenses and acquired responsibilities. She has worked for CETA INATEC for 5 years in charge of a kitchen. That is where she gets her monthly income and guarantees the family's wellbeing.  

She is asking for her third loan to remodel the bedroom where she sleeps so she can have more privacy and a better ambience when she is resting. 

She is working to have work stability since it is very difficult to find work. She wants her daughter to study and for her beautiful family to stay close.

loans.use: To remodel a bedroom

loans.name: Mariana Fanny

texts.es:
Marina de 57 años, tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de artículos, productos y víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Para poder mantener a su familia ella se la ha ingeniado vender todo tipo de artículo, víveres, productos de uso personal en los años que han pasado. Vendiendo desde un puesto que ella adecuo en su casa los artículos y productos ha podido ampliar su negocio con ventas de productos Yambal (compañía de productos de uso personal) y Esika (compañía de ropa por catalogo). 
 
Para que su negocio siga con los ingresos que ha tenido ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa esika para que sus clientes tengan más variedad al ir a comprar. En el futuro quiere incrementar su mercadería y tener mercadería en stop.
texts.en:
Marina, 57, has a small stand in the front of her house where she sells items, products and groceries.  She lives in an urban zone in Guayaquil, called Suburbio, notable because most of its residents are merchants.

To support her family she devised ways to sell all kinds of items, groceries and personal use items over the last few years.  Selling products and items from the stand she set up in her home she has managed to expand the business selling Yanbal and Esika products.  Yanbal are personal use products and Esika is a catalogue clothing firm.

So that her business can continue producing income she wants to use the loan to buy Esika clothes so that her customers will have a wider variety available for purchase.  In the future she’d like to increase her merchandise and have merchandise in stock.

loans.use: For clothes.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda S. is from the town of Trinidad.  She is 52 years old.   Erlinda is married and has 7 children.  To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from tending a "turo-turo" (cooked food counter) in the community.  Erlinda wants to increase her earnings and have her own savings. 

Erlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients for cooking. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda P. is from the village of Baybay liloy Zamboanga del norte. She is 43 years old. Luzminda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a business selling peanuts in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luzminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Luzminda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Soy Y Luna Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sol y Luna lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la capital de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es Alvaro V. quien inicio con un taxi hace 2 años y hace poco los fines de semana destace cerdo con el fin de día a día salir adelante. 
El invertirá el crédito en sus negocios con el fin de seguir creciendo.
Las otras integrantes son  Maricela Solórzano quien tiene una fritanga y Yolanda del Carmen M. quien vende refrescos.
texts.en:
The Sol y Luna ["Sun and Moon"] group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising individuals from the capital city of Managua.  The group leader is Alvaro V., who started a taxi service two years ago.  Not long ago, he also started butchering pigs on the weekends in order improve his situation day by day.

He will invest this loan in his businesses, with the goal of continuing to grow.

The other members of the group are Maricela Solórzano, who has a small restaurant, and Yolanda del Carmen M., who sells soft drinks.

loans.use: to invest in his taxi service and pig butchering business

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en:
Mrs. Baasanjav T. is 42 years old and married with four children. Her eldest daughter, Uranbaigal, 19, is married and lives separately. 

Mrs. Baasanjav’s family owns a piece of land and a wooden house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been renting a stall in Bumbugur, the second largest indoor market in the city, and has been running a clothing retail sales business since 2008. She buys the clothes from wholesalers who brings them from China and resells them.
 
Mrs. Baasanjav’s husband, Gankhuyag, 44, works part time as a taxi driver and rest of the time he helps in her wife’s business. The couple’s main goal is to provide a good education for their children. 

The reason Mrs. Baasanjav is requesting a loan is that Mongolians are expecting to celebrate the lunar new year in February, 2011, and she is planning to stock up on goods before the shopping spree starts.

loans.use: To stock up on goods before the Mongolian new year and the shopping spree starts

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing. 

She has operated a food stall business, selling at an open air market to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanaidi faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her business. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking oil and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Mrs. Net N. is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. Mrs. Net N. and her family are living in Saen Ban village in Takeo province. Her husband, Mr. Phoeun Khun, is a coconut seller. He also cuts leave of palm trees to make roofs for sale to earn some money. They support three children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school. The youngest child is a 4-year-old. 

Although they try to work a lot, Mrs. Net N. can earn only a small income. To improve this situation, Mrs. Net N. is borrowing some money from AMK to buy a cow. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Expand her tortilla stall and animal-raising business

loans.name: Melrie

texts.en:
Melrie D. is from the village of Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 32 years old. Melrie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melrie owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Melrie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2011, Melrie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melrie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melrie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. has worked for seven years as a vendor of salted fish and other food items, such as kenkey and salt. (Kenkey is a staple made from fermented cassava and maize dough.) She sells her wares at Abrafo, near the town of Abura. In this picture, Ama his holding Fante kenkey in her right hand and bagged salt in her left.

Ama is a widow and is her family’s sole breadwinner. To support her family, she needs to increase her earnings. Her loan will be used to buy greater varieties of fish in order to attract more customers. The new profits will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to buy greater varieties of fish in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Rotchel

texts.en:
Rotchel S. works hard to support her family. Rotchel is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rotchel requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy a fishing boat.

Rotchel has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

In the future, Rotchel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to purchase fishing boat

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
Mehriniso is married with four children. She sells all kinds of bakery products in her commercial location. The market is located in a good area that brings many clients. Mehriniso has operated this business for 7 years. She always offers good, fresh products. Her clients know and value this.  Mehrinoso is honest, entrepreneurial and hard-working. She makes every effort to make her business a nice, attractive place for her customers.

Mehriniso is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to expand her business and increasing her working capital. She hopes to use the additional income to improve her business conditions.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy bakery products

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en:
Abenawa A. is married and has six dependents. She operates a provisions shop and as well cooks banku at Elmina for sale. Banku is a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup. She is married to a farmer. Together they feed, clothe, and educate her dependents. 

Her customers are demanding more items from her shop and so she is requesting a loan to meet their needs; she will use the loan to buy more provisions for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abenawa plans to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy provisions for resale.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ninfa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. 

Ninfa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy a new diesel motor and to repair her fishing boat.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy a new diesel motor and to repair the fishing boat.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is a widow taking care of five dependents. She makes banku and kenkey (kenkey for distribution to retailers) at Elmina.  She has done this for 20 years.  Adjoa uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. 

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to produce kenkey and banku for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to invest in her business. She is in this picture mixing the dough to be used for the banku.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize to produce kenkey and banku for sale.

loans.name: Francisco Sandro

texts.es: Francisco nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 44 años de edad. Actualmente, Francisco vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Francisco trabajo en una empresa de construcción en el área de logística. Ya son seis años que se dedica a esta profesión y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Francisco requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como papeles y archivadores. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Unión Latina” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Francisco was born in the city of Cusco (Peru).  He is 44 years old and currently lives in the same city in which he was born.  Francisco works in a building company, in the logistics field.  He has been in this profession for six years and he has done very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.

On this occasion, Francisco needs a loan to buy work materials such as paper and files.  He is a responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, his friends invited him to join Asociación Arariwa's "Unión Latina" community bank.

loans.use: to buy work materials such as paper and files

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province of Mongolia.  His two children attend the local secondary school while his wife is a tailor.  

He manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2006 and has gained much experience.  He is a kind man who is planning to continue his business in the future.  He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to repair his car.

loans.use: To repair his taxi car

loans.name: Man Maya

texts.en:
Man Maya is 40 years-old. She is married and has three children aged 22, 14 and 10.  In 2002, she established her grocery shop business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to increase the inventory of her store. In the future, Man Maya plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. 

If a borrower is to improve the living standard, extra training is needed. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of  the small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Lira

texts.ru:
Лире 31 год, замужем и проживает в селе Ташарык Таласского района.  В дружной семье  Лиры растут пять дочерей, две из которых являются студентками, а ее муж Султанмурат является ее главной опорой в жизни.  В 2000 году, супруги решили начать свой бизнес в разведении скота, началом которого послужила покупка одной коровы на 5,000 сом (KGS).  Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности заемщицы, на сегодняшний день ее ферма насчитывает 10 голов овец и одну лошадь. Также, семья обрабатывает 1,5 га поливной земли, где сажает многолетние травы и фасоль. 
Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Лира запрашивает кредит в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для увеличения поголовья скота. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Lira, 31, is married and lives in the village of Tash-Aryk in the Talas district. Lyra is raising five daughters, two of whom are college students, in her close-knit family.  Her husband, Sultanmurat, is the mainstay in her life. In 2000, the couple decided to start a business breeding cattle, which was begun by buying a cow for 5,000 som (KGS). Through hard work and dedication, her farm now has ten head of sheep and one horse. Also, the family farms 1.5 hectares of irrigated land, where they have planted grasses and beans. In order to further development her business, Lira is asking for a loan in the amount of 50,000 Som (KGS) to increase the number of her livestock.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru:
Иброхим добросовестный и ответственный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 2 детей. Он занимается купля продажей продукты питание. Он имеет свой собственный магазин в центре города. Его жена помогает ему, когда он ездит за товарами. Более 4 лет он занимается в данном бизнесе.  Иброхим всегда старается получить максимальной прибыли и улучшить свое жилищное условие. Он запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки продовольственных товаров. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Ibrohim is a conscientious and dependable man. He is married and a loving father of 2 children. He sells groceries at his own store at the center of his town. His wife helps him in the store when he leaves to purchase groceries in bulk. Ibrohim has been managing his store for the last 4 years. He is always trying to maximize the profit from his business in order to improve living conditions for his family. Currently he is requesting a loan of 3000 US dollars to purchase various grocery staples for his store. He hopes that lenders will support this loan.

loans.use: to purchase bulk groceries for his store

loans.name: Tasileta

texts.en:
Tasileta is 52 years of age and married with eight children. Tasileta owns & operates a business venture selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  She has many years of experience in this business.  Tasileta needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Tasileta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tasileta's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is 24 years old and a business man, he is married to Tabitha who is a house wife. They have no children by now. He has been running a retail shop for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 7,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Haron will use the loan to buy sugar, wheat flour, and maize meal to add to his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his shop. His hopes are to open a wholesale shop which will cater for his coming children.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat flour, and maize meal to add to his shop

loans.name: San Agustín Group

texts.es:
El comité San Agustín se formó con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades que fomenten la mutua cooperación y el desarrollo de cada de ellas. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Señora Mirtha es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica ala venta de ropas y lencería. Ella es una señora muy creativa y siempre trae prendas muy lindas y de muy buen calidad. Ella comenta que por medio de su trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ayuda en los gastos de la casa. Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 3 hijos y su marido.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas para la posterior venta, pues tiene muchos pedidos y le gustaría poder cumplir con sus clientes
texts.en:
The “San Agustín” committee was formed when several neighbors and friends from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso joined together.  All the group members carry out activities that foment mutual cooperation and development of each of them.  The members formed a very united group that’s able to carry out group activities that strengthen their companionship.

Mirtha is one of the group members.  She sells clothes and lingerie.  She’s a very creative woman and always brings very beautiful, good quality items of clothing.  She comments that through her work she’s been able to raise her family because it helps her meet household expenses.  She has a very united family with three children and her husband.

She requests the loan to buy clothes for subsequent resale since she has many pending orders and she’d like to fulfill them for he customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Zakhir

texts.ru:
Zakhir jenat i imeyet 3 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione, posolok Bala Bahmanli vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Zakhir 44 qoda. On uje 2 qoda kak reshil zanatsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec. Do etogo on zanimalsya pticevodstvom i razvodil gusey. Eto vtoraya ssuda ZAkhira on ochen blagodaren lenderam i Kive za pervuyu ssudu. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota. 

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/76514
texts.en: Zakhir is married and has three children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives together with his wife and children in the Bala Bahmanli village of the Fuzuli region.  He is 44 years old.  He decided to get involved in animal husbandry two years ago and now breeds sheep.  Zakhir was previously involved in bird farming and bred geese.  This Zakhir's second loan, and he is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the first loan.  He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy sheep and increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to buy sheep and increase livestock quantity

loans.name: Sherkuzi

texts.ru: Шеркузи занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и откормом скота. В ведении бизнеса помогает жена. У них на воспитании растут пятеро детей. Они занимаются выращиванием картофеля, ячменя, моркови. Откорм мелкого рогатого скота приносит хорошие доходы в сельской местности. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит на приобретение десяти голов мелкого рогатого скота и корма для них. Он очень надеется получить кредит.
texts.en: Sherkuzi grows agriculture crops and feeds cattle. His wife helps him run the business. They are raising five children. Sherkuzi and his wife grow potatoes, barley, carrots. The business of feeding small horned cattle gives them good profit in their rural area. This is why he wants to take out a loan to buy ten heads of small horned cattle for feeding. He is very hopeful to receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a sheep.

loans.name: Elezar

texts.en:
Elizar is 54 years old. He is married and has two children. 

Elizar is in the business of buying recycled materials like plastic bottles, scrap metals, and other scrap materials. He buys these per kilo and sells them to buyers who buy them per kilo. He has had this business for three years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy more scrap materials.

Elizar joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional recycled materials like empty bottles and other scrap metals. These scrap materials are intended for sale.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: La señora Blanca, se dedica a la agricultura; tiene ganado lechero y con la venta de leche genera ingresos para la familia; además, tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de dos vacas lecheras de mediana calidad para incrementar el volumen de leche para su venta y mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en casa en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la localidad de Palomar del departamento de  La Paz: es casada y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que Blanca obtiene un crédito esperando mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca engages in agriculture. She has dairy cattle and sells the milk in order to generate income for her family. In addition, she manages a small store that sells basic necessities. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy two dairy cows of moderate quality so that she can increase the volume of milk that she sells and generate more income. Blanca lives in her own home in the town of Palomar in the Department of La Paz. She is married and has one child.

This is the first time Blanca has obtained a loan. She hopes to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Sango W/g Group

texts.en:
Jenipher is the facilitator of the Sango W/G group. Jenipher and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jenipher and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Jenipher takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. With income from her maize sales, Jenipher will educate her child, invest in livestock rearing and pay back loans.

In 2012, the members of Sango W/G group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows the members of the group.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Buenos Aires Group

texts.es:
Amenecia es miembro y coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Buenos Aires, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, es madre soltera de siete hijos y junto a su familia reside en el Barrio Jesús en el municipio de Juticalpa. 

Doña Amenecia inició a ganarse la vida desde muy temprana edad como empleada doméstica y un día cansada de tanto trabajar para otros decidió poner su propio negocio y desde hace varios años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Tiene una pequeña tortillera, que atiende ella y sus cuatro empleados desde las 4 am hasta las 2 pm. Su ventaja es que tiene una buena clientela que empieza a llegar a comprar las tortillas desde las 5 am y su desventaja es que el alquiler del local es muy caro y prácticamente lo que le queda en ganancias es para cubrir el pago. 

El préstamo de diez mil lempiras que Amenecia está solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo todo en la compra de maseca y leña. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos para ella y sus empleados. 

Las metas de doña Amenecia son tener su propia casa y un local propio para su tortillería. Tiene 5 años de trabajar con los préstamos de FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de manera puntual y los prestamos obtenidos le han ayudado a mejor su condición de vida y su negocio ha crecido.
texts.en:
Amenecia is a member and coordinator of the Buenos Aires communal bank. She makes and sells tortillas. She is a single mother of seven children, and lives with her family in the Jesús neighbourhood of the Juticalpa municipality.

Mrs. Amenecia began working for a living at a young age. She worked as a maid, but one day she got tired of working so much for other people, so she decided to open her own business. For several years now she has made and sold tortillas. She has a small tortilla shop which she and her four employees tend to from 4:00 am to 2:00 pm. She has a good customer base who start arriving to buy tortillas around 5:00 am. Unfortunately, the rent for her store is very high and almost all of her earnings go toward paying it.

Amenecia needs this loan of ten thousand lempiras to invest in the purchase of maseca [a popular brand of instant corn masa mix] and firewood. With the support of this loan, she will be able to continue having a source of income for her family and her employees.

Amenecia's goals are to have her own home as well as her own store for her tortilla shop. She has worked with FAMA loans for five years and has payed off her quotas punctually. These loans have helped her to improve her living conditions and her business has grown.

loans.use: to buy firewood and Maseca [brand of instant corn masa mix]

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

Salama sells used clothes and has been in this business for three years. She sells her products on a retail basis at the market. She also sells piped water as her other source of income. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

Her major business challenges are seasonality and increasing prices of clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to start importing used clothes and also to build rental houses. 

Salama lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Didier Adolfo

texts.es: El señor Didier a los 31 años de edad cuenta con una discapacidad física para caminar por lo cual para hacer esta actividad debe ser con la ayuda de un bastón.  Lo anterior, no es ningún impedimento para trabajar como barbero en una vereda del municipio de bello localizado al norte de la ciudad de Medellín, la experiencia del señor Didier es ya de cuatro años y los conocimientos los adquirió en un curso que hizo en una institución educativa de Medellín. El señor Didier con la esperanza de mejorar su negocio y prestar un mejor servicio desea comprar sillas para la sala de espera de su barbería y productos con los cuales trabaja tales como gel fijador para el cabello y shampoo. El sueño del señor Didier es tener su propia sala de belleza y brindarle educación a su hijo de 10 años.
texts.en:
Didier, 31, has a physical walking disability, so he has to do this with a cane.  This is no impediment to working as a barber in a district of the town of Bello, located to the north of the city of Medellín.  Didier already has four years of experience, and he acquired his knowledge in a course he took in an educational institute in Medellín.

Hoping to improve his business and offer better service, Didier wants to buy chairs for the waiting room of his barber shop and products he works with such as hair gel, hairspray, and shampoo.

Didier's dream is to have his own beauty shop and give his 10-year-old son an education.

loans.use: to buy chairs and beauty projects such as hair gel and shampoo.

loans.name: Olga Bertelia

texts.es:
Olga Bertilia tiene 65 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y los hijos de 37 y 28 años de edad en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC TENDAL está conformada  por 11 integrantes entre hombres y mujeres se encuentra ubicada a  45 minutos de la cooperativa.

Olga se dedica a la Agricultura y además a realizar quehaceres domésticos.
Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas las hace en Chillanes o en el Recinto Tendal cada semana.

Solicita el crédito para comprar animales como pollos y unos cerdos para criar y luego venderlos.

 Con la ayuda del crédito le podrá comprar  tener ingresos con la venta de los animales.
El sueño es poder  incrementar el negocio de la venta y compra de animales para tener un mejor estilo de vida.
Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado son los bajos precios en los animales.
En el tiempo libre le gusta arreglar la casa, cuidar los animales, es respetuosa, responsable y le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Olga Bertilia is 65 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her husband and her children, who are 37 and 28 years old, in Chillanes in the province of Bolívar.

The TENDAL communal bank is made up of 11 members, both men and women. It is located 45 minutes from the cooperative.

Olga works in agriculture as well as the tasks of her household. She buys supplies and sells her products each week in Chillanes or in the district of Tendal.

She is requesting the loan to buy animals such as chickens and some pigs to raise and later to sell. 

With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy animals and later sell them and receive income. Her dream is to expand her business buying and selling animals so she can have a better standard of living. 

The challenges she has faced include low prices for selling animals. 

In her free time she likes to fix up her home and care for the animals. She is respectful and responsible, and she enjoys the festivities of Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy animals such as chickens and some pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Wesal

texts.en: Wesal, 51 years old, is a housewife who has six sons and daughters. The oldest daughter is now married. One of her youngest sons, Bilal, who is 21 years old, is majoring in interior design in one of the Jordanian colleges. His mother Wesal wants him to finish his studies so he can work in the same field, so she has applied for a loan to pay his semester’s tuition. Because Wesal is a conservative person, she asked her son Bilal to appear in the picture instead.

loans.use: To pay for her son's semester fees

loans.name: Marcia Pilar

texts.es: Marcia de 44 años vive ( pariso Guayaquil ) ella decidió entrar al negocio de venta de artículos de belleza porque su mama le enseño a ser comerciante, tambien en ocasiones confecciona. Entonces ella decidió vender y le va bien . trabaja todos los días con muchas ganas el horario lo establece ella. A futuro anhela ser microempresaria . con el préstamo comprara ( productos de belleza, perfumes, cremas para mejorar sus ventas en cosmeticos)
texts.en:
Marcia, 44, lives in Paraíso, Guayaquil.  She decided to go into the business of selling beauty products because her mother taught her to be a storekeeper.  Then she decided to be a vendor, and it is going well for her.  Every day, with great desire, she works the schedule she sets up.  In the future she wants to be a micro-entrepreneur.

With the loan she will buy beauty products, perfume, and creams.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, perfume, creams, and dyes.

loans.name: Dewile

texts.en: Dewile is a 38-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to give his children a university education. In order to supplement his farming activities, he set up a retail shop that has been in business for 18 years. He has a vision of diversifying his business to include crop production on a large scale and having a wholesale shop. Dewile needs a loan to buy sugar and salt to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt  to sell.

loans.name: Jose Robert

texts.es: El señor José tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su esposa Marlene y 5 hijos menores, de los cuales 3 se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de la Comunidad y los otros dos no están en edad escolar, su domicilio está ubicado en Monteagudo, Cantón Sauces. Las principales actividades de los clientes es producción y venta de maíz amarillo y también cría y venta de cerdos cabañeros, una parte de sus productos agrícolas lo vende y con lo restante alimenta sus cerdos al igual que para alimentación de la familia. Don José trabaja arduamente para mantener a sus hijos que están estudiando y su mayor sueño es que ellos puedan continuar sus estudios superiores y tener una mejor vida. Están solicitando crédito para la construcción de un galpón de pollos (ponedoras de huevo), con esta actividad quieren incrementar sus ingresos lo que les ayudara a cubrir los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en: José is 30 years old and lives with his wife Marlene and five young children.  Three of the children study at the community school and the other two are not of school age.
