He lives in Monteagudo, Cantón Sauces.  His main activity is producing and selling yellow corn and he also breeds and sells pigs.  He sells a portion of his farm products and with the remainder, he feeds his pigs and in this manner, feeds his family.  José works hard to support his children who are in school and his greatest dream is that they are able to pursue higher education and have a better life.  He is requesting this loan to build a chicken shed (egg-laying).  He wishes to increase his income with this activity which will help him pay for his children’s studies.

loans.use: to build a shed.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
Ella es Maria Catalina, una mujer llena de sueños y el reto es hacerlos realidad, el mayor sueño es alcanzar la meta de volverse una profesional en cosmetológica y estética por que esa es la  profesional  que siempre le ha gustado, sabe que con esa profesión puede trabajar  como empleada pero también sabe que lo puede hacer independiente, necesita el subsidio por que no cuenta con los recursos para pagar la carrera sin tener ningún beneficio y sabe que el instituto ofrece la mejor educación y sabe que los profesionales que han estudiado hay brillan en las carreras, por esa razón quiere hacer realidad el sueño de estudiar en uno de los mejores institutos, los planes que tiene a futuro son ubicarse laboral mente, volverse una buena profesional en lo personal sobresalen por  ser una mujer sincera ,honesta, organizada, en lo laboral es muy responsable, siempre está dispuesta a adquirir conocimientos para así desempeñarse cada día mejor en el área de trabajo,  siempre dispuesta para hacer parte del  mejor equipo de trabajo, en lo familiar entrega todo el amor, siempre dispuesta para los hijos, siempre pendiente de las necesidades de ellos, los hijos siempre han sido el motor para no caer si no siempre levantarse con la mejor actitud, sin importar que  hay que vencer cualquier tipo de obstáculos.

Ella solicita el convenio con kiva, ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para hacer los pagos de las cuotas mensuales, para ella es importante poder terminar esta carrera, y poder tener un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Para pagar un semestre de matricula

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun is 24 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has two children. 

Rice farming is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for 11 years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 24,700 Cambodia Riel (KHR) per day and save about 15,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

This is the second micro loan for Oun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek another loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ayidote Mawudjro Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE MAWUDJRO est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Edwige est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Edwige est âgée de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. Edwige est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Albert. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et à leur charge. Edwige vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Edwige vend depuis cinq ans a son domicile du maïs et des pommades. Edwige s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu,  Edwige ensemble avec les membres du  groupe AYIDOTE MAWUDJRO, sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des pommades et du maïs.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Mère de sept enfants, Adjovi est une veuve femme âgée de 48 ans résidant à Baguida. Adjovi est une marchande de bouillie  préparée à base du maïs et accompagné des gâteaux à domicile. Adjovi revend sa marchandise au bord de la route. Adjovi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour sa préparation et demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs, des unités de beignets  et de gâteaux afin de pouvoir bien revendre puis de gagner une marge bénéficiaire assez importante pour pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation et à leur épanouissement.
texts.en: Adjovi is a 48-year-old widow and mother of seven children living in Baguida. She sells corn porridge served with cakes prepared in her home. She sells her products on the side of the road, and stocks up on supplies for her preparations once a month in the market. Adjovi is asking for this loan so she can order bags of corn, beignets and cakes to resell, and earn a sufficient profit margin to help her children with their education and personal development.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of corn, 50 beignets and 50 pieces of cake.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Houévi

texts.en:
Houévi F. was born in 1934 and now lives in the village of Atchamé. She has seven people to look after, all by herself. She has been a specialist in the weaving and marketing of mats, a business of hers for 20 years. It however does not manage to cover the basic needs of her family. This devoted woman has been trying to build a financial base through micro-loans, which have been beneficial and which she repays by the expected due date.

Concerned about resolving this problem and to increase her production of mats, she is asking for a loan of $800 to buy large quantities of raw materials while plentiful. The success of his project will allow her to weave and sell mats full-time. She can then augment her income and provide for her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1934, Madame F. Houévi vit aujourd’hui dans le village d’Atchamé avec sept (07) personnes en sa seule charge. Spécialiste dans le tressage et la vente des nattes, elle vit de cette activité depuis 20 ans et dont les revenus n'arrive pas à couvrir tous ses besoins élémentaires et ceux de sa famille. Cette dame dévouée tente de se constituer un fond de base à travers les petits crédits dont elle bénéficie et qu’elle rembourse dans les délais requis. Cette entreprise manque de matériels et de mains d’œuvres.

Dans le souci de résoudre ce problème et pour accroître la production des nattes, elle demande un crédit de $800 qui va lui servir à acheter les matières premières en grande quantité en cette période d’abondance. La réussite de ce projet lui permettra de tresser et de vendre en temps plein et d’augmenter son revenu pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy raw materials (for weaving)

loans.name: Asabe

texts.en:
Testimony: "The idea I had for business led me to look for people of like minds and then to form a cooperative with Urban Ministry. I began with $40 and my business has given me $10 per week of profit. I am grateful to UM as I can now assist my husband in taking care of some family needs."

Family: A married woman with six children

Current Income: I have an average income of $35.00 per month.

Business Plan: My goal is to be able to secure a place were I can have my own restaurant that will generate more income for me and my family.

Mrs. Asabe M. is part of the Rahama Cooperative and the loan is a group loan.

loans.use: Selling of basic food items needed in local communities.

loans.name: Mit

texts.en:
Mrs Mit S. is 39 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. Her husband is a fisherman. He earns four dollars a day. They have four children who are still students. 
Mrs Mit S. wants to purchase a motorcycle for her husband who works very far from their home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband who works far from their home

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen A. is a 33-year-old woman, married with 2 children. She deals provisions, drinks, frozen chicken and foodstuffs in Benin City, in the Edo State of Nigeria. She is seeking a $250 loan for expansion of her business and for purchase of provisions, drinks and frozen chicken. She has been in LAPO for 2 years and has 4 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks & frozen chicken for sale

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suandi

texts.id:
Nyoman Suardana, husband of Ni Ketut Suandi, is very supportive of her pig farming business. Especially after working with Dinari Foundation, and assistance in animal business was done by a veterinarian. Since she already have a mother pig and 6 piglets, loan would be used to buy wheat shell clippings for several months pig's feed, and repairs of the stalls. Cleaning the stall and feeding are done 2X/day, with objectives that mother pig and her 6 piglets are always healthy. Like always the case, Ni Ketut Suandi sells her 6 piglets for barbecue piglets at the age of 3 months. Feed expenses could reach Rp300,000 (about US$33). Total sales over 3 months could reach Rp1,000,000 (about $110), with a nett profit of Rp700,000 (about $77). This profit is useful to pay for family daily expense, and a teenage child.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Nyoman Suardana, suami dari Ni Ketut Suandi, sangat mendukung usaha ternak babi yang ditekuninya. Apalagi setelah bergabung dengan Yayasan DINARI dan mendapat pembinaan - pembinaan mengenai usaha ternaknya yang dilakukan oleh Dokter hewan. Karena sudah mempunyai Induk babi dan anaknya 6 ekor, dana bantuan dipergunakan untuk membeli dedak gandum untuk persediaan pakan babinya beberapa bulan dan untuk perbaikan kandangnya . Pembersihan kandang dan pemberian pakan dilakukan sehari dua kali dengan tujuan induk dan ke enam bibitnya selalu sehat. Seperti biasa Ni Ketut Suandi menjual ke enam bibit babinya untuk babi guling yaitu pada umur tiga bulan. Pengeluaran untuk biaya pakan mencapai Rp. 300.000,-. Total penjualan yang didapat selama tiga bulan mencapai Rp.1.000.000,- dengan kuntungan bersih Rp.700.000,-.Keuntungan ini sangat bermanfaat untuk mencukupi keperluan hidup sehari-hari dalam keluarganya dan seorang anaknya yang masih balita.

loans.use:
To buy pig's feed and repair stall

Membeli pakan ternak dan memperbaiki kandang

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
My name is Rehana B.. I have lived all my life in a small town, Raiwind. I am a mother of five kids. My husband sells vegetables on a cart. We have earlier invested a loan in this business which turned into better profits. He buys vegetables from a nearby vegetable market and has been in this business since his teens.

Now he wants to expand his business for which he requires a loan. I want to help my loan group members and get them loans. These women are very responsible and have never delayed paying their installments. Now, I introduce them to you: Rani B. needs a loan to invest in their vegetables business, Sufia B. requires a loan for their rice business, Mukhtar B. will invest her loan to buy cloth for her cloth selling business, Haneefan B. has a livestock trading business and plans to expand it.

loans.use: Expand vegetables business

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
K. Dilshod is 27 years old, married, and has two children. 

Dilshod is a cattleman. He owns 2 cows, and has been in the business already for 4 years. Dilshod's mother helps him. In addition to cattle raising, Dilshod grows plants and herbs like parsley, dill, coriander, and spring onions for sale. The business provides the main income for the family, allowing Dilshod not only to maintain, but also to improve its living conditions. 

Dilshod is planning to expand his business and to purchase another cow. For this purpose, he is asking for a loan of US$700 for a term of 12 months. Part of the loan Dilshod plans to spend on buying the cow, while the rest will be used for buying fodder. This is the second time that Dilshod is borrowing, and he is confident that, like previously, he will be able to pay the loan back in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow and of fodder

loans.name: Tekla

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! 36 year-old Tekla M. is single with one child, aged 9, and has two other dependents living with her because their parents cannot afford their care.

In 2007, Tekla established a beauty salon. Working six days a week, and assisted by one employee, she earns about $170 per month. Tekla now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase an additional hair steamer as well as haircare products. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $220. In the future, Tekla also plans to diversify her business and employ more staff. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase an additional steamer and haircare products for her salon.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 36 years old and lives with his family in the southern Lebanese town of Tyre. He has five children and makes a living selling yogurt and milk. This is the first time he has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua, and he intends to use the money to buy additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock to produce more yogurt and milk

loans.name: Ping Pong I Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Ping Pong I Village Bank consists of forty-one members.

Mrs. Yin S. is the Village Bank president. She is 49 years old and is a subsistence farmer who cultivates the field next to the village. She is the mother of three children. One works in a garment factory, another is working on the field with his parents, and the youngest is enrolled in state school.

The famiL. sometimes hires workers to work on their rice plantation, especialL. to plow, since they do not have enough draft animals. Last year, Mrs. Yin S. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to hire a worker to plow the rice field, but insects destroyed her rice. Now, the monsoon season is coming soon, so it is time to cultivate rice, but Mrs. Yin S. does not have enough money to hire a worker.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan to hire a worker who has a draft animal to plow the rice field, and to buy insecticides to avoid last year’s problems.

loans.use: To hire a worker to plow the rice field, and to buy insecticides to save her crops

loans.name: Bibiloik

texts.ru:
Bibloik M. lives in the town of Yavan. She lives with her family and takes care of the household. She is married and has 6 children. She is in agricultural business, and she owns a piece of land. She ususally plants wheat and flax. After collecting crops she prosesses and sells it. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She would like to obtain a loan so she could purchase fertilizers and corn seeds for the upcoming new season, since it is already time to collect wheat crops. She plans to pay off the loan within the next 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Мусоева Бибилоик живет в городе Яван. Домохозяйка . Живет со своей семьей . Она замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет землю . Засеивает пшеницу и лен. После получения урожая перерабатывает его и продает. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 20 лет. Хочет получить кредит для того . чтобы закупить удобрения и семена кукурузы для посева . Так как уже подходит врем я для сбора пшеницы.Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 18 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase natural fertilizers

loans.name: Filipe

texts.pt:
Filipe N. is 46 years old. He is married and has 4 sons -- the 20-year-old and the 18-year-old are on the 10th grade; the second youngest is 10 years old and he is on the 5th grade; the youngest one is 8 years old and he is on the 2nd grade. Filipe lives with his wife and sons and does not support anybody else. Filipe is from the Matutine district, located in the province of Maputo. He fled the district due to a civil war to the neighboring South Africa where he lived for 5 years. He, later, obtained a work contract back in the city of Maputo. Subsequently, he was transferred to Boane, district of the same province, and had his family relocated there as well. So, he left his residence in the city of Maputo and, at this time, he lives with his family in his own house in Boane. Filipe works as a human resources supervisor working between 7:00am and 4:00pm, from Monday through Friday. His salary is 3915,00mt and he is able to save 1600,00mt. This will be his third loan from Hluvuku which will be used to purchase construction material. His future plans is to improve his residence and rent it out after wards.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Filipe N. tem 46 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos com idade entre 20 anos o primeiro que estuda na 10ªClasse e segundo com 18 anos também na 10ªClasse, o terceiro com 10 ano e estuda 5ªClasse, o quarto com 8 anos e estuda na 2ªClasse, vive com a sua esposa e seus filhos e não sustenta ninguém mais. Filipe é natural do Distrito de Matutuine Provincia do Maputo, abandonou o distrito devido a Guerra civil e tinha se refugiado na Africa do sul pais visinho onde viveu 5 anos, e quando regressa foi parar na cidade de maputo, onde consegue um contrato de trabalho e por sua vez foi transferido para Boane distrito da mesma provincia e assim mais tarde foi buscar a familia para morar com ela. Assim deixou a residencia na cidade de maputo e neste momento tem outra sua própria residencia em Boane onde mora com a familia. Filipe trabalha como chefe dos recursos humanos e tem um horario das 7:00h até 16:00h da segunda a sexta feira. Tem um salário de 3915,00mt e consegue poupar mensalmente 1600,00mt. Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku qual pretende comprar material de construção. Tem com planos futuros reabilitar a residencia da cidade e posteriormente a rendar.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a house

loans.name: Paulina Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married, 63-year-old mother of six children. Julia and her husband have a carpentry shop in their house, located in the "April 16" Housing Development, with the help of her sons as well. Her carpentry shop requires machinery for different contracts and different clients. Julia also makes gelatins and other homemaD. products that she sells in her house and at the market.

Julia is a member of the Nueva Vida Village Bank. She needs a loan of 2,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles that she will invest in wood, laquer, etc. 

Julia's dream is to educate her children, to move forward, and to improve her life.

loans.use: invest in wood, laquer, etc.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.en:
The Las Margaritas communal bank is made up of eleven women and one man. Most of them have families of five (two parents and three children). Most are middle class, while some are from rural areas and have scarce resources. Most of the group lives in rented homes. They are involved in various economic activities: Maribel is a gym teacher; Juana and Eugenio sell sweets and cookies; Mery and Reyna own neighborhood stores; Alicia sells laundry detergent; Angelica has a liquor store; Ariana, Patricia and Jhovana sell cosmetics; Juana Alejandra is an elementary school teacher; and Pamela sells silpanchos (breaded, thin-sliced beef, a popular lunch or evening meal in Bolivia).

There is a fair amount of competition in all of these areas, but the group members remain competitive by quickly moving from market to market, offering a variety of merchandise and introducing new items frequently. Most of the group will use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.

Since this is not the group's first loan, most of the group members have credit experience already. Other members have participated in previous group loans at other microfinance institutions.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell (detergent, cosmetics, liquor, sweets) and ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria inicio el negocio para proveerse de dinero para la manutención de sus hijos, ya que tuve que hacerse cargo de sus 4 hijos. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 5 años cuando decidió junto con una comadre a poner un estanquillo de venta de tacos, quedándose posteriormente sola con el puesto y gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima, para tener un surtido adecuado de productos y que los clientes se sientan satisfechos con su servicio.
texts.en:
Maria launched her business in order to earn money for her children's basic needs, since she has to support all four of them. It began about five years ago, when she and a friend decided to set up a taco stand. Maira was later left as the sole owner of the stand, and thanks to her efforts her family has been able to get ahead.

She needs a loan of $575 to buy raw ingredients so that she can offer a wide variety of products in order to leave her customers satisfied. She will repay the loan in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw ingredients to make tacos

loans.name: Bethsabe

texts.es: Bethsabe tiene 38 años, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, que son  sus consentidos y la luz que la guía a seguir surgiendo en su negocio. Se separo del padre de sus hijos hace mucho tiempo, ahora vive junto a su madre, quien la apoya y quiere mucho, ambas se dedican a la venta de comida. Bethsabe es cada día motivada por el amor a sus pequeños, a quienes quiere darles lo necesario para que sigan adelante. Menciona que sola se encuentra mejor, sobre todo porque tiene en qué ocuparse, su negocio. Ahora quiere construir un kiosco o ampliar su pequeño espacio de comida, incluso mejorar la infraestructura, sin embargo para la realización de todo esto, necesita de un capital, que solicita en calidad de préstamo. Apoyemos a esta madre que demuestra sus ganas de seguir adelante, sin la ayuda de aquel hombre desinteresado e irresponsable.
texts.en:
Bethsabe is 38 years old, a single mother of three children, which she indulges as they are the light that guides her in her goal of continuing in her business. She separated from the father of her children a long time ago and now lives with her mother, who supports her and loves her very much. They both work at selling food. Bethsabe is motivated daily by the love for her little one, for who she wants to provide with what they need to continue to prosper. She noted that she is better off alone, especially since she has her business. Now she wants to build a stand or expand her small space where she sells the food, including improving the infrastructure. However she needs capital in order to accomplish all this, which she is requesting in the form of a loan. Let us support this mother that wants to keep moving ahead, without the help of that disinterested and irresponsible man.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To establish her business and have a stand built from which she can sell food.

loans.name: Mrs. Roatha Chhun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people in the Pou Roung Village Takeo Province in Cambodia have joined together for a village bank loan and they will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Roatha C. was selected as the village bank president. She is a grocer in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Nimal Thaong, is a construction worker. Although they have different businesses, they still cannot support the family well. In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Roatha C. is requesting a loan to buy piglets to start a new business. Mrs. Roatha C. is 38 years old and the mother of three children, who all attend the local school.

loans.use: Buy piglets to start a new business

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en: Joaquina is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Joaquina is 43 years old and has five children. Joaquina has a store in a rented location on Libertad Street, where she sells natural remedies that she buys in Lima. Sometimes she also buys grains, which she then sells in the city of Pisco. Joaquina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy grains and different kinds of flour. Joaquina dreams of starting her own laboratory to make natural remedies, that her children will graduate from college with professional degrees, and to travel to other countries with her children. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Joaquina es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Joaquina es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 5 hijos, Joaquina tiene una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado en el Jr. Libertad en donde vende medicina natural que compra en la ciudad de Lima, además en algunas oportunidades compra cereales que luego lo vende en la ciudad de Pisco. Joaquina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales y molidos. Joaquina sueña con tener un laboratorio de medicamentos naturales, sus hijos sean profesionales y viajar al extranjero con sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy grains and different kinds of flour

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Gifty Acquah is thirty-seven years old. She is divorced and a mother of four children: two boys and two girls. She lives with her children in a business community called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Some of her children are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high school. Gifty says she is the sole provider for her children’s needs. She says her ex-husband cares less about the children’s upbringing. She therefore works very hard to meet the children’s needs and, most importantly, to pay their school fees.

Gifty sells vegetables of all kinds, like tomatoes, peppers, onions, and garden eggs. She sells on a table top in front of her house. She says her target customers are the people in her community who walk all the way to the market everyday to buy such products. She buys from Kumasi and at times from farmers who come who to sell in the local market. She has been in business for ten years. Gifty wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk, like boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Bahri

texts.en:
B. Bahri is 46 years old. She is still working diligently to help her husband who works as a farmer. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle and also breeding sheep. She uses the profit to cover the family expenses and her children’s education fee. Bahri has 4 children. Her first child has already graduated University. The other ones are studying in school. The loan from IMON International will be used to purchase the cattle for expanding her business. She hopes that the business goes well and her family will have a better quality of life.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta C. is 65-years old and a rice grower. Despite her age, she is still strong and able to manage her farm business. She has workers who till the land. She has six children who help her manage her six-hectare rice field. Aside from farming, she also raises cows and pigs. Her husband, Wilfredo, cares for the farm animals.

Marieta is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. The loan will help her increase her yield and provide more inventory for her small sari-sari store. 

CEVI helps her grow and expand her business. Now, she enjoys having the CEVI credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sigifredo

texts.es:
Sigifredo inició el negocio por que necesitaba algo estable para obtener ingresos economicos. Comenzó el negocio  en diciembre del 2001 vendiendo abarrotes en pequeño, en un lugar de su casoa acondiciono e incio la venta de productos basicos,  en la actualidad ya cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes muy surtida.

El necesita un prestamo por MXN $10000 que pagara en 6 meses  para comprar mercancia y poder asi darle un buen servicio a sus clientes ofreciendoles los productos que ellos requieren.
texts.en:
Sigifredo started his business because he needed a stable source of income. He started his business in December of 2001 by selling groceries in an area in his house that he made into a small store. He sells basic products and his store is stocked with a variety of items. He needs a loan of $750 which he will repay over a 6 month period. He will buy merchandise and will be able to provide his customers with excellent service by offering them the products that they need.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Mrs. Noun C., 31, and her husband, Mr. La Chheng, 31, were married in 2003 and have one young daughter. The family lives along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Noun has been a garment factory worker for nine years. Her husband has been an aide-de-camp for five years. The couple is in the process of building their new house so Noun is asking for her first loan of $600 to finish the house and to use for her mother’s pig-raising business.

loans.use: To finish her house and for her mother’s pig-raising business.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena P., 33, is married with 5 children. She has 5 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 180 Tala (~120 USD). SPBD loans are Filomena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, weed killer, lawn mowing, knives and a wheel barrow

loans.name: Nulu Nakakande‘S Group

texts.en:
Nulu is the leader of the five members of the group. She is 48 years old and married with three children aged between 23 and 30. They are all married. She resides in and owns a five-roomed house where she is staying with four people. Nulu doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Nulu runs a hotel in Wankulukuku, one of the city suburbs. She sells meals to an average of 30 people a day, and works seven days a week. Nulu’s major monthly expenses include rent for the business, electricity and medication. She doesn’t incur extra transport cost to and from shopping as she buys from her place of work. She has been in this business for the last six years and sells to all categories of people. Her main challenges are increasing prices of meat and competition. Prior to this business Nulu sold sugar cane.

Nulu has been with MCDT (Micro Credit for Development and Transformation) for over five years and is requesting her twelfth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to pay rent for her business premises and also to buy more food for her restaurant. Nulu is aspiring to own two eating joints in town.

loans.use: To buy more food for her restauarnt and to pay rent

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes es una mujer trabajadora, que a sus 36 años es madre de 2 hijos, Ever de 11 y Dagne de 8 años, a los cuales cuida con mucho amor, vive en su propia casa y lo que más quiere es salir adelante. Cerca al terminal interprovincial de la ciudad de Puno, tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende combustible, con el cual abastece a todos los carros que se preparan para salir a las distintas provincias del departamento. Su puesto es muy concurrido y por lo general acaba con todo el combustible que vende, tiene un año en este negocio, el cual le ha alcanzado para alimentar a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que el dinero que gana no será suficiente para correr con los gastos de los estudios secundarios de su mayor hijo, es por eso que desea comprar un auto para ponerlo a trabajar como taxi. A ella le gusta conversar con sus clientes, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil permanecer todo el día en su negocio, ya que el olor del combustible es muy fuerte y termina mareándola, aun así Lourdes no decae en su afán de salir adelante y está dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en el cual es muy responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más combustible, para generarse mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a hard-working woman. At 36 years old she is the mother of 2 children. Ever is 11 and Dagne is 8 years old. She cares for them lovingly. She lives in her own house and she wants to get ahead more than anything. She has a small stand close to the interprovincial terminal of Puno where she sells fuel. She provides the cars that are preparing to leave for the different provinces of the region with fuel. Her stand is very popular and she generally sells all her fuel. She has been in this business for one year. It has helped feed her children and pay for their education. But she feels that the money she earns won’t be enough to pay for secondary school expenses for her older son. That’s why she wants to buy a car and use it as a taxi. She likes to talk with her customers and she enjoys doing it a lot. She finds it hard to stay at her job all day since the smell of fuel is very strong and ends up getting her dizzy. Even so Lourdes doesn’t falter in her wish to get ahead and she is willing to work hard to do it. This is her first loan with MFP. She knows she has to pay all her installments on time since she doesn’t want to cause problems for the members of her community bank where she is very responsible. She will buy more fuel with the thousand PEN she applied for to generate a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Eddy Pantaleon

texts.es: Eddy Pantaleón A. C. tiene 44 años de edad. La actividad económica de Eddy es la venta y destace de cerdos. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. El inicio este negocio por su familia porque su Papa administraba y realizaba el destace de cerdo, y así como Eddy desde muy pequeño le gustaba el trabajo, con el paso del tiempo el logra comprar sus propios cerdos y destazarlos para la venta en su comarca, Eddy es muy famoso en su comarca por vender unos deliciosos nacatamales y conversa contento con sus clientes que es un trabajo muy difícil pero lo que mas le gusta es ver la cara de satisfacción de sus clientes. Y es así que decide realizar un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos entre otros productos para la elaboración de sus nacatamales. El sueño de Eddy es tener su propio medio de transporte para sus animales.
texts.en:
Eddy Pantaleón A. C. is 44 years old. Eddy works selling and butchering pork. He has been dedicated to this business for more than 16 years. He began this business through his family because his father managed a business butchering pork and, from a young age, Eddy enjoyed the work. Over time, he was able to buy his own pigs and slaughter them for sale in his region. Eddy is very famous in his area for selling nacatamales (Central American tamales) and happily conversing with his customers. It is a difficult job but what he likes most about it is to see satisfied customers. As a result, he has decided to get a loan destined to be working capital for the purchase of pigs, among other products, so he can make his nacatamales. Eddy's dream is to have his own mode of transportation for his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Wilda

texts.es:
La socia Wilda, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 32 años de edad,  tiene 1 hijo y es conviviente y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta por catálogo de productos de belleza, ella visita las diferentes instituciones con sus catálogos y los ofrece y al cabo de 15 días ella puede pasar a dar los productos que le pidieron y en un tiempo de 2 semanas mas puede cobrar, ella requiere el préstamo para cubrir algunas pequeñas deudas en cuanto espera que sus clientes le pagen.

Nuestra socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Wilda is member of the communal bank "Siempre Unidos". She comes from the barrio Santiago in the city of Cusco. Wilda is 32 years old, has 1 son and lives together with her partner. She alternates her efforts between her household work and selling beauty products from catalogs. Wilda visits various salons to offer them her catalogs, and after 15 days she returns to deliver the products that the people from the salon have ordered. She then must wait 2 more weeks before she is able to charge her customers for the products. Wilda requires a loan to help her cover various small debts during this period in which she must wait for her customers to pay her. Wilda is very thankful for the opportunity to receive a loan that is offered to her by her communal bank, and she promises to complete all of her payments on time and in accordance with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital para comprar y vender productos de belleza.

loans.name: Meng

texts.en: Meng P., age 30, works in the weaving business, typically making $3 US per day. In Cambodia, the traditional method of weaving requires hard work and time to produce the best outputs that will receive competitive prices at the market. P. and her husband work hard to ensure that their family, including a seven-year-old child attending a local primary school, can live comfortably. Meng's husband works at home selling vegetables and snacks from their house, and, like Meng, makes around $3 US per day. Meng wants to take out a loan for $800 US so that her husband can expand his shop's inventory by buying rice and other goods. They plan to use the money for general household expenses and saving for their child's future education.

loans.use: Purchasing rice and other goods to sell in a home-based shop

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid M. has a lot of experience in cattle breeding because he has been observing it for more than 15 years. His wife helps him with his business. He is 51 years old, married and has two children. Vahid is a hardworking man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children.

Over time, he has increased his sales, and now he needs assistance investing in his business. The business has been going well and he would like it to continue to grow. Vahid has applied for a loan of $2000 US to buy young cattle. He and his wife thank you very much for the support you offer them to continue this business, and for helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Tamemsu group. They are small-scale business people and subsistence farmers from Massorie Village, which is about thirteen miles from Makeni. They have applied for a loan of Le 500,000 for each member. This will be their first loan from Kiva and SMT. With this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses so that sales and profit will also improve for them. The loan will help these people to look after themselves, feed and clothe their children, and pay their children's school fees. 

Jatu S. (left) is the leader of this group. Jatu is thirty years of age. She was born in a village called Maroki about seventeen miles from Makeni, but now lives in Masorie Village with her husband and four children. Jatu has one child in junior secondary school, two in primary school, and one that is too young for school. 

Jatu sells rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), groundnuts and clothing. With this loan, Jatu will buy eight barters of palm-oil (five gallons of palm-oil make a barter). Jatu buys the palm-oil in the villages surrounding Masorie Village at Le 50,000.00 per barter, and sells either in Makeni or in Freetown, he capital of Sierra Leone.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Mrs. Rorn Choem Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of twenty people, is located in Srae Kaes village in Kandal province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Rorn C. is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Yuon Vai, are farmers who owns 2.5-hectare (6.25-acre) field of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living.

With this plantation, they do not have enough money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field and they do not have rice seed yet. Thus, Mrs. Rorn C. decided to request a loan to pay for plowing and to buy rice seed to grow on the paddy field. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan.

Mrs. Rorn C. is 38 years old and is the mother of five children, two of whom are laborers while another two are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and to buy rice seed

loans.name: Elvita

texts.en:
Elvita C. is from the village of So. Pob. She is 50 years old. She is married. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.

In 2008, Elvita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional piglets to raise and sell in the future. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Elvita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets for raising

loans.name: Rhema Plus Group

texts.fr: Beya N. est présidente d’un groupe de 25 micro-entrepreneurs dénommé « Rhema Plus ». Elle est vendeuse de boissons dans son quartier situé au nord-est de Kinshasa. Elle est active dans cette affaire depuis 2004 avec un capital initial de $100. Sa bonne gestion ainsi que les bénéfices réinvestis ont fait prospérer l’activité qui lui génère aujourd’hui $50 par semaine. Beya est cliente fidèle qui a obtenu 4 fois les prêts chez l’IMF HOPE RDC et les a tous remboursés. Le prochain crédit lui servira à acheter d’autres casiers de boisson pour renforcer le stock en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un dépôt de boissons dans le but de rendre son affaire plus rentable. Beya est mariée et mère de 7 enfants âgés de 20 à 37 ans.
texts.en:
Beya N. is the president of a group of 25 micro-entrepreneurs called "Rhema Plus". She sells drinks in her neighborhood, located northwest of Kinshasa. She started this business in 2004, with an initial capital of $100. Her good management, as well as the profits she invested back, bolstered her business which now turns over $50 a week. Beya is a loyal client who obtained 4 loans from Kiva's partner, the MFI Hope RDC, and repaid them all. Her next loan will be used to buy additional cases of beverages, in order to bolster her stock and increase her revenue. She ambitions to open a drinks depot to make her business more profitable. Beya is married and the mother of 7 children, aged 20 to 37.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of beverages

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en:
Chingiz was born in 1957 and lives in Fuzuli region. He is married and has three children.

Seven years ago, Chingiz started this business. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving his house-repairing business.

loans.use: To buy necessary things to improve his business

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.en:
Dona Blanca Estela L. is 60 years old; she is not married, and she has two adult children who are independent of her.

Dona Blanca has a used clothing business which she started several years ago in order to have a way to support herself. There is a lot of competition in the clothing business and Dona Blanca reports it to be one of the challenges of her business.

Dona Blanca has a very good credit history with Fundacion Leon 2000, This loan will go toward the purchase of more used clothing inventory. She says that it will help her business and also her clients.

Her hopes for the future include being able to maintain her business and dreams of success for her children.

loans.use: More capital for business.

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es:
En el mercado Central del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Candida D. tiene su propio negocio de venta de especies de toda clase como canela, romero, albahaca, miel, arreglos florales, entre otros.
A pesar de su avanzada edad, ella continúa trabajando buscando la manera de cómo mejorar sus ingresos y así suplir sus necesidades. Ella se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace varios años y el crédito esta vez lo está solicitando para la compra de los productos de especies con el fin de continuar ofreciéndolos en su establecimiento en el mercado central de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Candida D. has a sales stall in Chinandega department's central market where she sells all kinds of spices like: cinnamon, rosemary, basil, honey, floral arrangements, among others. Despite her advanced age, she continues working and looking for ways to improve her earnings so as to meet her basic needs. She has been in this line of work for several years and the financing she is asking for now is to buy spices so that she can continue to offer them in her stall in Chinandega's central market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spices.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia F. earns her living through dressmaking. She is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Shopping Fabrica, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Anastacia’s husband, Efren, helps run the business and they have four children between the ages of 20 and 27 years old. The older two already work as teachers and are helping their younger siblings finish their college education. The two younger children are currently going to school and also help their parents with the business as part of their daily chores.

Anastacia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by making full use of her dressmaking skills. Now she earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities.

Anastacia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used to fund the operations of her dressmaking business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing 19,500 PHP for her 10th loan cycle, which she intends to use on her dressmaking business. Anastacia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family: to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en: In 2000, Abiola started her business selling wine and other juice products. She is happy doing the business as this has always attracted her to her customers. Abiola lives in Lagos. She is 43 years old and married to a printer. She has one child who is still growing up. Abiola wants to make her business bigger. She is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more juice products and wine to sell. She thanks all her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more juice and wine

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita G. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 52 years old. Juanita is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Juanita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Juanita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es:
La joven Martha S. tiene la edad de 30 años, casada y madre de 2 niños, es comerciante desde hace 9 años, anteriormente vendía tarjetas y recargas telefónica en su casa de habitación y desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa americana, ya que ella cuenta con la facilidad de que su mamá viaja y le trae la mercadería. Ella espera en un futuro invertir más y llegar a establecer una tienda de ropa en su casa de habitación.
Martha es el quinto crédito que se le otorga, trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 3 años y ella nos expresa que han sido de mucha ayuda tanto para su negocio, como para hacer unas mejoras en su casa de habitación, por lo cual se siente muy satisfecha porque le ha permitido que mejore su nivel de vida
texts.en:
Martha S. is 30 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She has been a merchant for 9 years, having previously sold cards and phone chargers out of her home. For two years now, she has been selling American clothing door-to-door. She has this opportunity because her Mother travels and brings her back the merchandise. She hopes to invest more into her business in the future and establish a clothing store in her home. This is the fifth loan granted to Martha, and she has been working with Ceprodel for 3 years. She tells us that this access to credit has been a great help to her business, as well as in making some improvements to her home. She feels very satisfied, since this financial assistance has helped her to improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (women's shirts, sandals, pants, purses).

loans.name: Cecilia Bañez' Group

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is from the village of Lutao. She is 49 years old and the leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Cecilia is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a livestock business venture in the agriculture sector. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Aside from her pig business, she also sells home-made longaniza (a pork sausage). Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2005, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her fourteenth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail O. is married with 4 children and she is 42 years old. She is a friendly and hard-working mother. She sells mouth-watering Nigerian cooked foods like rice and beans. She is well known in her community and this gives her joy because people patronize her cooked foods. She hopes to add more new recipes in her food to attract and retain more customers. She has been in this business for a long time. 

Abigail is requesting the loan amount of  NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and to sell

loans.name: Edith Waithira

texts.en:
Edith is 34 years old, married to Boniface and they have one son and two daughters between eight years and 15 years of age, respectively. Edith operates a green grocery business. Edith has been running the green grocery business for the past 15 years. She also does farming as her other source of income.

She was introduced to Kadet through an existing Kadet client. She plans to add cereal stock like maize, beans and green grams. Edith intends to purchase a piece of land with the extra profit generated from the business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open a big wholesale cereal store. She describes herself as a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and green grams to resell

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: K. Sylivia is 30 years old, married and a resident of Mayangayanga Nakifuma. She has no children but she has one dependent going to school. She has owned a retail shop for over eight years. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, soap, and so forth to sell. Her future hope is to expand this business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, salt, soap, and so forth

loans.name: Kabibi Kaingu

texts.en:
Kabibi Kaingu is a 30-year-old lady who lives with her husband and four children in Kibaoni Malindi, where she operates a retail shop selling items such as sugar, tea leaves, cooking fats, and detergents. This business has been in operation for the last two years and her target clients are the residents of the Kibaoni area. She normally earns a profit of Kshs 3,500 per month and also practices farming on the side.

This will be Kabibi's second loan with Kadet after having been introduced to it by an existing member. Half of the loan will enable her to restock her retail shop with items upon which she is running low, and the other half will be used to buy a cow and some goats. With the proceeds from this loan she plans to expand her business to wholesale status, increase her livestock, and pay school fees for her children. Kabibi hopes to ultimately own a big business that is stable.

loans.use: To restock the retail shop and buy a cow and more goats

loans.name: Union Warisata Group

texts.es:
Hugo M. de 25 años es transportista y es vecino de la zona Huayna Potosí, necesita el préstamo para hacer reparar su movilidad ya que es su instrumento de trabajo. Las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal Unión Warisatas, que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch,  cuentan con diversos negocios tales como: venta de tubos, celulares, ropa, atención de tienda de barrio, venta de comida y CDS. Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios y mejorar los mismos.

A la cabeza de su mesa directiva se organizan para llevar adelante su reunión y ponerse de acuerdo en el reglamento interno.
texts.en:
25-year-old Hugo M. is a shipper, near the community of Huayna Potosí. He needs a loan to repair his vehicle because it is for his livelihood. He works with the other members of the Warisitas Union Community Association, which is part of the German Busch Center. The Center is involved with many business such as the sale of pipes, cell phones, clothes, things for the needs of the neighborhood, food, and CDs. They all need the loan to invest in their businesses and improve them. At the head of the directing board, they organize to advance their meetings and agree on operating procedures.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Asset repair

loans.name: Gandolgor

texts.en:
Gandolgor is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family  live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent).  They have been living together in their current home for six years. Gandolgor operates a clothing trading business. She has been operating her business since 2007 and has steadily expanded her business. Gandolgor started her business with a working capital of 300,000 MNT. After three years of successful operations her working capital today stands at 7,000,000 MNT. She is planning on renting a retail counter in the future. 

Since Gandolgor started operating her business, her family's living conditions have improved. Gandolgor has been providing money for her family expenses. She is an open person with great communication skills. Gandolgor is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of clothing in Ereen, a Chinese border town, to resell  in the countryside.

loans.use: To purchase clothing apparel for her business

loans.name: Ruth Liliana

texts.es:
Ruth es casada, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Ruth junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de bicicletas en un local alquilado ubicado cerca del mercado central, Ruth inicio su negocio hace 5 años de manera ambulatoria y ahora ya tiene su local, en donde también brinda el servicio de reparaciones. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de repuestos de bicicletas.
El sueño de Ruth son tener un terreno para la construcción de su casa porque ahora vive en la casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Ruth is 28, married and has 2 children. She and her husband sell bicycles in a rented store located near the central market. Ruth started this business 5 years ago in a street market and now they have a store where they offer repair services. This loan will be invested in the purchase of bicycle spare parts. Ruth's dream is to have a plot of land to build her house because they currently live in the home of her parents-in-law.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Luz Cerito 3,4 Group

texts.en:
Cornelia is the coordinator of her group Luz Cerito (Guiding Light), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in L. Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town, north of the capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two children.

Cornelia is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited to invest in her business selling various snack foods. She plans to use this loan to purchase sweets to sell in her stand. She will use the profits to invest in her business with the goal of one day having a cafeteria.

loans.use: to buy candy to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy large bags, blouses, and T-shirts with a collar

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: To make a living, Rebecca C. runs a general store selling household items in her community. She is 55 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Southwestern. Rebecca has been in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2004, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000. She is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be her eighth loan from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Gotov

texts.en:
Gotov C. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and son in the Govi-Altay province in western Mongolia. His son attends a local high school while his wife helps him out with the business. The family's living conditions are good and this is possible because of his consumer goods trading business at a local market. 

Gotov sells a variety of clothes and garments to customers. He purchases most of their goods from Beijing, China, once or twice a month depending on sales and transports them back to the market to sell. Gotov started his business in 2002 with the working capital of 1,200,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) and has quickly established himself in the local business community. 

In 2004, he received a 600,000 MNT loan from Xacbank and paid the loan off in full, on time. Now his working capital exceeds 8,000,000 MNT. Gotov and his family hope to soon expand their business and increase their earnings. 

Gotov is a gentle, hardworking and neat man. He says, “I am trying my best to save money for my son's education and enlarge my business in the future. I wish I would have a small clothes store in my town.” 

He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes and warm garments to sell for the upcoming autumn season.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Mrs. Channy C., 38, and her husband, Mr. Chan Pich, 37, have been married for ten years and have two children — one son and one daughter both young. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Channy has been a garment factory worker for three years, while her husband has been a mason for fifteen. She is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting and put an additional on her house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and put an addition on her house.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet B. lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, all of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (her sister's children). Annet has a business of a pub.  She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days a week. 

Annet works from home and sells to all kinds of people but at retail prices. She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer, soda and a jerrycan of local gin. She also generates additional income through food sales. The main business challenges for Annet include seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to put up her own house and to own a fully stocked bar. Annet rents her home; she has access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer, soda and a jerrycan of local gin

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
La Sra. María Julia Rodríguez vive en la Comunidad del Manzano, Los Clavos.
Ella es una Señora que compra y vende Ganado, tiene 10 años de experiencia en el rubro ganadero y ha tenido Buenos resultados en sus negocios.
Ella va a utilizar el crédito para comprar terneros de  desarrollo y posteriormente venderlos ya que ese es el negocio al que se dedica.
A la fecha lleva 02 créditos con CEPRODEL, de los cuales el anterior lo cancelo muy bien en tiempo y forma.
Ella habita con su esposo y su niña y junto con el que también es ganadero se dedica a la compra venta del mismo.
texts.en:
María Julia Rodríguez lives in the town of Manzano, Los Clavos.  She buys and sells livestock.  She has 10 years experience in this trade and has had good results in her business.

She will use the money from this loan to buy calves that she can raise and resell.  She has had two previous loans through CEPRODEL and repaid both on time.

She lives with her husband and daughter.  Her husband also buys, sells, and raises livestock.

loans.use: Calves

loans.name: Cleide

texts.es:
Cleide es socia del Bancomunal Santa Rita, tiene 40 años, es casada y madre de 2 hijos de las edades de 16 y 10 años, los cuales actualmente están estudiando. Cleide y su esposo (carpintero) se dedican ala fabricación de muebles como son sillas, mesas, roperos, cómodas, etc., actividad que lo realizan en su misma casa desde hace  más de 15 años. 
La dificultad que ha tenido en algunas ocasiones es al entregar los pedidos, ya que no cuenta con movilidad propia pero por lo demás les va muy bien.
El préstamo que solicita lo va ha emplear en la compra de Tripley, Madera, Bisagra, laca, cola, etc.
Cleide agradece a Finca Perú por que gracias a los préstamos que le han ofrecido a podido comprar su terreno, hacer su casa y formar su propia microempresa, aprendió a ahorrar y a ser puntual en todo.
Su meta ahora es poder comprar un carro para poder transportar los muebles.
texts.en:
Cleide is a member of the Santa Rita Community Bank. She is 40 years old, is married, and is the mother of two children, ages 16 and 10, who are in school. Cleide and her husband, a carpenter, make furniture, including chairs, tables, wardrobes, dressers, etc. They have been pursuing this activity in their home for 15 years. 

Delivering their orders can sometimes be difficult, because they do not have their own vehicle. Aside from this, their work is going well. They are requesting this loan to buy wood, hinges, lacquer, glue, etc. Cleide is thankful to Finca Perú for the loans that they have offered her to buy her land, build her house, and build her own business. She has learned to save money and to be punctual in her repayments. 

Her goal is to save enough so that she can buy a car to transport the furniture.

loans.use: To buy wood, hinges, lacquer, glue, etc.

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita S. owns a farm and grows rice and root crops, in the town of Trento Agusan Del Sur.  With the additional farm supplies, she hopes to increase her harvest. In that way, she will be able to earn a higher income.

Her main goal is to expand her business to become more financially stable in the future. Any additional income will be reinvested into her business and support her family’s needs.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Luisa Esperanza

texts.es: Luisa Esperanza tiene 53 años, su actividad es la venta de muebles. Desde hace 14 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella es una mujer muy luchadora y triunfadora. Inicio como medio de ingreso para mantener a su hijo que está a su cargo, pues siempre está al pendiente de lo que sus clientes le soliciten, ya que es una amplia variedad de productos, como sillas, comedores, escritorio, roperos y mesas. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima ya que se acerca una buena temporada.
texts.en: Luisa Esperanza is 53 years old.  She has a business selling furniture.  She has been in this business for 14 years.  Luisa Esperanza is a fighter and a winner.  She started this business to support her child who is in her care.  She always keeps an ear open for what her customers are requesting since it is a wide range of products such as chairs, dining room furniture, desks, closets and tables.  She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials since a good season is approaching.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita O. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Merlita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlita owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services of many kinds appliances like refrigerator & television as her husband is a repairman to local community members. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed to provide service. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed to provide service

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is twenty-eight years old and married with one 18 month old child. He is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya where he has been farming for 6 years. His farm produces milk, maize, beans, vegetables and potatoes which he sells to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farming to cater for the needs of his family.

He has requested this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him take care of the basic needs of his family and also invest in other businesses. Fluctuations in the market prices of farm produce and diseases which are too costly to treat have been his biggest challenges. In the future, he plans to venture into zero grazing and improve his milk production.

He hopes that Juhudi will continue funding farmers in order to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: 70 - Thon 1 - Quang Hung Group

texts.en:
Hue P. T. (141) is a 28 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Hue is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 70 - Thon 1 - Quang Hung (18-01-70 Quang Hung).

Hue is married and has 1 infant-aged child.  To making a living, Hue owns and operates a business venture raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Hue has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,800,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Hue joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hue is requesting for her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hue plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. T. Tinh (142) is a 21 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

2.  N. T. Hien (143) is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 4,428,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3.  N. T. Hang (144) is a 48 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

4.  N. T. Diep (145) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

5.  N. T. Huong (146) is a 50 year-old female who is requesting a 4,428,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

6.  T. H. Hoa (147) is a 20 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

7.  N. T. Tham (148) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy different kinds of thread and cloth.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman with nine children, six of whom graduated from school, while three still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees.

She has operated a firewood selling business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Sidi faces a major challenge of competition and high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to sell wholesale in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 30 years old and married and supports her family by operating a fishing business. She lives in Daan Bantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $200.
