Arlene is borrowing 11,000 PHP so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment.  This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Arlene aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Josselyn

texts.es: La Srta. Josselyn es soltera, tiene 20 años de edad,  Josselyn estudia Diseño de Modas en un instituto de prestigio que le ha permitido trabajar como diseñadora de modas en una empresa donde realiza las funciones de diseñar en computadoras y también cose y crea modernos diseños de ropa, ella eligió esta profesión porque  es su vocación y también le generara mejores ingresos económicos, el sueño de Josselyn es brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y de alguna forma devolverle a ellos todo lo que hicieron por ella pero lo mas importante ser una gran profesional, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar su matrícula y prácticas profesionales. Sabemos que Josselyn  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Ms. Josselyn is single and 20-years-old. She is studying fashion design at a prestigious institute that has allowed her to work as a fashion designer at a  company that designs on computers and also sews and creates modern clothing designs. She chose this profession because it is her vocation and also because it generates good income. Josselyn's dream is to give her parents a higher quality of life and somehow give back to them for all that they have done for her. What is most important is for her to be a great professional with the goal of continuing to grow. The loan will be used to pay tuition and for professional experience. Edaprospo (Kiva field group) knows that Josselyn will meet her goals with hard work and effort and that their loans will help her.

loans.use: tuition and professional experience

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah is 29 years old, married and blessed with a six-year-old child.  She runs a garage to earn her daily bread. She has been engaged in the business for eight years. In addition, she runs a retail shop. Since Zipporah joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to stock her garage and her retail shop. She hopes to own a car and a petrol station for better income in the future. She has requested a loan of 40,000 kes to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.en:
This group of 11 entrepreneurs live in the same neighbourhood in the Saint Cecile district of Cotonou, Benin's economic centre. This is their second loan with ALIDE, following the successful repayment of their first. They have agreed to support each other in their businesses and loan repayments.  

Josephine (with her hand raised in the photo) is 25 years old and lives with her husband Gamei, a fisherman. Together they support their three children.  Since the age of 11 Josephine has worked selling sandwiches. This loan will enable her to purchase bread, butter, avocados and condiments from the local bakery. Her aim in the long term is to build her business to become self-sufficient. She states that her greatest attributes are her dynamism and creative spirit in building her business.

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her brother in his agriculture business. He owns a small piece of land and grows different seasonal crops in it to earn money for the family. Through the loan, he will buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides to get maximum output from his land and to gain maximum profits. 

Noreen is a mother of three children. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  Her husband's name is R.. He is also involved in the agriculture business and is an expert in his work. 

Noreen is a very caring lady who prefers to stay at home and do her household responsibilities. She is a very responsible person by nature and pays her responsibilities effectively.  She lives in Khanewal, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Shanti nagar in a two-room brick house with her family for the past 20 years. 

She is hopeful that the loan investment will help her brother in expanding his business and increasing his income. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Noreen.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 42 years old; she has 5 children aged between 5 and 18. Her husband is a driver. Charlotte has been selling clothes for 10 years. This business has enabled her to pay her children’s school fees. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to add to her business and, hence, make more profit which will help her improve her living standard.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some animals to be able to grow his business and attract more customers.

loans.name: Gulom

texts.en:
Gulom is a hardworking married man. His wife is a housewife and does not work outside the home.    Gulom works as a taxi driver to make a living to provide for his family’s needs.  He works from early morning until late at night.  He services the route between Kanibadam and Khujand, and earns a good daily income of about 100 – 150 TJS.  

Gulom would like to get a loan of 1000$ USD to convert his vehicle to (compressed natural) gas.  That way, he will save more money since the price of (natural) gas is cheaper than the price of petrol.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to install gas equipment

loans.name: Kyamwasha Bakyara Kwebisaho Group

texts.en: Twenty-six year-old Cornelious has been selling bricks for the last 10 years in Ntungamo.  Cornelious is also a builder and he says he entered this business to supplement his income. His hard work has been paying off, as manifested in the increasing demand for his bricks. The early years were a bit stagnant, but the business started growing by leaps and bounds after a period of 3 years. He says this business generates him 450,000 shillings monthly as profit. He says he is going to use this loan to purchase better brick-making machines.

loans.use: to purchase better brick-making machines

loans.name: Manchita

texts.en:
Manchita is 53 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom are in school. Manchita is in the agricultural business of raising hogs in the Philippines. Manchita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Manchita has been raising hogs for one year, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

In the future, Manchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 31-year-old single mother of two. She earns a living by supplying sand and cement to construction companies and has been engaged in her business for seven years. Beatrice also earns extra income by running a taxi business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her businesses.

Beatrice is requesting a loan of 70,000 KES to buy cement and sand. In the future, she hopes to get more cars for her taxi business and to open a driving school.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 1 child. 
Letty has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Letty is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Letty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida shares the financial burden with her husband by operating a "Pranday" (an ornament used to tie back the hair) making and selling business. She gets orders from different cosmetics shops in the market and fills their orders to earn profits for her family. 

Her husband is a shoe-maker by trade. He makes very good quality shoes for his customers. He receives orders from different shoe stores in the city and fills their demand on time at a profit.

Zubaida is the mother of six children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. He has a large order to fill and Zubaida hopes that the loan will help him purchase shoe making materials in bulk to be able to fill the order. 

He is very experienced in his business and has been doing it for the past 20 years. Zubaida is confident about her  husband’s improved financial business condition after the investment.

loans.use: To buy shoe-making materials for her husband's shoe-making business.

loans.name: Fotima's Group

texts.en: Fotima is the leader of this group. She is 37 and married. Her husband works in Russia as a constructor. Each month, he transfers to Fotima 5,000 soms. Fotima takes care of four sons; the youngest son goes to a kindergarten, and the other three sons study at school. In order to earn additional money, Fotima breeds cattle. At the moment, she keeps a cow and two calves. Selling the dairy products and cattle, she earns 10,000 soms per month. This profit made her able to pay for her children’s education. Fotima applied for the loan because she needs financial funds for purchasing feed for cattle. In the future, she wants to give her children a good education. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cattle.

loans.name: Ines Marlene

texts.es:
Ines Marlene tiene 37 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de dieciseis, trece y de once años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.
Ines se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poderse comprar una casa.En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Ines Marlene is 37 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children (ages 16, 13, and 11) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo, which is part of Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Ines is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells her products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

Ines is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. The help from this loan will make it easier for her to acquire supplies.

Her dream is to buy a house. During her free time, Ines enjoys practicing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Jessica's Group

texts.en:
Jessica’s group is comprised of six hard working women. Jessica is 22 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Jessica has a tailoring business, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials, and an electrical machine for making clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jessica hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. In the future, Jessica hopes to expand her business. Jessica is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials, and an electrical machine for making clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jaime Acisclo

texts.es:
A sus 31 años de edad Jaime sueña con tener su propio negocio, y es por tal motivo que hoy solicita un préstamo, hace 8 años aproximadamente  aprendió a fabricar artesanías en un material llamado mimbre y con éste fabrica todo tipo de muebles, teniendo este conocimiento decidió montar su negocio y debe comprar toda la maquinaria y la materia prima que requiere para realizar los primeros productos y comenzar a vender para generar ingresos y hacer crecer poco a poco su negocio.

Jaime sueña con tener a futuro un gran negocio, que sea reconocido en el sector y que sus clientes lo distingan por la buena calidad y el mejor servicio. Para comenzar con este proceso deberá comprar máquinas como: Sin fin, radial, taladros, soplete, grapadoras, entre otras. Pero el capital es muy alto y el no cuenta con esta suma de dinero. Por lo que espera recibir el crédito y emprender su negocio con la ilusión te tener un mejor futuro y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 31 years of age, Jaime dreams of having his own business and because of this he is currently requesting a loan.  About eight years ago he learned how to craft items out of wicker.  He makes all types of furniture.  Having this knowledge, he decided to start his own business for which he needs equipment and raw material to produce his first items and sell them to generate income and grow the business.

Jaime wants to have a large business in the future, recognized in the area, and identified by his customers for the good quality of the products and good service.  To start this process he needs to buy machines such as: circular saw, drill, blowtorch, stapling gun, and others.  The cost of these is very high and he currently does not have this sum of money.  He is wanting to get the loan and be able to start his business with the hope of having a better future and improved quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase machinery and raw materials.

loans.name: Cyr Conde

texts.fr:
Client de 38 ans, marie et père de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 9 et 15 ans. A l'arrêt de ses etudes universitaires, il se lance dans la vente des vêtements pour homme, comme des pantalons, des chemises, des polos, et tous habits a la mode.
Ayant déjà bénéficié de 3 cycles de prêts a Hope Congo, il a rembourse avec succès et fait des épargnes considérables, ses ventes ont augmente de 15000frs a 75000 frs par jour.
A l'octroi de ce 4e cycle, il va renforcer le stock de sa marchandises en achetant des pantalons en jeans, en lin , de la gabardine, des chemises avec manchettes et sans manchettes, des polos et T shirts a la mode.
Tres ambitieux, il est très satisfait de son activité et c'est son travail selon ses dires , il prend  en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et s'occupe valablement de sa famille;
A l'avenir , il pense ouvrir une boutique de prêt a porter et effectuer des voyages pour aller aussi s'approvisionner a l'étranger.
texts.en:
This client is 38, married and the father of two children 9 and 15 years old. When he stopped his university studies, he began selling clothing for men such as pants, shirts, polo shirts, and all sorts of fashionable clothes. 

Having already received  three loans from Hope Congo, he has reimbursed with success and put aside considerable savings.  His sales have gone from 15,000 francs to 75,000 francs per day. 

On receiving the fourth loan, he is going to add to his stock of merchandise by buying jeans, linen pants, gabardine pants, shirts with cuffs and short-sleeved shirts, polo shirts, and stylish T-shirts.

Very ambitious, he is also very satisfied with his business and says this is his sort of job. He pays for school fees for his children and takes good care of his family. In the future, he is considering opening a ready-to-wear shop and making trips to purchase merchandise overseas.

loans.use: to buy jeans, gabardine pants, polo shirts, shirts and T-shirts.

loans.name: Bokk Xol Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 07 JUIN 2001. Il  est  constitué de dix femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Seynabou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge trois autre enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits et légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 7, 2001. It consists of ten women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is trade.

Mrs. Seynabou is the head of the group. She is at the far right of the photo with a hand raised. She is 57 years old and married without children. She does however look after three children left in her care by relatives.

She sells fruits and vegetables. She has a good command of her activity, having been in the business for several years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her working capital and better expand her activities.

She will use the profits to improve her family’s living conditions (healthcare, food, clothing, etc.).

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a single mother of four children ages 18,15,12 and 1 years old child. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past one year. She gets a monthly income of KES 18,000.

This is her first loan term in KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to buy stock of charcoal for resale.She will use the anticipated profit to support her family's budget and pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to expand her business to a greater level and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: El señor Gregorio se dedica a la Fabricación, arreglo y reparación de zapatos,  su taller se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, el vive por la zona de Pasanqueri, en casa familiar en la casa de su hermana, el se dedica  ya varios años a esa actividad,   tiene un hijo pero el Sr. Gregorio es soltero,  solicita el crédito para la compra de material para la fabricación y arreglo de zapatos, como cuero, hilos, etc.  Y así de esta manera poder  incrementar  su capital  de trabajo y también realizar  mantenimiento a su maquina de costura, es una persona joven y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Gregorio makes, mends and repairs shoes.  His workshop is located in his own home.  He lives in Pasanqueri district, in his sister's house.  He has been in this business for several years.  Gregorio has a son but he is single.  He is requesting this loan to buy materials for making and mending shoes such as leather, thread, etc.  In this way, he will be able to increase his working capital and also have maintenance work carried out on his sewing machine.  Gregorio is a young, hard-working person who feels grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as leather and thread

loans.name: Namuma A Group

texts.en:
Kenneth is the facilitator of the Namuma A group. Kenneth and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Kenneth takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Kenneth had a good maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Kenneth was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Kenneth and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Kenneth will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Namuma A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Kenneth is pictured with his group members. The field officer appears on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los claveles”, del Distrito D. picota, Provincia D. Picota, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años, estudió la carrera D.  técnica en Enfermería, actualmente  trabaja como docente en un colegio D. su localidad. Tiene 03 hijos, él  mayor tiene 32 años, el segundo 26 años y son independientes y la  menor tiene 22 años D. edad que está a su cargo es estudiante del nivel superior.
Por iniciativa propia incursiona en la venta D. productos D. belleza, al inicio era ayudante D. venta se dio cuenta que siendo directa tenía mucho más descuentos y regalo por parte D. la empresa. Inicia con un capital D. 300.00 nuevos soles que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le brindó. 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 400.00, comprará más cosméticos e incrementará su stock D. productos como: lápices labiales, talcos para el  cuerpo, perfumes, colonias, cremas faciales para  así satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes, amigos (as), familiares, y vecinos. 
La Sra. Ana Mercedes es una mujer muy  trabajadora, anhela ampliar su negocio;  esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella. Y además se siente muy contenta por las sesiones educativas que se realizan y por la unión que existe entre las socias.
texts.en:
Ana Mercedes belongs to the communal bank “Los claveles,” Picota province, department of San Martín. She is 54 years old, married, and studied for a career in nursing. Right now she works as a docent at the local college. She has 3 children. The oldest is 32 years old, and the second is 26. They are living on their own. The youngest is 22 years old and in her care; she is an upper level student.  

Through her own initiative she began selling beauty products. In the beginning she was a sales assistant, and she realized that by being in charge she would have many more discounts and gifts from the company. She began with starting capital of 300.00 nuevos soles that Movimiento Manuela Ramos provided her. 

With this loan of S/. 400.00 she will buy more cosmetics and increase her stock of products like lip liners, talc body powder, perfumes, colognes, and facial cream to meet the needs of her clients, friends, family members, and neighbors. 

Ana Mercedes is a very hardworking woman, and she wishes to expand her business. She is very thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her. Furthermore she is very satisfied with the educational sessions that they put on and for the linkages that exist between the members.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa Victoria sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y ella sigue ejerciendo su profesión pero ahora empezó con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes. En esta oportunidad Rosa Victoria solicita el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como cuyes.  

Rosa Victoria está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Rosa Victoria is still participating in the communal bank "Comuzone III", from the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco. She is also still practising her profession but now she is has started a business of breeding small animals, such as guinea pigs. On this occasion Rosa Victoria is requesting the loan to buy more small animals like guinea pigs.

Rosa Victoria is very pleased to be receiving the loan and she promises to make all her repayments.

loans.use: to buy more small animals such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Daniel Alonso

texts.es: El joven Daniel se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y caballero desde hace 6 meses a sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos; anteriormente el joven Daniel se dedicaba a vender electrodomésticos para obtener ingresos adicionales. Hoy día, el joven Daniel requiere de la compra de surtido de ropa para poder cumplirles a sus clientes con los pedidos de fin de año. El sueño del joven Daniel es tener su propio almacén y dedicarse tiempo completo a este.
texts.en: Daniel has been selling men’s and women’s clothing for six years, to his neighbors and co-workers.  He used to sell appliances to earn an extra income.  Now he needs to buy an assortment of clothing to be able to fill his customers’ end of the year orders.  His dream is to have his own store and dedicate all of his tome to it.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Angel David

texts.es:
Angel David tiene 55 años de edad es casado tiene 1 hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo de 24 años de edad en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC TENDAL está conformada  por 11 integrantes entre hombres y mujeres se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la cooperativa.

Angel se dedica a la Agricultura a los sembríos de naranja, cacao además trabaja jornal diario y es partidario.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en  San José del Tambo cada mes. Solicita el crédito para poder terminar con los arreglos de la casa donde el vive.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá culminar con los arreglos y poder vivir tranquilo con el hijo y la esposa.
El sueño es  comprar un terreno para tener sembríos propios.

Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado son las vías en mal estado.

En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse más al trabajo, es respetuoso, responsable y le gustan las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Angel David, age 55, is married and has one child.  He lives with his wife and his 24 year old son in Chillanes in the Bolívar province.

The Tendal communal bank is comprised of 11 members, men and women who are located 45 minutes from the Cooperativa.

Angel is a farmer.  He devotes himself to growing oranges and cacao.  He also works as a day laborer on other people’s land.
He makes his purchases and his sales every month in San José del Tambo.

He is requesting the loan to be able to complete the repairs on the house where he lives.  With the help of the loan he will be able to finish the repairs, and he will be able to live peacefully with his son and his wife.

His dream is to buy some land in order to have his own crops.  The challenges he has faced are the roads, which are in a bad state.

In his free time he likes to spend more time on his work.  He is respectful, responsible, and he likes the Carnaval festivities.

loans.use: to complete the repairs on the house where he lives.

loans.name: Nyanchick

texts.en: Nyanchick is a 35-year-old married woman with one child who is not in school. For four years, she has been selling fish in Bor, South Sudan. Nyanchick is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 40 year old woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan who helps support 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to make home improvements. She will be buying new furniture and repainting her house.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Gisela Judith

texts.es:
Gisela es una mujer de 41 años de edad, comparte su vida al lado de su esposo y sus 2 maravillosos hijos de 4 y 14 años a quienes quiere muchísimo y por quienes lucha cada día para poder brindarles una vida digna y sobre todo brindarles mucho amor. Gisela aprendió sobre el trabajo desde muy joven, ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y debido a ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, aunque le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial.

Día a día Gisela trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, el cual pudo iniciar con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 20 clientes cada día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad a un precio cómodo.

Gisela está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio arroz, azúcar, menestras, entre otros, de esta manera ella podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena profesión a sus hijos y tener una casa propia ya que actualmente es alquilada”.
texts.en:
Gisela is a 41-year-old woman. She lives at the side of her husband and their two wonderful children, aged 4 and 14. She strives every day in order to provide her children with a worthy life, and above all, a lot of love. Gisela learned about work from a very young age since her parents had very little financial resources. Because of this, she only managed to study up to the 5th grade of her secondary education; however, she would have liked to have studied Industrial Engineering. 

Gisela works day-to-day in her small grocery store which she managed to start with a lot of effort and savings. She works in her business around 10 hours a day and can attend up to 20 customers each day; she believes that her business is going well because she is very kind to her customers, and above all, because she offers quality products at a decent price. 

Gisela is very grateful for the Kiva lenders since thanks to the support that they have offered her, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, stews, etc. This way she will be able to have a greater variety of products to offer and to keep fighting to accomplish her greatest dream: to provide her children with good careers and to have her own home since her current one is rented.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, and tuna, among other things.

loans.name: Sedjrogande Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEDJROGANDE est composé de trois  personnes qui sont des amies et sont dans le même groupe de tontine. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Florentine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Florentine est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Florentine est mariée à un conducteur de taxi du nom de François. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains  scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Florentine vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Florentine prépare de la nourriture( riz, igname) depuis quinze ans. Parallèlement à cette activité Florentine vend également du charbons de bois. Florentine s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Florentine ensemble avec les membres du groupe SEDJROGANDE, sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du riz, de l'igname et  charbons de bois.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
G. Victoria owns a small shop selling household items. She was able to open her business thanks to a loan from her husband who sent $300 from Italy where he works. Every day from 7am until 9pm Ms. G. runs her store, which happens to be located in her house. Victoria is applying for this loan so she can purchase marketing material that is going to highlight her product specials and exhibit any goods she might be featuring. With the proceeds of the loan she is hoping to improve the standard of living of her children and save up to pay for their education. She says it is hard living as a single mother, but she has no desire to move to Italy. This 32 year-old entrepreneur who lives in Provincia de los Rios wants nothing more than to succeed in business and give her kids a better life than she had growing up.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Victoria is applying for this loan so she can purchase marketing material that is going to highlight her product specials and exhibit any goods she might be featuring.

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Mr. S. Komi, born on January 23 1980 in AFAGNA in the Vo, is a good-natured person, hard working and full of talents. He is married and father of one (01) child and is responsible for five (05) persons. He is a barber and a repairman for mobile phones. After abandoning his secondary education because of lack of funds, he tried several commercial activities before settling in hairdressing. He then specialized in repairing cellular phones.

He would like to sell mobile phones and accessories, but lacking the funds he is requesting a financial help of $800 to realize this project. This loan would first let him achieve his dreams and allow him to make a profit likely to get him out of poverty.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Komi, né le 23 janvier 1980 à AFAGNA dans le Vo est une personne aimable, travailleur et plein de talent. Il est marié et père d’un enfant avec cinq (05) personnes à charge. C’est un coiffeur et réparateur de portable. Après avoir laissé ses études secondaires pour faute de moyens, il a entrepris plusieurs activités commerciales avant de se stabiliser dans la coiffure, puis après s’est spécialisé dans la réparation de postes cellulaires.

Il compte vendre des portables et des accessoires, mais faute de moyens, il sollicite une aide financière de $800 afin pouvoir réaliser le projet qu’il veut mener. Ce crédit demandé va lui permettre d’abord de réaliser ses rêves et de faire des bénéfices susceptibles de le sortir de la pauvreté.

loans.use:
Sales of mobile phones and accessories

Vente de téléphones portables et accessoires

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
María Elena is married and has 4 children who are 26, 20, 19 and 8 years old. Her husband works as a bricklayer and his salary is low and varies, since there are some seasons when there is no construction. During these times, the family's income is reduced. For this reason, she has decided to help with the family's expenses by opening her own business, which she started when a friend invited her to sell beauty products. Her sales have gone well, and have been increasing, as well as her customers.

María Elena is requesting a loan for US$275 to purchase merchandise and to have a supply of products and be meet the demand she has had recently. María is offering to pay this loan in a period of 4 to 8 months and hopes for your support to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

María Elena esta casada y tiene 4 hijos de 26, 20, 19 y 8 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil y su sueldo es bajo y variable, ya que hay temporadas en las que no hay obras y por ello no hay ingresos familiares, por ello ella decidió ayudar al gasto familiar abriendo su propio negocio, el cual lo comenzó cuando una amiga la invitó a vender productos de belleza y así ella comenzó con su negocio. Le ha ido bien y sus ventas se han incrementado y sus clientes también.

María Elena está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 275 para comprar mercadería y tener surtido sus productos, además de poder cumplir con los pedidos que ya tiene actualmente. María ofrece pagar este préstamo en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses y espera de tu apoyo para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. sells fresh produce at her shop in Fao, where her vegetables like green peppers, string beans, and cabbage are sold alonside local coconuts. Maria will use her loan to expand her business model by selling charcoal as well as rice and cooking oil. All of Maria's nine children are studying either in public school or for a profession. Rafael (21), Emania (18), Yela (16), Quetrina (13), Mari (13), Chelene (11), Vitali (6), Ingrid (5), and Jose (8) live with Maria and her husband Felix. This loan will help her grow her business to support her large family. These loans help a lot, Maria says. With another microloan, her business can grow and prosper.

Note: Maria is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $825 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. As soon as Maria pays off her current loan with Esperanza, this loan will become active.

loans.use: Business model expansion

loans.name: Laurida

texts.es:
Business Description

Laurida began her business 1 year ago. The products she sells are: chuzos, (an Ecuadorian skewered-meat snack), chicken wings and roasted corn on the cob. She provides her customers with personal service every day from 4 to 10 pm.

Purpose of Loan

Laurida needs the loan to invest in the purchase a small display cabinet, more products and to fix up her business. This way she will be able to improve her business’ image and offer a wider variety of good to her customers.

Personal Information

Laurida is 58 years old. She has 1 son who is an adult and lives independently. Laurida began her business with a small amount of borrowed capital. As time has passed she has gained a great deal of experienced yet has found it difficult to grow the business due to lack of financing. She runs the business from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Laurida inicio su negocio hace 1 año. Los productos que vende son: chuzos, alas de pollo y choclos asados. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 4-a -10pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Laurida necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de una vitrina pequeña, más productos y arreglar el sitio de su negocio. De esta manera podra tener una mejor imagen para su negocio y podra ofrecer una variedad mas amplia de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Laurida tiene 58 años. Tiene 1 hijo que es mayor e independiente. Laurida inicio con un pequeño capital solicitado a un prestamista. Ha pesar del tiempo y la experiencia en el negocio se le ha hecho difícil crecer por problemas de financiamiento. El negocio lo atiende en las afueras de su casa.

loans.use:
Purchase a display cabinet

Comprar una vitrina

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam's parents died over ten years ago. Her grandmother (68-years-old) supported this family of four children. Three of them now work as day labourers, and the youngest is in the 9th class. Their average income is $14 per month/person. Nam is requesting a loan of $75 to raise pigs, which will increase her family's income. The loan will be repaid in five months.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Manuel Bernardo

texts.pt:
Manuel Bernardo M. lives in Corumana in the district of Moamba in Maputo. He entered the program in November of 2007 with a loan of 6.000MT. He fishes by the Corumana Dam, and during the off season he sells beef. He is looking for a loan for $425US to help him buy and sell beef. He has already started construction on his home using conventional materials. In the past he only had a house built with precarious materials.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel Bernardo M. vive em Corumana, distrito da Moamba em Maputo. Entrou para o programa em Novembro de 2007 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT. Pratica a pesca na barragem de Corumana e na época do defeso compra e vende carne de vaca. Vai tomar agora um emprestimo de 10.000MT para aplicar na compra e venda da carne de vaca. O cliente começou já uma obra de cosntrução de sua residência com material convencional. No ciclo passado tinha apenas uma casa feita de material precário.

loans.use: Buy and Sell Beef

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Not having any economic support from her husband was not an obstacle for Adela to be able to support her 7 children.

After have worked selling desserts in the street and washing clothing, Adela has been selling homemade food from a stand in the market near her house for 5 years.

This business not only has helped her raise her children and better their quality of life, it ihas also generated employment for two of her children with the purchase of their respective motortaxis.

Adela has always had a great vision for business. It is for this reason, and having the opportunity, she would like to open a grocery store and internet service. In addition, thinking always of her children, she would buy them cars so they can offer taxi service, and at least, buy sewing machines so as to start a tailoring business at home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

El no tener el apoyo económico de su esposo, no fue un obstáculo para que Adela sacara adelante a sus 7 hijos.

Luego de haber trabajado vendiendo postres en la calle y lavando ropa; Adela, desde hace 5 años, vende comida criolla en un puesto del mercado que está cerca de su casa.

Este negocio no solo le ha ayudado a criar a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda; sino también, ha generado puestos de empleo a dos de sus hijos con la compra de sus respectivos mototaxis.

Adela, siempre ha tenido una gran visión para los negocios. Es por esto que, de tener la oportunidad, pondría un puesto de abarrotes y un local de Internet. Además, pensando siempre en sus hijos, les compraría carros para que realicen servicios de taxi y a la menor, máquinas de coser para que inicie un taller de costura en casa.

loans.use: Open a grocery store

loans.name: Kikooza G(I) Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Teopista N..  She is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 300000 to to expand the business.  Teopista is 32 years old and is married and has 3 children ranging from age 9 to 15 and her children go to school.  Each week, Teopista makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.  Teopista is joined in her small group by Josephine N., Robinah N., Justine M., and Agnes K..  Josephine N. is currently in the retail shop business and is requesting a loan of UGX 800000 to buy a weighing scale and increase stock.  Robinah N. is currently also in the retail business and is requesting a loan of UGX 1000000  to increase stock in the shop.  Justine M. is currently in the business of textiles and is requesting a loan of UGX 2000000 to purchase more textile materials.  Agnes K. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 500000  to expand business.

loans.use: To expand the stone quarrying business

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla A. is a trader who sells lace, underwear, sleepers and babies wear. She is not yet married and has no children. Business is doing very well and for that reason she wants to increase her sales but lacks enough capital to achieve this target of hers. She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more of the lace, underwear and other items to provide for the demand of her costumers.

loans.use: Priscilla would like to buy more lace, underwear and other items to sell.

loans.name: Lydia Achini

texts.en:
Lydia was born in 1969. She is married to John Nikwi and they have nine children. Her husband abandoned her and the children. This led to the death of two children due to poverty and suffering. She says being alone and paying rent is a difficult burden on her.

She has to start doing some of those things her husband did. Challenged by these realities she has double her effort towards meeting the needs of her children like paying schools fees, providing medication and food.

This made her join GHAPE. Given a loan, she plans to rear pigs, crop cultivation and do trading. Her community stands a chance of benefiting from her activities, as she will provide them with food and manure, which will help increase agricultural output.

She plans to repay the loan in 24 months and her first installment repayment will begin on the fourth month from date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets, seedlings and trading

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is married with four children; ages 6, 17, 19, and 20. She started a small shop a year ago, where she sells general items. She works every day and is able to make a monthly profit of about $145 from this business.

Saada hopes for a loan to purchase more inventory for her shop. She is a member of loan group Subira Yavuta, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Tatjana

texts.en: Tatjana is a single woman from the town of Derventa. She works and her monthly salary is 400 KM. She does not have any children. This would be her first loan from MCO WWI, and she is requesting 600 KM. She will use this loan to work to become a florist, and will use the loan to purchase flower seedlings and agricultural tools. Tatjana hopes to expand a flower cultivation operation and generate future revenues through the sales of the flowers that she grows.

loans.use: To purchase  flower seedlings

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
The group consists of 17 women who work and function in an environment of companionship, harmony, respect and solidarity. They value the help and service of Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya in supporting their causes. They are women who work to help their households make headway and improve the quality of life for their children and all their family members.

The group members dedicate themselves to selling food, coal, cleaning supplies, crafts, etc. The loans they are requesting will be used to purchase the items they sell (sugar, yerba, thread, cleaning supplies, coal, etc.).

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

El comité compuesto por 17 mujeres que trabajan y se desenvuelve en un ambiente de compañerismo, donde reina la armonía, el respeto y la solidaridad.

El comité valora la función y el servicio que brinda la Fundación Paraguaya al apoyarlas, son mujeres que trabajan para sacar adelante sus hogares y ayudan a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y el de todos los miembros de su familia.

Las señoras se dedican a la venta de comestible, venta carbón, productos de limpieza, artesanías, venta de leche, etc. Los préstamos que solicitan serán utilizados para compra de azúcar, yerba, hilos, productos de limpiezas, carbón, etc.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, yerba, thread, cleaning supplies, coal, etc. / para compra de azúcar, yerba, hilos, productos de limpiezas, carbón, etc.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas, 41 years old and single, lives in a crowded neighborhood of Beirut.

This ambitious and hard-working man works in three different places: as a waiter in a restaurant close to his home, as maitre d' at night in a hotel of Beirut and, finally, he helps his brother with his small “Manakiche” bakery. The "manakiche" is a famous pizza bread that Lebanese usually eat for breakfast.

Abbas needs a loan for an amount of USD 1,000 to purchase a new bakery oven and expand the "Manakiche" family business. The income increase will help improve the livelihood of his brother's family. This is the first time Abbas has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase a new bakery oven

loans.name: Felix Bautista

texts.es:
Felix is 39 year old, and lives with his wife and four children. He is a head of household who works tirelessly to improve the standard of living of his family, always looking for opportunities to help himself and his family get ahead. For these reasons, he currently works selling wood at wholesale. It is hard work, and involves first buying the eucalyptus trees so that later he himself can cut them down into smaller pieces of wood. His primary tools are an electric saw and an axe. Once Felix has finished cutting, he selects what he is going to move and the amount that will fit into his truck for transport. Felix has been in this business for five years, and this actity has allowed him to support the education of his four children. He also plants and tends to several crops, including potatoes, on his land. Felix makes great efforts to see his family get ahead each and every day, which is why he always seeks opportunities that may help him in this endeavor. He seeks a loan to buy more trees so he can take advantage of the upcoming winter season when trees are scarce. He hopes to, in this way, stabilize his earnings and have the ability to produce a greater quantity of product to offer for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Félix tiene 39 años de edad y vive con su esposa y 4 hijos. Es un padre de familia que trabaja arduamente para poder mejorar la economía de su hogar, siempre ha buscado las oportunidades de desarrollo de su familia, por los cual está trabajando en la actualidad en la venta de leña al por mayor, es duro el trabajo, consiste en comprar árboles enteros de eucalipto para luego, él mismo, cortarlos y darle la forma de leña, cuyos instrumentos principales de trabajo son una sierra eléctrica y su hacha, una vez que Félix a terminado de cortar, los selecciona para arrimarlos y tener la suficiente cantidad para su transporte en camión, de esa manera reparte al por mayor la leña que produce, Félix viene produciendo leña desde hace 5 años y esta actividad le permite poder sostener la educación de sus 4 hijos, también no descuida el cultivo de su terrenos en las cuales siembra papa y otros productos. Félix se esfuerza porque quiere ver a su familia superándose cada día, es por ello que seguirá en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades para los suyos. Solicita un crédito con la cual podrá comprar más árboles y de esa manera afrontar la época de invierno donde existe la escasez de árboles y así mantener estable sus ganancias, su meta es producir en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: Buy more trees to continue his business selling wood.

loans.name: San Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita inició el negocio porque su hijo estaba estudiando la universidad y no tenia para pagar las cuotas escolares además de gastos del hogar, ya que es viuda. Comenzó hace mas de 6 años elaborando y vendiendo tamales y tacos a vapor en su casa a sus vecinos y conocidos, hasta que logro hacerse de clientela.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima ya que tiene un pedido especial y necesita surtir los ingredientes para este.
texts.en:
Juanita started the business because her son was studying in university and she didn't have money to pay tuition as well as the household expenses now that she is a widow. She started more than six years ago making tacos and tamales in her house and selling them to neighbors and acquaintances, until she was able to build a clientele.

She needs a loan of $750 which she will repay in 6 months to buy material now that she has a special order and she needs to get the ingredients for this.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials

loans.name: Santa Fisher

texts.es:
Doña Santa tiene 33 años de edad, estudió educación superior, es casada, madre de 3 hijos (todos menores de edad), vive en el  Jr. Manco Capac Interior 11 del distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno y es socia del Banco  Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave.

Con el crédito inicial de S/.300 pudo comprar más productos (detergentes,  betún, pasta dental, champú, etc.), con lo que aumentó su mercadería y le es necesario viajar a distintas comunidades. A los 15 años de edad se dedicó a la compra y venta de carne que los mismos comuneros le traían a su casa y ella  vendía en las diferentes ferias. A los 24 años tuvo su familia y continúo con su negocio conjuntamente con su esposo. 

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará,  detergente, betún, ayudin y más productos.

Su sueño es progresar y que su familia salga adelante y también ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santa is 33 years old woman who attended some college and is the mother of 3 young children. She lives in the Jr Manco capac Interior 11th district of Ilave in the provincia El Coallao Puno district. She is a partner in the San Miguel community bank in Ilave. With her initial loan of 300 soles she was able to purchase more products (detergent, shoe polish, toothpaste, shampoo, etc) which she used to increase her stock which she takes to neighboring communities. She began working buying and selling meat brought to her home by salesmen when she was 15 years old. She would take the meat to various markets to sell. When she was 24 years old she began her family and continued working with her husband. With this loan of 500 soles which she will pay off in 3 payments she will purchase detergent, shoe polish, and other products. Her dream is to progress and help her family while seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcahse of detergent, shoe polish, and other products.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Розикова Сафаргул жительница города Яван. Возраст 27 лет,замужем и имеет двоих детей. Имеет магазинг рядом с домом, где продает продукты питания. Ее бизнес помогает населению делать покупки не выезжая далеко на рынок. Для того, чтобы увеличить бизнес , а так же удовлетворить спрос населения , она планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Safargul R. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She has a store near her home where she sells foods. Her business helps give residents local access to goods so they don't have to travel far to the market. To increase business and meet customer demand, she decided to apply for a loan and expand her inventory. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Gilberto David

texts.es:
La actividad económica a la que se dedica el señor Gilberto G. es a la venta de cloro, pinesol, criolina, ambientador ofreciéndolos ambulantemente en las calles del municipio de San Rafael en la ciudad de Managua de donde es originario.

Es importante destacar que este negocio se vuelve muy agotador por el hecho de que todos los días y sin descanso alguno, el señor Gilberto recorre las calles de su municipio y con la fatiga del sol dando lugar al desgaste físico pero con la esperanza de que algún día mejorará su nivel de vida. 
La razón por la cual ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para  solicitar un crédito para la compra de estos productos de limpieza y así ofertarlos en su municipio y de esta forma llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Gilberto G.'s business activity is the selling of chlorine, Pine Sol, criolina (a cleaning substance), air fresheners, offering them traveling through the streets of the San Rafael neighborhood in the city of Managua, his hometown. It's important to emphasize that this activity has become very exhausting due to the fact that everyday, without rest, Gilberto travels through the streets of his neighborhood, with the fatigue caused by the sun causing physical exhaustion, but with the hope that someday he will improve his quality of life. The reason he has come seeking the support of Ceprodel is to request a loan for the purchase of cleaning products to sell them in his neighborhood to bring income to his household.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchae of home cleaning products

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr: Fatou Bintou S., 54 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Château d’Eau Bignona depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du parfum, du pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du citron, de l’huile de palme, du sucre et  autres pour son activité de vente de parfum, de produits alimentaires et de glaces. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou Bintou S. is 54 years old, married, and is responsible for seven children. She has been a member of the "Château d’Eau Bignona " village bank for six and a half years. She wants to buy perfume, baobab fruit, lemons, palm oil, sugar and other products for resale. She sells perfume, foodstuffs and ice cream. She will repay the loan in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for resale:  foodstuff and perfume.

loans.name: Kotimi

texts.en:
Kotimi M. is forty years old. She is a married woman with five children, a son and four daughters. Some are in the junior high and the basic school while others are learning a trade, hair dressing. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a small town called Koforidua in the Ashanti Region. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops like maize, cassava, etc.

Kotimi is a business woman. She sells maize and bananas. She buys her goods from farmers in the nearby villages and sells to retailers in her community. She says she sells the maize in the market square to the food vendors but sells the ripe bananas by the roadside. Kotimi has been in this business for over twenty years. She wants a loan to buy maize and bananas in bulk. Kotimi is working hard to help her husband so that they can put up a building of their own.

loans.use: To buy maize and bananas for re-sale

loans.name: Srey Seur

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Seur C., 22, resides in Samroung village in Takeo Province, where she owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice.  Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sophun, sells salt in the local village but has difficulty transporting his product to market. Thus, Srey is requesting a loan to add her savings to buy a motorbike for his business. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To help buy a motorbike for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Bancomunal Señor D. los Milagros. 
Teodora es casada tiene 46 años  cinco hijos D. 28, 27, 22, 16 y 14 años los menores están en la escuela estatal
Teodora solo sabe escribir su nombre, firmar y sumar, no sabe leer, ni escribir; se levanta a las tres D. la mañana para preparar el caldo D. gallina, ella venD. años, lo dejó por un tiempo por que se enfermó del asma  bronquial y tuvo que viajar a Ayacucho por dos años  hasta que se sano y regreso a Lima, actualmente hace tres años ha vuelto a vender caldo D. gallina 
DesD. que está en Finca ya no está estresada, porque antes tenía que prestarse dinero D. prestamistas que todos los días le cobraban, y no veía su ganancia, ahora se ha compro su carreta, cocina,  servicios, y tiene ahorros. 
Teodora necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideos, mote para la preparación D. menú.   
El sueño D. Teodora es abrir un restaurante en su casa
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the Communal Bank of Señor D. los Milagros. She is 46 years old, married, and has five children ages 28, 27, 22, 16, and 14. The younger children go to public school.

Tedora only knows how to write and sign her name, and to add. She doesn't know how to read or write. She gets up at 3:00 in the morning to make the chicken soup which she sold for years. She left that business for a time because she got quite sick with asthma and she had to go to Ayacucho for two years until she got better and returned to Lima. Three years ago she returned to selling chicken soup.

Since she has been with Finca she's no longer stressed, because before she had to borrow money from loan sharks who charged her interest every day, so she never benefited from her business's earnings. Now she has bought herself a cart, a stove, and silverware, and she has some savings.

Teodora needs a loan of 1200 soles (about $400 US) to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and boiled wheat to make her soup. Her dream is to open up a restaurant in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for chicken soup to sell

loans.name: Oiposho

texts.en:
Working in agriculture has helped Oiposho P. and her family to overcome the tremendous loss of her husband. Twelve years ago she was forced to learn how to take on the responsibility of obtaining an education for two children alone, something that was not an easy task. Thanks to her organizational skills and care she has been able to maintain stability in her home. Oiposho’s great knowledge regarding her profession has allowed her to produce good quality and variety, but it has still not been enough. That is why she would like to make a greater investment in her land so that she can increase her income. She would like to earn enough to contribute to the costs of her children’s education.

Oiposho is requesting a loan of 2200 Somoni in order to purchase high quality seeds and fertilizer for her land. She appeals to the generous hearts of those who can grant her this assistance.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Абдуазиз - молодой мужчина лет 30. Женат и имеет 3-х детей. У него среднее образование. Он занимается продажей обуви и хлопчатобумажной ткани на рынке "Фаровон" города Гафурова. Его жена помогает ему. Абдуазиз продает обувь а его жена продает ткань. Абдуазиз с женой закупают товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Они ездят за товаром раз в месяц. Абдуазиз уже год берет кредит в нашей организации. По началу он продавал только обувь. Теперь он расширил бизнес и закупил партию хлопчатобумажной ткани, чтобы жена тоже занялась делом. Теперь на новый займ они хотят закупить новую партию товара.
texts.en:
Abduaziz is a young 30 year old man. He is married and has 3 children. He has a high school education. He sells shoes and cotton fabrics at the “Farovon” market in Gafurov. His wife helps him. Abduaziz sells shoes and his wife sells fabrics. Abduaziz and his wife purchase their products from the wholesale market in Istaravshan. They travel for their products once a month. Abduaziz has been taking credit from our organization for a year. In the beginning he only sold shoes. Now he expanded his business and purchased a stock of cotton fabrics so that his wife can also be involved in the business. Now he would like to use his new loan to purchase a new stock of products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: shoes and cotton fabrics

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.ru: Нуринисо женщина- кредитор с 2003 года.Она продаёт мужскую одежду, брюки и рубашки. Скоро погасив свой предыдущий займ она хочет получить повторно.Нуринисо довольна условиями Фонда и рада работать с нами.У неё всегда стабильная торговля и пунктуальное погашение кредитов.Нуринисо в числе положительных клиентов Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Nuriniso has been a borrower since 2004. She sells men’s clothing, trousers and shirts. After a timely repayment of her last loan, Nuriniso wants to obtain another loan. She is satisfied with the terms of the fund and is glad to be working with us. Her sales have always been stable, and loan repayments have been timely. Nuriniso is in the ranks of MicroInvest’s positive clients.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Men's clothing

loans.name: Yermilia

texts.es:
YERMILIA V. SENGUNDO, pertenece al Banco Comunal “RICARDO PALMA” con domicilio en la calle Señor de los milagros Nº 128, tiene 32 años, 2 hijos, y su esposo trabaja conduciendo su propio moto taxi.

A parte de tener su moto taxi ella trabaja junto a su suegra fabricando escobas y la primera vez que obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro materiales para fabricar escobas.

Con este préstamo de S/.1000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de llantas, amortiguadores, trapecio, y otras piezas que son necesarios para que su moto taxi le pueda rendir bien sin malograrse.

Durante el tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta y satisfecha por haber logrado muchos de sus sueños , y por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante.
texts.en:
YERMILA V. SENGUNDO is a member of the "Ricardo Palma" Communal Bank. She lives at Senor de los Milagros #128, is 32 years old and has 2 children. Her husband works driving his own moto taxi. Besides having her moto taxi she works along side her mother-in-law making brooms and with her first 300 soles loan she bought raw materials for their manufacture. With this 1000 new soles loan she will purchase tires, shock absorbers and other replacement parts necessary to insure that her moto taxi will function optimally. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the assistance given her in reaching her goals and for the help given to women to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires, shock absorbers and other replacement parts for her mototaxi.

loans.name: Edy Fernando

texts.es: El Joven Edy Fernando es originario D. la zona cuatro del departamento D. Totonicapan actualmente trabaja el juzgado civil del mismo municipio como oficial segundo, el necesita D. un credito para poder terminar su carrera univesitaria en la elaboracion D. su exame privado ya que en su trabajo se le obliga en ampliar su conocimientos para poder fortalecer algunos caso judiciales que se tiene o que se le exige diariamente.
texts.en:
The young man Edy Fernando comes from zone four of the Totonicapan department where he currently works as a deputy officer at the civil court. He needs a loan in order to finish his university career by preparing for a private exam. His work requires that he increases his knowledge to strengthen various judicial cases that he works with on a daily basis.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Course fees

loans.name: Aylen

texts.en:
Aylen is 33 years old and married to Eduardo. They are blessed with four children. Their family is residing in a rural village in Nueva Vizcaya. Two of the children are now in their elementary level and they are hoping that all of them will finish their studies and have a bright future.  
Despite the hardships of life, Aylen and her husband strive very hard and sacrificing a lot, under the heat of the sun, as they till their farm just to earn a living and to provide for the needs of their family. They plant rice, vegetables and citrus in their farm lot in the upland. Aside from farming, Aylen also sells their harvested crops every week. Aylen is hoping to avail a loan amounting to PHP12,000 in order to support their farming needs and also to expand her vending business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Like other business persons, Agnes C. also dreams of success in her grocery business. She started it off small, using her savings of Php 3,000 in 1986. She managed it well and has turned it into a mini-grocery. This year, she is earning a lot from her store and what she wants to do is to send her two children to college.

However, she still needs capital to buy additional merchandise for her store. She is asking for a loan of Php 25,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will really help her achieve better income for her family.

She is happy with the services of CEVI. She still would like to access loans, training and insurance coverage as well from them.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina D., 58, of Barrio Bagong Pag-asa, Pasay City, has been known for her sweet banana cue for three decades now. Her husband Antonio, 64, is a family driver, and they have seven children. Marcelina has spent half of her life cooking and selling sweet caramelized bananas skewered in thin bamboo sticks. She is so used to her daily routine that she says she could even cook with her eyes closed. Earning more than P10,000.00 a month, she uses her profits for the family’s daily needs.

Marcelina joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She recently applied for a new loan with the cooperative in the amount of P14,000.00 as additional capital for her banana cue business. She dreams of having other types of businesses or jobs to do other than selling banana cue.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for banana cue business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie Baguran is a new member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She is 33 years old and lives with her husband Julito Baguran and their 4 kids, the eldest being 14 years old. Apart from rice farming, Rosalie also sells banana que and clothes to make up for daily necessities.
Rosalie applied for a loan of Php5, 000 to buy farming materials and equipments. Having heard good feedback about CEVI from fellow farmers, Rosalie can only be thankful she joined for it is truly a big help in her farming.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle A. is from the village of Punta. She is 46 years old. Anabelle is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Anabelle owns and operates a duck-raising business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. Anabelle has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for this activities.

In 2006, Anabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Anabelle is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Anabelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose Antonio D. R. reside en Sensuntepeque en el departamento de Cabañas. Jose tiene 26 años de edad vive con esposa y sus tres hijos todos menores edad. La esposa de Jose trabaja como empleada domestica en un hogar, y Jose trabaja en casa dando servicios de costura, y elaborando variedad de prendas deportivas, Jose es muy minucioso en su trabajo se ha dado cuenta que necesita de una maquina nueva para detalles que requieren algunas prendas, es por ello que solicita de un crédito para comprar dicha maquina.

loans.use: Compra una maquina de costura

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa currently lives with her husband and six other children. She has one grandson who is in school but all her children are grownup and are living on their own.

Yaa is 54 years old and very supportive of her family. She trades in Chinese herbal medicines in bulk and is a manufacturer of local medicine. She combines herbs from the forest to prepare the local medicine which is proved to cure diseases like fever, piles, malaria, etc. She obtains her supply of Chinese medicines from importers in Kumasi and retails them (hand in hand) with the local medicine. She mostly sells through hawking in the local market centre.

Yaa wants the loan assistance to buy materials to prepare local medicine and to boost her stock to raise sales and create a substantial profit.
