loans.use: To buy materials to prepare local medicine and to boost her stock

loans.name: Por Una Vida Digna Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL
POR UNA VIDA DIGNA

Este grupo lo forman 10 personas las cuales son muy responsables y solidarias  comenzaron hace 6 años viendo L. necesidad D. invertir en algún negocio con el cual poder contribuir en sus hogares.
Tal es así que L. Sra. Benedicta S. se dedica a L. elaboración y venta D. yogurt D. diferentes sabores según lo solicitado por sus clientes así como también néctares D. frutas,  tiene mucha demanda,  es por eso que el préstamo recibido lo invertirá en comprar una conservadora. Todo esto le ha permitido apoyar  a su hijo en su empresa D. servicios y colocación D. personal; es una socia muy activa en el grupo y es por eso que L. nombraron presidenta.
Como tesorera Elsa Dávalos se preocupa el pago puntual D. las cuotas del grupo. ElL. como profesora D. danza pudo notar que el alquiler D. disfraces era rentable así que elL. misma comenzó a confeccionar y alquilar los disfraces  a sus alumnos y otras personas; este negocio le ha dado muchas satisfacciones.
Así como ellas, las socias tienen diferentes negocios a los que le  dedican mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo,  porque uno D. sus objetivos más importante  es brindar una buena educación y alimentación a sus familias.
texts.en:
POR UNA VIDA DIGNA (FOR A DIGNIFIED LIFE) COMMUNAL BANK This group consists of ten, very responsible and cooperative, persons who, six years ago, saw the need to invest in some type of business in order to contribute to the support of their households. As examples we have Mrs. Benedicta S. who makes and sells variously flavored yoghurts according to her customers' wishes; she also sells various fruit nectars. She has a lot of demand so the funds she receives will be used to buy an ice chest. This has allowed her to support her son in his empolyment agency. She is a very active group member and, because of that, she was selected to be the group president. As group treasurer, Elsa Dávalos is concerned that the group makes punctual repayments. As a dance teacher, she noticed that renting costumes could be a profitable enterprise so she began to make them herself and then rent them to her students and others. This work has given her much satisfaction. Like them, the other group members have different lines of work to which they are dedicated with much enthusiasm and effort because one of their most important objectives is to proviD. their families with sustenance and good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Anavita

texts.es:
Anavita R. N., tiene la edad de 38 años, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 13,17 y 19 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de  ganado para leche.El negocio del ganado le ayudará a su familia ya que va a poder vender la leche y producir queso para la venta. Es la primera vez doña Anavita se financea con  FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le brindaron muchas facilidades. Ella tambien trabaja en la agricultura sembrando hortalizas.
Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Anavita R. N. is 38 years old, married, and has three children who are her top priority. Her children are 13, 17 and 19 years old, respectively. She wants to take out a loan to purchase milk cows. This livestock business will help her family since she will be able to sell milk and produce cheese for sale. This is the first time that Anavita has obtained financing with FUDECOSUR. She states that the credit committee has helped her a lot, and they have provided many services. She also works in agriculture planting vegetables. She hopes that as this project grows she will be able to provide a better quality of life and greater economic stability to her family in the future. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of milk cows

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan U. is from the village of Lapasan in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old. Alan is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Alan uses his tricycle (a motorcycle with a sidecar) to provide passenger transport services. Alan has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alan is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to repair his vehicle so he can provide better services. This will be Alan's second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the motorbike that he uses in his transportation service

loans.name: Delmy Del Rosario

texts.es: Delmy del Rosario L. C. de 37 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Delmy posee un taller de costura en el cual elabora prendas de vestir para las diferentes personas que hacen sus pedidos y así mismo comercializa la ropa que elabora de manera ambulante. Ella es una persona que debe esforzarse mucho ya que desea poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus cuatro hijos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar telas y repuestos para sus maquinas de coser, esto con el fin de poder aceptar mayor cantidad de pedidos, sobre todo en la temporada de inicio de clases la cual esta pronta y todas las personas mandan a hacer los uniformes de sus hijos. A pesar que Delmy recibe ayuda del padre de sus hijos, ella trabaja mucho para poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Delmy del Rosario L. C., 37, lives in the city of Arce in the La Libertad department. She lives with her four minor children. They go to school. Delmy has a seamstress shop. She makes articles of clothing for different people who place orders. She also works as a street vendor to sell the clothes she makes. She is a person who must put forth a great deal of effort because she wants to be able to give her four children everything they need. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy fabric and replacement parts for her sewing machines. That way she will be able to accept more orders, especially in the season when classes start. That season will be here soon, and everybody has uniforms made for their children. Even though Delmy receives help from the father of their children, she works hard to be able to pay all of the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric to make clothes

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mina

texts.fr: Mina F. est une femme de 42 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est revendeuse d’éponges, elle a fait plusieurs années d’expérience dans le domaine, elle réalise beaucoup de bénéfices et avec le prêt de kiva, elle voudrait se ravitailler beaucoup en vue de pouvoir satisfaire la clientèle. Avec les bénéfices obtenus, elle aimerait aider son mari dans ces tâches de responsabilité. Dans l’avenir elle aimerait être une grossiste.
texts.en:
Mina F. is a 42-year-old woman, married and mother of one child. She retails sponges, and has several years experience in the business. Her income is quite good, and with Kiva’s loan she wants to acquire a large quantity of supplies to meet customer demands. With her earnings she wants to help her husband manage his responsibilities. In the future, she would like to become a wholesaler.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sponges for retail

loans.name: Tamunang Joseph

texts.en:
Born in 1948, Tamumang Joseph is married to Nkenti Grace and they have brought forth three children. Due to the fact that it is too difficult for him to take care of the family single-handedly and provide the children’s basic care, and also that his wife could not do it alone, he decided to join GHAPE in 1998. Also, he has been having a lot of marital problems with his family and this has made him sad all the time, but he is appreciative of the fact that he is alive.

Tamumang’s desire is to give his children love and education. He states that he feels better each time he provides something small for his children. His inability to get investment capital which could constantly generate income for him to meet his children’s needs is what motivated him to obtain a loan from GHAPE.

Given the loan, Tamumang plans to buy a motorcycle to start a transportation business. He knows this business will succeed because he is located at a good business site and he has a good rider for the motorcycle. He plans to use the generated profits to sponsor his children in school and to cater for the basic needs of his family.


About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO (non-governmental organization) based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to start a transportation business

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi D. is a 46-year-old nurse and the married mother of two children: Rehema, who is in college, and Roy, who is in secondary school.

Sidi has been in the business of rearing dairy cattle for the last eleven years and she has been selling milk to the residents of Mabirikani estate in Kilifi.

Sidi is now borrowing her second loan from KADET after servicing her first one well. With this loan she intends to purchase one more dairy cow and to also buy dairy feeds.

Sidi hopes to own a large dairy farm for commercial purposes in order to be able to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and feeds for her cattle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is well known as a businesswoman in Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells onions at retail prices to her customers. Her customers love patronizing her because she is friendly and hard working. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to grow her business. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more onions to sell.  She is married to a pastor and they have five children. Mary is 45 years old. She hopes to give her children a quality education. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more onions to sell

loans.name: Hierng

texts.en: Mrs. S. has a life partner in her husband who is a firewood seller. They both reside in a medium wooden house located in Kompong Tom, a province of Cambodia. The couple has three school-aged kids who are also under their care. In order to earn a daily income, S. goes to buy groceries in bulk from her supplier in the market and she sells the groceries to her nearby villagers to raise cash. In a day, she is able to generate at least $3, which she uses to feed her family. Beside her grocery business, S. and her husband always take time to plant various kinds of crops during farming season. S. plans to buy a piece of a good farmland but her saving are not enough to buy it. So, S. has requested a loan to be used to purchase the land. On her new land she will grow crops for extra profit.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to rent.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe M. is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family by running an eatery/restaurant. She lives in Sitio Mabuhay, Gil Montilla, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental with her husband, Guilbert, who works as a maintenance carpenter at the City Hall of Sipalay. They have three children who are between 15 and 24 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1994. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her eatery/restaurant business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,500 PHP.

Fe is now borrowing 20,000 PHP so that she can expand her eatery/restaurant. This will be her 11th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Fe aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than US$1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her eatery business

loans.name: Inna

texts.en:
Inna is divorced. She has two sons, Yevgenyi and Roman. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, where she sells dishware and souvenirs in one of the sections of a local store called “Krestyanskyi Dvor” (“Country Yard”). Inna can boast a nice selection of retail items offered for sale at her outlet. She has been in this trade for four years. Presently, she has 50,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her income amounts to 15,000 Grivnyas. 

Inna is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital. Inna is very serious about her business. She approaches all aspects of it with a great sense of responsibility. 

She believes timely investment will help her generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Inna’s responsibility and strong character will assist her in the current loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Florinda Mariel

texts.es: LA SEÑORA FLORINDA ESTA CASADA, SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE VARIEDAD DE ROPAS(CHAMARRAS, POLERAS Y OTROS) DESDE HACE 8 AÑOS, TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ROPA EN EL MERCADO, ESTA EN ALQUILER. TIENE CASA PROPIA, TIENE 2 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ESTA EN SU SEGUNDO CICLO, DONDE HA DEMOSTRADO SER RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS CON LA INSTITUCION, ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA. EL CREDITO LO UTILIZARA  PARA AUMENTAR SU MERCADERIA SURTIR MEJOR SU CASETA YA QUE ESTA LLEGANDO LA TEMPORADA DE FRIO Y NECESITA COMPRAR CHAMARRAS AL POR MAYOR Y ASI VARIAR SU MERCADERIA POR TEMPORADA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Florinda is married and she has been dedicating herself to the buying and selling of various kinds of clothes (leather jackets, ponchos, T-shirts and others) for 8 years in a clothes shop she rents in the market. She owns a house and has 2 children of school age; she is a very hard-working woman who is presently repaying her second loan, and she has demonstrated being very responsible with her payments to the institution. The loan she is asking for will be used to augment her stock and to better furnish her stall, as the cold season is approaching and she needs to buy wholesale jackets, thus varying the seasonal products she offers. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy items of clothing to sell

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 60 years old. He is married with 8 children aged between 14 and 31 years old. Six of his children are currently attending school. He is a farmer from western Kenya, in Kisii town. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 35 years. 

Ben's products are maize, tea, bananas, and millet which he sells to institutions and local markets. He also earns income from sale of milk and he has a pension being a retired extension officer. His main challenges are lack of a ready market, the poor transport network, and family needs which at times make him divert money to educate his children.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of Kes 30,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to get manure from the cow; the nutritional status of the family is going to improve from the consumption of milk, and he is also going to get extra income from the sale of milk.

In five years, he hopes to start a greenhouse for vegetables and tomatoes. He also hopes to buy a pickup truck to use for transporting his products to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa E. is from the town of Albur. She is 58 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Celsa owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Celsa has been engaged in her business for over a year now.
Celsa joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Celsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Hermida

texts.es:
Rosa de 35 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana con una ecología en disolución), con la ayuda de su esposo y sus  cuatro hijos ella pudo estudiar costura y realizar las practicas en una empresa textilera. 

Hace tres años atrás tuvo su primera maquina y pudo tener su propio taller de costura y confección en su casa, trabaja en la tarde y noche con su taller y en la mañana se dedica a vender productos en el sector donde vive para tener mas ingresos. 

Para tener la oportunidad de hacer mas ropa ella necesita comprar con el préstamo forros y cierres para su negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar maquinas industriales  para su taller.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil. It is a semi-urban area on the outskirts of the city, and has a deteriorating ecosystem. With the help of her husband and their four children, she was able to study dressmaking and to learn first-hand at a textile company. Three years ago, Rosa got her first sewing machine and was able to start her own sewing workshop in her house. She sews in the afternoon and at night, and in the mornings she sells her products around the area where she lives, in order to bring in income. In order to allow her the opportunity to make more clothing, she needs to buy lining and zippers for her business. In the future, she would like to buy industrial sewing machines for her workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy zippers and lining

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase water, sodas, sugar, and other products

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou G. is a married woman who lives in Bryg Zone III, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by a fruit vending business.  Her husband Harry G., who is 46 years old, helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 7 children who are 7 to  23 years old. 

Marilou joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilou has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2500 per month,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 9000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her food vending business so that she could continue to save up for future education of her children. Marilou G. is a 'Dungganon' woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Kolo Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
This enterprisingly dedicated married mother of five school-going children is gleeful in paying tribute to her husband whom she credits with the pep talk that, at length, led her to start up her first business selling snacks.

With the little profits that had accrued from this business, N. Molly began her current food-selling business in Kolo, Mukono. This business has now lasted seven years and makes 200,000 shillings a month.

With this loan, Molly wants to buy materials for the expansion of her restaurant and purchase more food for her canteen. She is a really hardworking and determined lady.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for the expansion of her business and more food for her canteen

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị is a 53 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. L. is the leader of a two-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Hậu 2 nhóm 12 (Nhóm 12).

L. is married and has four adult children. To making a living, she raises cattle for sale. L. has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month.

In 2009, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.496.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the second taken out by the borrower from SEDA. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrower in the group:

Kiều Thị M. is a 33 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

L. Nguyễn Thị (20206030019) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Yên Hậu 2 nhóm 12 (Nhóm 12).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Kiều Thị M. (0) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 54 years old. Delia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Delia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jorge Isaac

texts.es:
El cliente Jorge Isaac R.  Rivera. Vive en el municipio Santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león Costado Oeste Iglesia Católica, Es Acompañado  trabaja actual mente en la alcaldía santa Rosa del peñón desempeña  el cargo como Responsable De unidad de Adquisición tiene 10 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación Familiar el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para la compra de Sin  para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Isaac R. R.is the client.  He lives in Santa Rosa Del Peñón, León department, along the west side of the Catholic Church.   He has a life partner and is currently working for the city of Santa Rosa Del Peñón as a Buyer.  He has worked for this institution for 10 years.

He has a family home that he wants to improve.

The loan is to buy zinc metal sheeting for home improvement which will make possible better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting.

loans.name: Cristhian José

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Cristian es un joven muy trabajador,  a sus 19 años le gusta pensar en su futuro ya que él cree que antes de formar su familia es importante tener algo que ofrecer a su familia para no tener un fracaso en su vida futura, en la actualidad vive en casa de sus padres.

El en ocasiones trabaja en albañilería pero en sus días libres y cuando no tiene estos trabajos se dedica a la venta de pescado, recorre la ciudad en una bicicleta lo cual le resulta incomodo por la carga que tiene que llevar pero de igual lo hace ya que es su forma de ganarse la vida.  Trabaja los sábados y domingos  desde las 5am hasta las 14h00 y los días que no tiene trabajo de albañilería también el mismo horario. Sus productos los compra en Manta.
 
Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque permite a personas como el que puedan poner su negocio y salir adelante. Este crédito lo quiere ocupar para comprar un triciclo (bicicleta con carreta) y así recorrer sus productos con más comodidad.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa y una linda familia.
texts.en:
The Anibal San Andrés community bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture. It’s also known nationally and internationally for its handicrafts. It’s famous for Panama hats.

Cristian is a young hard-working 19 year old. He likes to think about his future. He believes before having a family that it is important to have something to offer them, in order to avoid family failures. At the moment, he lives in his parents’ house.

At times, he works in construction. However, on his free days and when he’s not building, he sells fish. He covers the city on bicycle which is uncomfortable because of his cargo load. He does it anyway because it is way to make a living. He works Saturdays and Sundays from 5am to 2pm. On the days he doesn’t have construction work, he works the same schedule. He buys his products in Manta, Ecuador.

This is his third loan with his community bank. He likes the bank because it allows people to help their business and make progress. This loan will be used to buy a tricycle ( a bicycle with a cart) so he can sell his products more comfortably.

His dream is to have a nice family and house.

loans.use: to buy a tricycle ( a bicycle with a cart)

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a tireless woman. She is 67 years old but still works long hours every day, tilling a small hectare of farm. She is doing this for a living, to earn an income and support her family.

Because she has limited access to capital, she has been unable to expand her business. The loan she applied for will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She believes she can maximize profit on her farm by buying the farming needs.

The additional income will go to pay for her family's daily needs, such as food, as well as investing in other possible new business opportunities. She also hopes to earn enough to support her family.

loans.use: Seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Isidra Elsa

texts.es: Isidra Elsa de 70 años, es comerciante de venta de bolsitas, hielo, gaseosas Para poder mantener a su familia y ayudar a su esposo tuvo que comenzar a trabajar con sus propios fondos, a pesar que era muy poco capital pero como ella quería generar sus propios ingresos decidió tener su propio local comenzó a vender a sus vecinos hasta que poco a poco ha incrementado su negocio. Para continuar con su negocio solicita este crédito que le será de mucha ayuda. En el futuro quiere tener otro negocio.
texts.en: Isidra Elsa, 70, is a merchant who sells bags, ice and soft drinks in order to support her family and help her husband.  She had to start the business with her own funds. Even though she had little capital, as she wanted to generate her own income, she decided to have her own store.  She started to sell to her neighbors, and her business gradually grew.  To continue with her business she requests this loan, which will be very helpful for her. In the future she wants to have another business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia J., from the town of Trinidad, is 35 years old, married and has four children aged 16, 15, 10 and 5. To make a living, Anastacia owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. Working hard to achieve a better life, she hopes to establish her own sari-sari store soon to help in their daily needs.

Anastacia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a tailoring business for the past seven years; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Constance faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and open another tailoring shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita B. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 52 years old, married and has 2 adult children. Carlita owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP every six months.

In 2006, Carlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Carlita is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be her 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sarvarkhon

texts.en:
Sarvarkhon is a widow and mother who lives in the town of Isfara, where she operates a typical small business selling women's clothing in the local market. She's been in this field for 20 years and has gained much experience working with clients and handling business-related challenges. She is applying for a loan for 11,000 Somoni to buy additional merchandise to sell to her customers. She is hoping to buy it wholesale and make a good profit when she sells it retail. Sarvarkhon is an entrepreneur who is constantly developing and growing as she experiments and introduces new and trendy clothing. Her customers always leave her kiosk pleased with their purchases, and we are hoping to see her continue to thrive and succeed in her business endeavors.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more products to sell to her cusotmers.

loans.name: Kukat

texts.en:
Kukat S. is a 37-year-old man who is married to Naduari S.; together, they have one child who is 6 months old. Kukat is a livestock trader in the Bissil market, but he also sells his livestock to the Kenya Meat commission and to butchers from the Kajiado and Kitengela areas. This has been his income base since 2009 and he takes home 21,000 Kenyan shillings every month.

Kukat joined KADET LTD after he was introduced to us by one of our credit officers and this is his first loan from KADET. He plans to use the money to buy three cows and 10 goats, which he will sell at a later period. He hopes to make good profits so he can save and buy a pick-up van for transporting his livestock.

He in the future, he hopes to establish a meat-supply company and also start supplying meat to a market called Barma in Nairobi. He believes he is ambitious and focused on achieving his goals.

loans.use: To buy three cows and 10 goats for future resale

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich B. is 54 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She earns a living by cultivating rice crop as well as raising ducks in a cage behind her house. She raises ducks to produce eggs and sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at her village. She is married with three single children and five married children, and most of them have already started new families. Her husband’s name is Chom Chory who works with her in the business. Pich B. has applied for a $600 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase additional feed and ducklings to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and ducklings to raise.

loans.name: Indaura Margarita

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Indaura, ella tiene 55 años de edad, está casada hace ya 35 años  y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven en el exterior y dos en otras ciudades del país, con ella viven dos nietas de 11 y 10 años que son como sus hijas y que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es pescador.

Ella trabaja en un colegio de San Jacinto como guardián, pero además se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de las marcas Nature Garden en la cual ya lleva 13 años y de Obnilife en la cual lleva dos años, trabaja todos los días en sus diversas actividades y en lo que es venta en las tardes después que los alumnos se hayan ido del plantel educativo aunque también vende a los maestros de este centro que son sus clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Nos cuenta que lo que más vende son el Aloe beta, Fiver Plus, One Miel, entre otros.

Este crédito es para comprar más productos naturales. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya tres años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan a ella y  a sus amigas socias. Sus sueños son comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the Communal Bank "Esperanza Para Superar" (The Hope To Go Beyond) meet in the splendid seaside resort of San Jacinto, surrounded by a lovely beach where the River Portoviejo meets the sea. The resort is visited by many tourists, locals and foreigners alike.

Here we met Señora Indaura, aged 55 and married for 35 years. From this union she has five children, all grown up. Three of them live abroad and two live in other cities of the country. Two granddaughters, 11 and 10 years old, live with her and attend school. To Indaura they are like daughters. Her husband is a fisherman.

She works as a security guard at a school in San Jacinto, but she also sells natural products of the brands Nature's Garden (for 13 years) and Obnilife (for 2 years). She works every day in her various activities. In the afternoon she sells her products after the students have left the school site. She also sells to the teachers of her school. She sells on credit and collects payment every fortnight. She does her best business with the products Aloe Beta, Fiber Plus and One Miel, among others.

This loan will be used to buy more natural products. She has been with the Communal Bank for already three years. She is grateful for the help provided to her and the other members. Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy natural products of the brands Nature's Garden and Obnilife

loans.name: Maria Sabina

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa con su padre en el caserío Las Mercedes en el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios básicos como agua y luz.

María se dedica al siembro de arroz en la  tierra cerca de su casa.  Ha pasado la mayoría de su vida trabajando esta tierra  así que conoce perfectamente su rubro. Vende su arroz a los comerciantes que visitan la región y a sus vecinos en el mercado local.

Desea usar su crédito para comprar más fertilizantes para el cultivo de su arroz. Espera lograr una mejor producción para vender su producto a un buen precio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María, 48, is single and has a son.  She lives at home with her father in Las Lomas district’s Las Mercedes hamlet, an agricultural zone located in Piura province, more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.  She currently does not have basic utilities like water and electricity.

María grows rice in a field near her house.  She’s spent most of her life working this land so she knows her line of work perfectly.  She sells her rice to merchants that visit the region and to her neighbors at the local market.

She wants to use the loan to buy more fertilizer for her rice crops.  She hopes to attain better production to sell her product at a better price.  Because of this she has deemed it convenient to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for her rice crops.

loans.name: Enrique Hernan

texts.es:
Enrique Hernan tiene 37 años, Es divorciado vive solo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada EN EL RECINTO Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas en ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Enrique se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz por mas de 10 años. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir progresando en la agricultura.

Le gusta hacer mucho deporte.
texts.en:
Enrique Hernan is 37 years old, divorced and lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  He has two children.

The communal bank "V.R.C. NUEVA UNION" is located in Guamayacu which belongs to the Echeandia canton.  This farm group mainly grows short-cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Enrique has been growing corn and rice for over 10 years.  He buys his supplies in Comercial Murillo and sells his produce in the same place.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizer for his corn and rice crops.  This financial support helps him meet his needs.  He is up against challenges such as plagues, sickness and weather change.  His dream is to become more successful in his agricultural business.

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Thượng Thôn - Nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09) Group

texts.en:
T. Hoàng Thị (20203060047) is a 21 year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thượng Thôn - Nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09).

T. is married and does not have any children. To making a living, T. works in someone else's furniture making business. The main source of income for the business comes from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from these activities.

In 2011, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. T. is requesting her first loan from SEDA, for 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase machinery to expand the business. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Thị

loans.use: to purchase machinery to expand the business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como pollos y patos, ella también trabaja en un restaurant como cocinera desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Qorilazo.” The bank is located in the district of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Marcelina; she is 32-years-old and has a partner and they have three children.  The member alternates her daily activities with a business raising animals like chickens and ducks.  She also works in a restaurant as a cook from 9am to 4pm.  Through this business she helps her children get ahead.  The member would like to improve the animal selling business.  She is requesting the loan to buy food for the animals.  

The member is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the payments on her loan.

loans.use: to buy food for animals.

loans.name: Lemomo

texts.en:
Lemomo K. is a 41-year-old man who is married to Lepesony and together they have three children aged 14, 10 and eight years. He is in the livestock trade business. He buys cows and bulls when still young and rears them, then he resells them at a profit. He has been in this business for the last eight years and he gets a profit of Kenya shillings 21,000. His business is in the busy Kitengela market.

Lemomo joined KADET the other day, after introductions by another client, and he has applied for his first loan which he will use to buy more livestock. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to establish a shop where he can sell roasted meat to his clients.

He has dreams of buying a big ranch where he can sell livestock and meat wholesale. He describes himself as hard-working and focused.

loans.use: To buy more livestock.

loans.name: Bayarkhuu

texts.en:
Bayarkhuu is 53 years old.  She lives with her husband and a son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in “ger”, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on a relative’s plot of land.  Her husband has lung cancer and stays at home and her son is studying in college. 

Since 2005, Bayarkhuu has been sewing covers for gers and selling them to customers at the market. In the beginning she was renting a sewing machine but now she has her own sewing machine which she bought.  In recent years, Bayarkhuu has started to receive more and more orders from her clients.  She is planning to buy textile materials for her business to grow her income by producing more products. 

Bayarkhuu is a hardworking woman. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and to educate son to the university.

loans.use: buy more materials to sew ger covers

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is 25 years old and married. To earn a living, he sells clothes. He has been operating the business for five years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business. He hopes to expand his business and open other outlets of his business in the future. Since Benson joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused on his business. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: San

texts.en: San, 59 years old, is a farmer. Her husband cannot do anything because his eyes are not good and he can’t see things clearly. She has four children, and they are 29, 25, 18, and 16 years old. Two are studying. One of her children is working as a housekeeper in Malaysia, the other is working in a factory, and both of them can earn $6.50 per day. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $20 on school fees, and $15 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a hand tractor for plowing her farm field. She expects to use this tractor to make more income by helping to plow other farmers' farmland when they need. She wants to prepare her house to be more comfortable to live in and to send her children to study in the university in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor for farming

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria tiene 61 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de reparación de calzado. Tiene más de 10 años en su negocio, inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar pues con mucho esfuerzo logro mantener a sus cuatro hijos que tenia a cargo. El crédito es para la compra de hilo, suelas, cuero, cuchillas, tijeras entre otros utensilios necesarios.
texts.en: Rosa María is 61 years old.  She provides shoe repair services.  She’s been in business for over 10 years.  She started this way of life because of the need to meet household expenses; with much effort she was able to support the four children she had in her care.  She will use the loan to buy thread, soles, leather, blades and scissors, among other necessary tools.

loans.use: to buy thread, soles, leather, blades and scissors.

loans.name: Ralph

texts.en:
Ralph is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with one child. 

Ralph is providing motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the utilities for the service.

Ralph has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ralph hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the utilities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beverages and general merchandise such as sugar for resale.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr: Madame Lucie vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 17 et 30ans. Lucie est éducatrice de profession. Mais elle s’active avec dynamisme  dans la couture et  le tricotage de pagnes, de draps et de nappes. Elle capitalise une expérience de  plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine. C’est a l’école de Sœurs qu’elle a appris la couture et beaucoup d’autres activités de femme.  Elle travaille sur commande et a chaque fois a l’approche des fêtes elle voit ses commandes  augmenter. Elle est sociétaire d’un des guichets de LU-IMCEC depuis juin 2006. Elle sollicite un prêt de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et  de fils pour finaliser ses commande et développer son activité surtout pendant les vacances. L’accroissement de ses revenus lui permet d’être plus autonome financièrement et aussi d’appuyer son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de leur foyer.
texts.en:
Madame Lucie lives in Sénégal. She is 51, married, and the mother of five children whose ages vary between 17 and 30. Lucie is an educator by profession, but she works enthusiastically at sewing and knitting wraps, sheets, and tablecloths. She has the advantage of more than 10 years' experience in this area. She learned sewing and other domestic activities at the Sisters' school. She works to order and each time the feast days approach, she finds her orders becoming numerous. 

Lucie has been a member of the savings and loan branch of LU-IMCEC since June 2006. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs intended for the purchase of cloth and thread to finish off her orders and expand her activity, especially during the holidays. The increase in her income will allow her to be more financially independent and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread.

loans.name: Juana Elisa

texts.es:
Juana Elisa tiene 31 años de edad vive en unión Libre junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de diez y siete años de edad en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Juana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  en el mercado de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno para hacer una casa para la familia. En su  tiempo libre se ocupa de los quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Juana Elisa is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children (ages 10 and 7) in the canton of Pueblo Viejo, which is part of Ventanas Province in Los Ríos.  

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Juana is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies wholesale and sells her products at a market in Ventanas.

Juana is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. She plans to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

With the financial support of this loan, she will be able to purchase what she needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Acquiring this loan will help her secure supplies more easily.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land so that she can build a house for her family. 

During her free time, Juana Elisa enjoys keeping herself busy by performing the household chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus

texts.es:
Carmen, vive con sus hijos de 25 y 30 años de edad,  quienes la apoyan mucho, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 9 años, lo atiende todos los días de la semana.
Esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para la compra de verduras y frutas, con esta inversión espera aumentar su atención y buen servicio a los clientes, su compra será en tomates, cebollas, plátanos, manzanas, uvas, sandia, bananas.
El objetivo es seguir en el negocio, ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Carmen lives with her children who are 25 and 30 years old and provide her with a lot of support.  Carmen sells fruit and vegetables and has owned her business for nine years.  She serves in it every day of the week.

Carmen is requesting a new loan to buy fruit and vegetables.  Through this investment, she hopes to provide a better service to her customers.  She will buy tomatoes, onions, plantains, apples, grapes, watermelon and bananas.

Carmen's goal is to continue in her business and help her children with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, bananas, apples, grapes and watermelon for her business

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado La Amistad es de la ciudad de Santaní. Está integrado por 13 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de buscar mayores ingresos para sus familiares e hijos. Desean que tengan una vida mejor a la que ellas tuvieron, es por eso de su lucha diaria.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Elida, ella se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de animales. Nos comenta que mediante esto ella logra mantener y ayudar a su familia. Cuenta que es una tarea no muy fácil, pues requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico, pero pese a esto le gusta mucho lo que hace. Le gustaría poder seguir con este trabajo y poder crecer más.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de animales para la cría como así también para la compra de alimentos para los mismos. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito, pues de tenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group named "La Amistad" ("Friendship"), is from the city of Santaní.  It has 13 women as members, all of whom are friends and neighbors in this city.  They came together with the plan of looking for better income for their families and children.  They want to be able to give them a better life, and this is why they strive on a daily basis.

One of the members is Señora Elida.  She works raising and then selling animals.  She tells us that this is not an easy task as it requires a lot of physical effort, but in spite of this she really enjoys what she does.  She would like to be able to continue with this work and be able to grow her business further.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of animals to raise, and also to buy feed for them.

She has placed her hope in this loan, as having it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy animals for raising and then selling, and to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Chancel Yannick

texts.fr:
Client de27 ans, il se lance dans la vente des habits ' il y'a de cela 10 ans , celibataire sans enfant, a la fin de ses etudes universitaires , n'ayant pas pu trouve du travail il se lance dans la vente des habits hommes , comme les vestes, pantalons en jeans, polos, et tous habits a la mode , selon la saison.
Il a fait de ce commerce son travail, il vend en moyenne 40.000 frs a 90.000 frs par jour;
Etant deja un client qui a beneficie de 3 prets , a son quatrieme cycle, il veut renforcer le stock de ses vetements en achetant des pantalons en lin, jeans, gabardine, des chemises a la mode et tous ce dont qu'interesse les hommes.
Il rembourse avec succes et a l'intention de faire des grosses epargnes et toujours en respectant les regles de gestion apprises sur le journal de caisse et la gestion de stocks.
Il a deja commence a faire des voyages pour aller acheter a l'etarnger et Cotonou, tres fier de lui , il a pour ambition d'ouvrir un grand magasin a pret a porter.
texts.en:
This 27-years-old client has run a clothes selling business for about ten years. He is single, with no children, and after graduating from college, as he could not find a job, he started selling menswear, such as jackets, trousers, jeanswear, polo shirts, suits and all fashionable items, depending on the season. With this business he makes a daily revenue between 40,000 and 90,000 francs.
This is his fourth loan as he already benefited from three previous ones. His intention is to increase his stock by purchasing linen trousers, jeanswear, gabardines, fashion shirts and other men fashion items. 
So far he has succesfully paid back and intends to make large savings and always follow the rules of business and inventory management learned through the community bank journal.
He has already begun to travel to buy supplies abroad as well as in Cotonou. Very proud of himself, he hopes to open a ready-to-wear fashion store.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, jeanswear, shirts, t-shirts, marinier style shirts, polos, jackets

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa lives with her husband and four children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. T. support her family, Hoa earns an income by selling rice. She started this business five years ago. 

Hoa would like T. take a loan T. expand her current business. With the loan, she will buy more kinds of rice of better quality which will enable her T. attract additional customers. 

Hoa hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her T. improve her family's living conditions and enable her T. set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ocherdene

texts.en: Ocherdene is 41-years-old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger, mongolian traditional nomadic tent, in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. His children go to school. He started his garment retailing business in 2005 by renting a counter in a market. He is well known by his fashionable products. Now that winter is approaching he needs to sell more warm clothes. He is a strong and hard working man who is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy more clothes from Erlian.

loans.use: to buy more clothes from Erlian.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: El señor Nelson tiene un taxi con el que trabaja en transporte Libre de pasajeros; además trabaja como profesor de educación física en una unidad educativa privada. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehículo, pues necesita cambio de aceites y fluidos y un chequeo general de frenos, caja de cambios y llantas. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos.
texts.en: Nelson has a taxi that he uses to provide passenger taxi services; he’s also a Physical Education teacher at a private school.   He needs the loan to provide maintenance for his taxi because it needs an oil and other fluids change and a general brake check, transmission repair and new tires.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto San Pedro zone; he’s single and has no children.

loans.use: to pay for taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Bellamis Astrid

texts.es: Bellamis de 35 años con su anterior credikiva le fue muy bien, ella está siendo apoyada por su esposo, quien aparece en la fotografia, pues esta dedicado especialmente a la atención de sus clientes.  Ella está muy entusiasmada y necesita invertir de nuevo, especialmente en esta época de mayor repunte  de sus ventas como lo es la de fin de año. Con su segundo credikiva comprará insumos al por mayor para ganar más descuentos y lograr una mejor utilidad. Su mensaje a los financiadores del crédito es el Siguiente:  “Quiero agradecer inmensamente la oportunidad que me dieron de crecer mi negocio con el préstamo otorgado”
texts.en:
The previous Kiva loan that Bellamis, age 35, had went very well for her.  Her husband, who appears in the photo, supports her.  She is especially dedicated to waiting on her customers.  She is very enthusiastic.

She needs to invest in her business again, especially at this time.  There is now a great upturn in sales like there is at the end of the year.

She will use her second Kiva loan to buy wholesale supplies in order to get discounts and get an improved profit.  Her message to the lenders of the loan is the following:  “I want to give you my immense gratitude for the opportunity you gave me to grow my business with the loan you provided.”

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Davaahuu

texts.en: Davaahuu is 43 years old and lives with her sister in ger(Mongolian yurt) in Govi-altai province, Mongolia. Her sister is a college student. Davaahuu started her business in 2009 by selling garments in the market. Even though she is fairly new to the business, her products are very stylish and cheap; therefore her products sell fast. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to fill her supplies with warmer clothes; therefore, she is requesting 3,800,000 MNT to buy new dresses and winter coats. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "My business is going so well and if I dont sell warmer clothes, my business will shutdown."

loans.use: To buy new dresses and winter coats.

loans.name: Matano

texts.en:
Matano is a single man who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His monthly expense is school fees for his young siblings.

For the past 3 years, he has operated a battery charging and mobile sales business, selling as retail to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of power shortages in the business.

With the 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase mobile phone chargers and calling cards for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone chargers and calling cards for resale

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 27 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en casa alquilada junto a su pareja Daniel de 30 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanto voluntad y entrega han logrado cultivar Marina y Daniel, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y frondosos. Lleva 07 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta su localidad, lugar donde recibe mejores precios por sus granos de cacao. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en el mantenimiento respectivo de sus plantas como la poda y el deshierbo de maleza. En adelante espera sembrar más plantas de cacao. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP, por lo que se compromete a aportar sus pagos en la fecha indicada, ya que desea acceder a otros prestamos posteriormente. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratara jornaleros para que le apoyen en desmonte y cosechas de sus productos.
texts.en:
Marina, 27, is a hardworking woman living in a rented house with her spouse, Daniel, 30, and their three beloved children who are the reason behind all her efforts.  The products that Marina and Daniel grow with such good will and dedication have helped them much towards their lives’ progress.  

Every morning she starts out working in her fields because she knows that on the care she provides her cocoa bean crops depends the quality of the products she’ll obtain.  What she enjoys the most about her work is caring for the crops and she feels very happy when she sees them big and dense with leaves.  She’s been in this line of work for seven years and considers the most difficult part having to transport her products from her fields to her location which is where she gets the best prices for her cocoa beans.

She will use the requested loan to hire day laborers to help with crop maintenance especially pruning and weeding.  In the future, she hopes to plant more cocoa bean plants.

This will be MFP loan #4 and she commits to make her payments on the indicated dates because she wants to access future loans.  She will use the requested 3000 new soles to hire day laborers to help her clear weeds and harvest her products.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has a spare parts business. He first started off as a mechanic before acquiring money to roll out the current business. Meshack was introduced to Milango by an employee.

He is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more spare parts. The main challenges in his business are high cost of products and some customers not paying on time.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANCACHA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche y fideos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Francisca belongs to the “QORIMANCACHA” community bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco. She is 52 years old, married and has four children. She divides her household activities with her grocery store business, selling rice, sugar, oil, milk and noodles. She works from 8 a.m. until 10 p.m. The business helps make headway for her children, which is why Francisca wants to expand it. She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and noodles at wholesale. She feels happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy wholesale rice, sugar, milk, and noodles.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa is a 53 year old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan who helps support two members of her family. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to buy supplies and materials for making chocolate and other items for weddings and events which she will be selling. She is planning on opening a specialty shop to sell her products. In the future she hopes that she will be able to buy a her family a house.

loans.use: to buy materials for making chocolate and other wedding items

loans.name: Fabian's Group

texts.en:
Fabian is 68 years old, has 6 children, and lives in Kowiti A village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya. Kowiti A village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Nyasao borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Fabian and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Fabian works as a peasant farmer, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Fabian and three other promoters in his community, including Benter, Pamela and Rose, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Fabian will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Fabian wants to be a promoter because he believes that the dispenser system will prevent water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Fabian’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Klouyibo Ayawavi

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Klouyibo Ayawavi was born on 28th December 1972 in Sotouboua. She is married and has three children (03); she is in charge of three other children belonging to relatives. She is illiterate but very intelligent and started the trade of loincloth and plates very early. With the revenue from her small business she significantly contributes to meeting the needs of her home for the income of her husband is insufficient and too irregular to meet the needs of the family. As a skilful salesperson, she often calls on prospects to present new cloth ranges. The strategy works very well as evidenced by the growth of the activity over the past two years; however she lacks financial resources to meet the demand from her customers. As at now, the demand remains high thanks to the approaching end of year festive period. She therefore requested a new credit to meet the needs of her clients. The amount requested is $850. It will allow her to build up a sufficient stock of loincloth for the end of year festive period. Mrs. A. Klouyibo Ayawavi has enough experience and talent to successfully run this activity.

Madame A. Klouyibo Ayawavi est née le 28 Décembre 1972 à Sotouboua. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle prend en charge 3 autres enfants de proches parents. Analphabète mais très ingénieuse, elle s’est lancée très tôt dans le commerce de pagne et d’assiette. Avec les revenus de son petit commerce de pagne, elle contribue énormément au besoin du ménage car le revenu est non seulement très insuffisant mais irrégulier pour couvrir les charges du foyer. Très commerciale, elle va souvent vers sa clientèle pour lui proposer les nouvelles gammes de pagnes. Cette dernière stratégie fonctionne bien car l’activité a pris de l’ampleur ces 2 dernières années, mais les moyens financiers lui font défaut pour répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle. Actuellement, la demande est encore très forte car les fêtes de fin d’année s’approchent. Ce qui l’amène à solliciter un nouveau crédit pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Le montant de $850 sollicité servira à constituer un stock suffisant de pagnes pour les fêtes de fin d’année. Madame A. Klouyibo Ayawavi dispose de beaucoup d’expérience et de talent pour mener à bien cette activité.

loans.use: To buy loincloth

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She sells firewood to the community in which she lives. She carts the firewood from the nearby villages to her house. This is one commercial activity which is highly regulated because of its negative impact on the environment. However, the majority of the people still depend on firewood to do their cooking and prepare food for sale to the public.

Mariama sometimes runs out of supplies. She therefore intends to apply the loan to create buffer stock before the rains set in by late May.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is an active women who is working hard for her business. She has worked since 2003.
