Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa para la familia.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Rigail Ramiro M. C. is 26 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and child in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The Nueva Unión community bank is located in Guamayacu, in Echeandia canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Rigail is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.  He is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  Rigail faces challenges in his business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a house for his family.

Rigail enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Đoàn

texts.en:
B. Đoàn Thị lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - B. Ninh. She is married, has two school-aged children and makes a living by selling wood products to local businesses and people who live in her community. She has been in this business for more than three years and earns about 4,000,000 VND a month from her work.

In 2009, B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business.  She has successfully repaid two previous loans and has applied for a third, for 7,392,000 VND, to buy additional supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and northern Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


B. Đoàn Thị (20203050017) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - B. Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, B. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  B. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, B. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, B. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  B. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  B. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía B. Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to buy supplies for a wood-making business

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gabriela; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de celulares y servicio para celulares, ella trabaja en una empresa de telefonía y por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar en el negocio de venta de celulares. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar celulares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gabriela belongs to the San Rafael Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Gabriella is 35 years old, married, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling cell phones and cell service.  She works in a telephone company, and through this work she gets her children ahead.

She wants to improve her business of selling cell phones.  She is requesting the loan to buy cell phones.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cell phones.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina N. lives in the Mengo Mackay neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has one child in school. Madina has a business selling clothes. She has been in this business for three years, and works 7 days out of every week. Madina sells her products at the market, wholesale and retail. Madina has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.The main business challenges for Madina are transportation and seasonality. Her goal for her business is to see it grow big and start importing clothes. Madina lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are food, school fees, and medication

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Sabira's Group

texts.en:
Sabira is the leader of this group. She is 69 and is married to a farmer. Together with her husband, who is a pensioner, she has raised five daughters and three sons. All her children are married and live with their families. Only the youngest son lives with his parents (under the Kyrgyz traditions the youngest son’s family lives with the parents). To make additional money to meet their needs, the family breeds cattle. They have been doing it for twenty years, so this family has a lot of experience in this sphere. With this loan, Sabira wants to purchase three farm animals for breeding and construction materials for repairing the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase three farm animals for breeding

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 54 years old. He has five children who are aged 13-24 years old. His wife is a farmer. 

Francois sells timber and he has been selling timber for 20 years. With this business he feeds his family with no difficulty. He is requesting a loan to buy equipment which will help him make timber products and hence make more income.

loans.use: to buy equipment for making timber products.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence works as a farmer in Surallah, South Cotabato. He has been growing rice for five years. According to Laurence, he earns about 10,000 PHP per month from farming. He also raises pigs in his backyard piggery.

Laurence plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizer and feed. In the future, he hopes to improve his farm business.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Carolina's Communal Bank Group

texts.en:
Carolina is the president of a communal bank that consists of seven people, five of whom are women. Carolina is 20 years old and lives in San Lorenzo in northwest Ecuador. She is unmarried and lives with her parents. Her business, pictured in the photo, is a small general store in which she sells necessities such as cooking oil, canned food, toothbrushes, and selected over-the-counter medicines to meet the needs of her customers. 

Carolina works alone and reports that her business is going well. She is seeking this loan, her first, to purchase more products for her store to provide more variety to her customers. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her business. She is a young entrepreneur who began this business on her own and is working to see it grow.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Aida has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more stock to sell.
Aida has been in this business for three years now and also earns additional income from her fish-vending business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Desman

texts.en:
Desman is a 26 year-old married man with three children, living in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the family and his dream is to own a permanent house.

After dropping out of school due to lack of funds, he decided to venture into farming and he is happy with the way business is growing.  Desman needs the loan to clear land for planting cow peas.  His dream is to buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes

loans.use: To clear land for planting cow peas.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is an ambitious 30-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with four children, three of whom are in school. Since the year 2007, she has been operating a retail shop so as to meet the needs of her family. She supplements her income from the earnings she get from dairy farming. In the next five years, she wants to be running a successful business, and her dream is to be a wholesaler. 

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, wheat flour, rice salt and beans. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour, rice salt and beans.

loans.name: Pupu

texts.en:
Pupu is 56 years old, married, and has four children. She owns & operates a business providing men's tailoring services to local community members.  She has 7 years of experience, and needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional fabric & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Pupu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Pupu's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric & materials

loans.name: C9605 Muyange I Group

texts.en:
Innocent is 31 years old and he is married with five children aged between 2 and 14 years old. He sells Irish potatoes and maize. Innocent is the team leader of this group which is called "MUYANGE I" in local language and he is the first person on the left side.  He has ten years of experience in this business. He works from 7am until 7pm every week except on Saturday and he currently employs four people to help him. 

Innocent and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses by purchasing more products such as Irish potatoes and maize for sale. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to reinvest in this business and to save in the future. Innocent will also be able to pay school fees for hischildren.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantities of Irish potatoes and maize for sale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza, tiene 37 años y 8 hijos.
Juana es feriante lleva a las ferias cereales, recuerda que con el primer crédito que obtuvo compró cereales para las ferias pero era en menor cantidad, ella se siente muy bien porque ha progresado, le encanta las capacitaciones porque le ayudan a ser mejor persona y a tener muchos valores. El préstamo que solicita lo utilizará para poder compra cereales para las ferias pero ahora ella compra en mayor cantidad. Su meta es poder comprarse un carrito.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Granito de Mostaza” (Little Mustard Seed) communal bank.  She’s 37 years old and has 8 children.

Juana is a merchant in the markets.  She sells cereals.  She recalls that she used her first loan to buy cereals to sell in the markets but in a small quantity.  She feels very good because she’s made progress.  She loves the training because it helps her become a better person and to have many values.  The loan she’s asking for is to be able to buy cereals for the market but now she buys them in larger amounts.  Her goal is to be able to buy herself a little car.

loans.use: to buy cereals at wholesale.

loans.name: Nawras

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 29 years old, married, and lives with her husband and four children.

Nawras has been a tailor since 2008. She makes, repairs, and alters clothing professionally, including suits, coats and trousers for women, men and kids. She has good experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is becoming well known in her surrounding areas.

She is requesting $1,200 to purchase an industrial sewing machine and to add more supplies like buttons, zippers and thread. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial sewing machine and to add more supplies like buttons, zippers and thread.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is aged 36 and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is married with four children aged between 20 and 4 and all schooling. She has been in farming for over six years with her produce of milk, eggs and vegetables going to the local market.

Pamela has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to give a boost to her poultry farming by purchasing more poultry birds.She says this will increase her family's income and make life more bearable.She is focusing on rearing at least 1000 birds in her farm.

She concurs with other farmers about high cost of feed which is a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother of four children aged 22, 18, 8 and 6 years old; two of which are school going. She has a food kiosk and has been in the business for the past nine years. She gets a monthly income of KES 22,000.

This is her third loan term in KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase food stuff to cook and sell like maize flour beans, wheat flour, rice and cooking fat. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in her business and support her family budget. Her dream is to stabilize her business and expand it to accommodate more customers.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her business.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José armando cuenta con 36 años de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando la primaria sayuri está cursando 6º grado de primaria, melisa esta en 5º grado Jairo en 2º y jaseer 3 de preescolar mientras que el pequeño tiene 3 años de edad, su esposa se llama lucero ella se dedica a la casa.

El es chofer de su propio taxi es transportista urbano de taxis lo cual invirtió su préstamo en el mantenimiento del auto, a José armando le gustaría poner otro taxi para así ir aumentado su negocio.
texts.en:
José Armando is 36 years old, married, and has five children who are in school.  Sayuri is in sixth grade, Melisa is in fifth grade, Jairo is in second grade and Jaseer is in his third year of pre-school.  Their youngest is 3 years old.  José Armando's wife is called Lucero and she takes care of their home.

José Armando drives his own taxi.  He is an urban transport provider.  He invested his loan in having his car serviced.  José Armando would like to have another taxi so that he can continue growing his business.

loans.use: to have his taxi serviced

loans.name: Samith Antonio

texts.es: Samith vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia con su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 2 a 14 años. Allí es propietario de una frutera, negocio  que inició hace 11 años, cuando llegó de su natal San Marcos, pueblo ubicado en el departamento de Sucre. Inicialmente trabajó como albañil, pero su  ímpetu  de  emprendedor lo impulsaba permanentemente, por eso  cuando su primo le sugirió iniciarse como negociante, con la venta de frutas tropicales,no lo pensó dos veces y empezó porque era un  trabajo que llamó su atención debido a que  lo realizaria con menos esfuerzo y mayor utilidad. Hoy su frutera está ubicada en plena plaza principal del municipio, muy cerca al mar, bajo un frondoso árbol en el que suelen reposar los transeúntes. Buena parte de sus clientes son pensionados, de una exitosa empresa de Puertos en Colombia, que se reúnen y son personas confiables a quienes  les da crédito a 30 días. Su sueño es tener su propio local y lograr más adelante comprar su vivienda, por eso trabaja diariamente, con el fin de lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un nuevo armario de madera, para exhibir los frutos y abrirse hacia la oferta de tubérculos y verduras. Su inversión sería exitosa pues está basada en la demanda del mercado y el buen conocimiento y aprecio que sus clientes le imparten.
texts.en:
Samith lives in the Puerto Colombia municipality.  He lives with his wife and their five children; ages 2 to 14.  He sells fruit there, a business that he started 11 years ago when he came to his native San Marcos, a town in the Sucre department.

He initially worked as a bricklayer, but his enterprising impetus continually motivated him.  When his cousin suggested that he start a business selling tropical fruits, he didn’t think twice.  He started the work because it caught his attention.  He would do it with less effort and greater profit.

His fruit business is now located at the principal plaza of the municipality.  It is close to the sea under a leafy tree where passers-by often rest.  A good part of his customers are pensioners from a successful business in Puertos in Colombia.  They are trustworthy people, they get together, and he gives them credit for 30 days.

His dream is to have his own place and to later on manage to buy a house.  Therefore, he works every day in order to do this.  

He is currently applying for his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy a new wood cabinet to display the fruit and to start selling tubers and vegetables.

His investment will be successful because it is based on the market demand and good knowledge and appreciation that his customers give him.

loans.use: to buy a new wood cabinet to display the fruit and to be buy tubers and vegetables.

loans.name: Guideon

texts.en:
Guideon says that "determination and perseverance" are the characteristics needed in managing a rice farming business. He is 45 years old and married, having only one child.

Guideon plans to increase his yield despite the high cost of basic commodities, farm inputs, and labor cost of hiring laborers. He is determined to obtain his goal but due to a shortage of financial matters, he is asking for additional working capital worth 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). This amount will enable him to buy necessary farm inputs to make his rice farming more productive and profitable. He would be grateful for the requested amount because with the profit, he could provide basic necessities for his family and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for his rice farming business.

loans.name: Cesar Mateo

texts.es:
Cesar Mateo sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y él   sigue dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. En esta oportunidad Cesar Mateo solicita el préstamo para la compra de alimentos para sus cuyes como pasto, maíz, comida mejorada para sus animalitos.

Cesar Mateo está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en: Cesar Mateo continues as a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Comuzone III" community bank in Cusco.  He continues raising animals such as guinea pigs.  On this occasion, Cesar Mateo is requesting a loan to buy food for his guinea pigs such as fodder, corn and improved feed.  He is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy food for his guinea pigs such as fodder, corn and improved feed

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nelida tiene 32  años; es madre soltera de su pequeño hijo Carlos de 12 años; Nelida vive en la casa de sus padres quienes le dan apoyo para que pueda sobresalir mas adelante. Nelida es una mujer trabajadora. Desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra. Nelida es campesina y cuenta con un terreno donde cultiva plantas de cacao. Viene trabajando 05 años en sus propias tierras, y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros  para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en su localidad; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Este será su crédito número 08 con MFP, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y siempre esta pendiente del bienestar de sus compañeros. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará plantas de cacao para que pueda incrementar sus productos.
texts.en: Nelida is 32 years old and the single mother of a small son Carlos who is 12 years old. Nelida lives in her parents' house. They support her so that she might excel in the future. Nelida is a very hardworking woman. As a young girl her parents taught her how to work on the farm. Nelida is a rural woman and has her own plot of land where she grows cocoa plants. She has been working her own land for the last 5 years and at harvest time she hires day labourers to make the fruit collection faster. What she likes the best about her work is harvesting the fruits from the plants as she thus feels that all the months of hard work give her in return quality fruits. She thinks that the most diffiuclt thing is to transport her products from the farm to the collection centres located in her area. This will be her 8th loan with MFP. She is willling to to make her repayments on time as she wants to have access to another loan in the future. She is a very supportive member of her communal bank and is always concerned about the well-being of her peers. With the 1,000 nuevos soles (PEN) requested, she will buy cocoa plants so that she can increase her production.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants.

loans.name: Zeus

texts.es: Zeus de 22 años es un joven que tiene un negocio de venta de carnes  desde hace 4 años, cuando su padre laboraba en una empresa y junto a él aprendió a comercializar productos, pues conseguia retazos de las empresas de confecciones y fabricaban vestidos, que vendían a un buen precio. Posteriormente como Zeus continuó estudiando,  se alejó un poco de esta actividad y como su madre vive en una población y le envía carne para que venda, ha logrado conseguir muchos clientes y generar importantes ingresos con los que cuenta diariamente, Entusiasmado, quiere hacer crecer su negocio y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará carne al por mayor  de res y de cerdo, para venderla a crédito y de contado. En su infraestructura cuenta con cuchillos, pesos y todo lo que requiere este negocio, para un funcionamiento básico de su negocio. Con  su credikiva  planea que será una inversión exitosa porque la hace sobre pedidos, en una época de gran movimiento comercial como lo es el final del año que viene con fiestas navideñas y de recibimiento del nuevo año.Su meta mas adelante es incluir nuevos productos afines a la carne, como verduras frescas y frutas.Zeus está satisfecho por la forma como ha venido creciendo su negocio y reconoce que la oportunidad de estar en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, le ha representado una oportunidad de inversión para su futura familia , ganacias actuales y contribuye permanentemente a su crecimiento como persona y compo empresario de la miccroempresa.
texts.en:
Zeus, 22, is a young man with a butcher shop he’s had for four years.  His father worked for a firm and alongside him he learned to sell products because he’d get remnants from fabric firms and would make dresses that they’d then sell at good prices.  Later on, as Zeus continued to study, he distanced himself somewhat from this activity but since his mother lives in a town and sends him meat to sell he’s managed to acquire many customers and to generate significant income that he counts on daily.  Encouraged, he wants t make his business grow and this is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, his second financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he will use to buy beef and pork at wholesale to sell it on credit and for cash.

He has knives and scales in his infrastructure and everything this business needs for basic functioning.  He expects that his Kiva loan will be a successful investment because he works based on prior orders during a season with much commercial activity which is the end of the year when Christmas and New Years happen.

His goal for later on is to include other products akin to meat like fresh vegetables and fruit.  Zeus is satisfied with the way his business has been growing and recognizes that the opportunity to be affiliated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has meant an opportunity for investment for his future family, for current profits and that it contributes permanently to his growth as a person and as a micro businessman.

loans.use: to buy beef and pork at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
Rosa Luz tiene 42 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Patria, ella se dedica al comercio osea tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y a la agricultura. 

Rosa Luz pertenece al banco comunal “Mercaditos de Patria” de la ciudad de Patria. Ya son seis años que trabaja con la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Patria de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. Desde la ciudad del Cusco a nuestro destino hay una distancia de 200 Km. (aproximado nueve horas de viaje) hasta llegar a la localidad de Patria. Durante el viaje cruzaremos parte de la cordillera andina Peruana, observaremos hermosos valles interandinos, comunidades indígenas andinas quechuas y camino a la Reserva de Biosfera del Parque Nacional del Manu. 

En esta oportunidad Rosa Luz requiere el préstamo para mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas y desea comprar semillas, abono y otras cosas más. Su sueño Rosa Luz de es ampliar el negocio.   

Rosa Luz agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rosa Luz is 42 years old. She has three children and lives in the city of Patria. She is a merchant, that is to say she has a little store selling groceries and farm supplies. 

Rosa belongs to the communal bank "Mercaditos de Patria" from the city of Patria. She has been with the Asociación Arariwa for six years and it is going very well. The communal bank meeting takes place every thirty days in the city of Patria in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco. From the city of Cusco our destination is a distance of 200 km (approximately a nine hour trip) until arriving at Patria. During the trip we cross part of the Andes Mountains of Peru where we see beautiful valleys, indigenous Quechua communities, and the road to the Biosphere Reserve in the Manu National Park.

At this time Rosa Luz is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as, for example, bags of rice, sacks of flour, and other items like seeds, fertilizer and more. Rosa's dream is to expand her business. Rosa Luz is grateful, and values the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as, for example, bags of rice, sacks of flour, and other items like seeds, fertilizer and more

loans.name: William George

texts.en:
George is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. 

For the past ten years, George has been working hard to manage his retail shop, in which he sells sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, salt, bread, groundnuts, and soya flour. 

To help expand his business, George has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, salt, bread, groundnuts, and soya flour and it will help George to generate greater profits and increase capital. George hopes that, in the future, he will be able to expand his business. 

George is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like George, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, salt, bread, groundnuts, and soya flour.

loans.name: Amelito

texts.en:
Amelito is a 46-year-old married man and a father of four grown up children from Trinidad, Bohol. He earns a living through a livestock sales business. Amelito has been in the business for more than 6 years now. 

Amelito is requesting to take a loan to buy more chickens and piglets to raise. A loan will help him improve his business as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and piglets to raise

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.en:
Anne Marie aged 55 years. She is married with 7 children aged between 6 and 23 years.  They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 9 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 53 years old, described as a strong and very hard-working woman. She began her business when her husband`s income was not enough for her daughter`s education. Her husband works as a fisherman and his income is not fixed. Elena decided to start to cook her favorite foods and sell them. Her clients were their same neighbors, but her business began to have too many clients and the size of her house’s kitchen and tools to cook, do not allow her to increase her sales and earnings.

Today Elena and their family request your help to receive a loan of $375 because she wants to purchase raw materials and tools and increase her sales. She plans to return the loan in a term of 6 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Elena tiene 53 años, descR. como una señora luchadora y muy trabajadora, ella inicio su negocio al ver que el salario de su esposo no era suficiente para la educación de su hija, ya que el señor trabaja como pescador y su salario es inestable, Elena decidió comenzar a cocinar sus comidas favoritas, sus clientes eran sus mismos vecinos, pero su negocio comenzó a tener mas clientela y el tamaño de la cocina de su casa además de las herramientas, no le permite aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.

Hoy Elena y su familia piden tu ayuda para recibir un préstamo de $375 Dlls y poder abastecerse de insumos y aumentar su capacidad en comidas, Ella planea retornarlo en un plazo de 6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and tools and increase her sales

loans.name: Fuseina

texts.en:
Fusiena is 35 years old and married, with 3 children. She sells grains and cereals in her community, including rice, beans, maize and groundnuts.

Because Fusiena buys on credit from her suppliers, it tends to reduce her profit margin. During the KRABAN 'TEACH' learning sessions, Fusiena got to know about the KIVA program, and she is therefore seeking a loan for seed capital to be able to pay off her suppliers at the point of purchase. She hopes this will improve her profit levels.

loans.use: Seed capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 48 year old woman. She started a community training college to offer nursery teaching, computer, and counseling courses to 12 students. The college now has 40 students.

Florence is an innovative and hard-working woman who wishes to borrow funds to renovate the college buildings and purchase a printer. She has 10 years of experience in education. Her dream is to expand the capacity of the college and to publish books.

Florence has 5 children aged between twenty three and twelve. They are all at school.

loans.use: Renovation of a community college building and purchase of a printer.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio// Business Description

Dolores tiene una experiencia de 5 años con su negocio. El cual la pudo iniciar gracias a los ahorros que tenia de sus trabajos como empleada domestica. Decide comenzar a trabajar con negocio propio y opta por una tienda. La tiene ubicada en la casa de su suegra con la que lleva una buena relación. Ella solo la atiende por las tardes y por las mañanas su suegra presta su servicio al local. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m.

Dolores has five years of experience in her business. Thanks to her savings from her work in domestic service, she was able to open her own business. She decided to open a shop in her mother-in-law’s house, with whom she has a good relationship with. She attends to the shop in the afternoon and her mother-in-law attends to it in the morning. She works every day of the week from 6:00 am to 11:00 pm.

Uso del Préstamo// Loan Use

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para surtir su local. Además exhibir otros productos que por falta de capital no compra. Y la gente le pide estos productos. Ella espera con la inversión que realizara poder mejorar sus ingresos. Y prestarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

She will use the credit to invest in the purchase of products to supply her shop. In addition, she will supply the shop with new products, that clients have asked for, but that to date she was unable to buy due to lack of capital. She hopes that with the investment, she will be able to enhance her income and to give a better service to her clients.

Información Personal// Personal Information

Dolores es madre soltera. Tiene 36 años y tres hijos los que estudian. A pesar de estar separada del padre de sus hijos ha logrado con su esfuerzo y dedicación darle lo que ellos necesitan. Ha podido ir terminando de construir su casita de cemento. Sus hijos en sus momentos libres también le ayudan con la atención del negocio.

Dolores is a single mother. She is 36 years old and has three children that study. Despite being separated from the father of her children, she has accomplished with effort and dedication to provide them with what they need. She has been able to continue building her house of cement. He children also help her in the shop in their spare time.

loans.use: Invertir y exhibir productos nuevos// Invest and supply with new products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more furniture for her private school.

loans.name: Eulalie

texts.fr:
Miss Eulalie D. Z. was born on February 12, 1964 in Kpalimé. She is married with four children and also looks after her grandson. She sells firewood and charcoal. Her husband, who works as a driver at the port, is unable to meet the needs of the family, so his wife takes on most of the expenses. However, she runs into difficulties in her business because of lack of funds. Miss D. Z. is therefore asking for a loan of $600 to stock up on merchandise.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle D. Eulalie épse Z. est née le 12 février 1964 à Kpalimé. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants et à charge son petit fils. Elle est commerçante de bois de chauffage, de charbon de bois et d’orange. Son mari étant chauffeur de profession au port, n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins de la famille donc sa femme prend part à la plus grande partie des charges. Mais, elle rencontre des difficultés dans ses activités, problème de fonds de commerce. Pour cela mademoiselle D. Eulalie épse Z. sollicite un montant de $600 pour le stockage des marchandises.

loans.use: To buy stock of wood and charcoal

loans.name: Gulgaz

texts.en: Gulgaz is a mother of three children. She and her family live in the Salyan region, in the Yenikand village. This 40-year-old woman started a farming business 9 years ago. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur 34 years old. He is married and has two children. His sister and his elderly mother live with him in a rented house. He has a small market to sell home supplies and he applied to get $1200 to purchase new goods, make new shelves, paint the shop and do some advertising for to increase his income and provide a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new goods

loans.name: Namunina B(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Deborah A.. She is currently in the business of brick laying and is requesting a loan of UGX 900,000 to expand her business. Deborah is 25 years old and she is single. Each week Deborah makes approximately UGX 35,000 in profits. With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to start a livestock business.

Deborah is joined in her small group by Ruth N., Hasifah N., Margret N., and Gladys Z.. Ruth N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying. She is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to re-invest in the business. Hasifah N. is currently in the business of selling fruits and vegeables. She is requesting a loan of UGX 200,000 to increase her inventory stock. Margret N. is currently in the business of brick laying as well and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to re-invest in the brick business. Gladys Z. is currently in the restaurant business and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy more food warmers.

loans.use: To expand the businesses and make more profits

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en: Neneng, 29, is a widow and has 1 child, age 6. Her husband passed away several years ago because of an illness. Since then she has had to work by herself to earn income for her and her child. Everyday she goes around selling floor mattresses on credit, earning $5 a day. Now she is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business so she could earn more income for her child's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis is 32 years old and has one son who goes to school. He is married to Ramona Leon. Luis has been selling clothes for women and children in the area of Santaní for the past three years. He has steady clients thanks to the competitive pricing of his merchandise.

With a lot of effort he was able to get his own home where he lives with his wife and children. In the future he would like to build a commercial space in his house where he could open a a store and also sell his clothes.

Luis has in the past requested loans and he has always maintained a good record on his payments. Now he wants to obtain a new loan with which he will be able to buy merchandise such as t-shirts, blouses, jeans, shorts, shoes, and underwear, among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Luis tiene 32 años, tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, y esta casado con la señora Ramona León. Luis se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas y niños, en toda la zona de Santaní, desde hace 3 años y ya cuenta con una buena clientela formada, gracias a los buenos precios de sus mercaderías.

Con mucho esfuerzo logró tener su casa propia en donde vive con sus hijos y esposa. Tiene proyectado en el futuro construir un salón comercial en su casa para abrir una despensa y una ropería.

Luis ya ha solicitado créditos anteriormente y ha mantenido siempre una buena referencia en sus pagos, hoy el desea solicitar un nuevo crédito para poder comprar mercaderías como remeras, camisas, jeans, shorts, zapatos, ropa interior, entre otros.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business (clothes for women and children)

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, age 41, is married with 7 children, ages 22, 21, 20, 19, 18, and 17 years old. She owns a food business, in which she sells fish and other items. She works from 7am to 10pm daily. From this business, which she started 7 years ago, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $290.

In the past. Asha has taken a loan in order to increase her business. She successfully repaid this loan and now hopes for a new loan to purchase more fish and other food items. She is a member of the Ari Mpya loan group, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more food items and fish

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame T. is a palm oil extractor. Palm oil is very popular for cooking in Ghana. He is married, but his wife's income from farming does not cover the expenses for Kwame and his four children. Demand for his palm oil is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase the profits he brings back to his family.

He is asking for $500 in additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita and her husband Alberto have three children. She is 49 years old and sells pork stew, travelling throughout her neighborhood and others nearby areas. She purchases supplies daily in Brazil, specifically in the city of Foz do Yguazú. She, along with her hardworking family, has run this business since 2004. She will use this loan to purchase supplies needed to run her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Margarita de 49 años, esta casada con Alberto, y tienen 3 hijos. La Señora Margarita se dedica a la venta de puchero de cerdo, su venta lo realiza en forma ambulante por todo el barrio y otros a los que alcanza a cubrir.

La mercadería lo compra diariamente del Brasil específicamente de la ciudad de Foz do Yguazú, pues la misma limita con nuestro país. Desde el año 2004, son una familia muy trabajadoras y luchadoras; el crédito le servirá para aumentar su stock de mercaderías.

loans.use: Purchase of meat (pork) in large quantities for resale

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina baji is the wife of M. Y. and lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house where she has lived for the past 3 years. She is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. Her two elder sons work in a marble factory. The next eldest to them has a butcher business. Her youngest son is in 7th standard. Her two daughters are in 8th standard (level). Her husband has a Punjabi food (samosas) business and has been in this profession for the last 3 years. Nagina baji successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan for her husband so that he can buy more goods for making the food.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members: Shahnaz baji and Ruqaiya baji each want a loan to buy thread for their carpet weaving businesses; Zubaida baji wants a loan to produce ceiling material; and Haleema baji wants a loan to buy more plants for her plants business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa O. started her local restaurant nine years ago in Sunyani where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 37 years old and married with two kids who are currently in school.

She serves many kinds of local dishes, like fufu, rice balls, and banku, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and taken with hot pepper or soup.

Yaa wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood. She also hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children's education. She is a member of the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan funds and peer pressure to repay the loan. Yaa was attending her usual group meeting when her photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo M. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente del municipio de Somotillo. Es padre de cuatro pequeños hijos siendo ellos la razón por la cual se esfuerza grandemente en su actividad para suplir sus necesidades.

El señor M. hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de obtener el capital financiero para la compra de terneros de desarrollo y además para invertir en sus cultivos. Es de importancia destacar que por medio de este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su familia. Actualmente se ha mantenido como fiel cliente de Ceprodel y son sus sueños mejorar su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Reinaldo M. is from the city of Chinandega, specifically from the municipality of Somotillo. He is the father of four little children who are the reason why he works so hard to furnish what they need.

Señor M. today has turned to Ceprodel with the goal of getting financial capital to buy calves to raise and also to invest in his crops. It is important to emphasize that, by means of this loan, his family benefits as much as he does. Now he has become a loyal client of Ceprodel and his dreams are to improve his work.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Purchase of Calves to Raise

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua. Antonia es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Antonia tiene un kiosco ubicado dentro del complejo deportivo de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende golosinas, frutas, bebidas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hermana durante todos los días de la semana. Además Antonia tiene un carro que alquila diariamente y recibe un pago diario.

Antonia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago para comprar otro carro. Antonia sueña con tener una casa en el centro de la ciudad y tener una tienda, que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the communal bank Llapanchik, which means “Everyone Together” in quechua. Antonia is married, 42 years old and has three children. Antonia has a kiosk located inside a sports complex in the city of Ayacucho where she sells sweets, fruit, and drinks, an activity which she realizes with the help of her sister every day of the week. In addition, Antonia has a car that she rents and receives payment for on a daily basis.

Antonia needs a loan of 3,000.00 soles, funds that will be invested into a partial payment for another car. Antonia dreams of having a house in the center of the city, of having a store, and of seeing her children become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Antonia needs a loan of 3,000.00 soles, funds that will be invested into a partial payment to purchase another car.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine sells medicine and supplies in her pharmacy. She has been in this business for a long time. 

Josephine lives in Okoko, in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 32 years old and married. She has no children. 

Josephine is a LAPO Microfinance client. She will use the loan of 140,000 naira ($1200 USD) to purchase more medicine and provisions for resale. She says "thank you" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase medicine and provisions for resale

loans.name: Thi Minh's Group

texts.vi:
Đặng Thị Minh sinh năm 1956 ( mã số 010105060001 ). chị vay mức 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Gia đình chị có máy làm đậu. Hàng ngày chị thường dậy sớm để làm đậu. Sáng ra chị đem đậu đi chợ bán và cung cấp cho một số cửa hàng ăn uống. Con trai chị cũng đã đi làm hỗ chợ kinh tế gia đình. Chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Đặng Thị Hoa sinh năm 1964 ( mã số 010105060002). chị vay mức 4.142.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi gà. Chị có lương hưu hang tháng. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Nguyễn Thị Lạng sinh năm 1956  ( mã số 010105060005). chị vay mức 4.142.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi gà, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ/ tháng.
 Lê Thị Tâm sinh năm 1969 ( Mã số 010105060007) chị vay mức 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng  bán đồ ăn sang( bún, phở,…). Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Lê Thị Tất sinh năm 1971 ( mã số 010105060009). chị vay mức 4.142.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi gà, bò. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Nguyễn Thị Tiến sinh năm 1964 ( mã số 010105060011). chị vay mức 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ sắt vụn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Nguyễn Thị Hạnh sinh năm 1963 ( mã số 010105060013). chị vay mức 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư mua thức ăn cho cá . Thu nhập bình quân khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ /tháng.
texts.en:
D. Thi Minh, born 1956 (ID 010105060001), requests a loan of VND4,142,000 for working capital. Monthly income of her family is about VND3,000,000. Her family has a tofu-making machine. Everyday she gets up early to make tofu. Then in the morning she sells tofu in the market and distributes tofu to some restaurants. Her son is also working to support the family. She is the leader of the borrowing group including:

D. Thi Hoa, born 1964 (ID 010105060002), requests a loan of VND4,142,000 to raise chickens. She receives pension every month. Average monthly income of her family is about VND3,000,000.

N. Thi Lang, born 1956 (ID 010105060005), requests a loan of VND4,142,000 to raise chickens. Average monthly income of her family is about VND3,500,000.

L. Thi Tam, born 1969 (ID 010105060007), requests a loan of VND4,142,000 to open a shop selling breakfast (vermicelli, noodles,etc.). Average monthly income of her family is about VND3,000,000.

L. Thi Tat, born 1971 (ID 010105060009), requests a loan of VND4,142,000 to raise chickens and cows. Average monthly income of her family is about VND4,000,000.

N. Thi Tien, born 1964 (ID 010105060011), requests a loan of VND4,142,000 to trade steel scraps. Average monthly income of her family is about VND2,500,000.

N. Thi Hanh, born 1963 (ID 010105060013), requests a loan of VND4,142,000 to buy food for fish. Average monthly income of her family is about VND3,000,000.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food, food services, livestock, trading

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan P. ha tenido ya un crédito con FVP el cual lo pago puntualmente, ahora solicita su cooperación para un nuevo préstamo, ya que por el momento no cuenta con el capital para poder realizar su mejora. Le esta haciendo falta a su vivienda los acabados del exterior y así tenerla ya terminada. 
El planea pagar este crédito con los ingresos de su trabajo como empleado de una empresa  de trasportes.
En la foto aparece su esposa la señora Elsa Atzin Garcia ya que Don Juan P. en ese momento se encontraba en su empleo.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan P. has previously obtained a loan from FVP, a loan which he paid punctually. He now requests your cooperation for another loan because at the moment, he does not have the funds necessary for home improvement. His house needs some work on the exterior for the repairs to be complete.

He plans on repaying this loan with income from his job at a transport company.

Because Mr. Juan P. was at work, pictured in this photo is his wife, Ms. Elsa Atzin Garcia.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home exterior work

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Originaire d'EKPE ,un petit village du département de l'Ouémé, Dame D. Bernadette est âgée de 30 ans; elle n'a jamais fréquenté école et est placée dès son jeune enfance chez une tutrice à Cotonou. Elle aida cette dernière dans la vente de divers articles :oeufs frais,pagnes.Quelques années plus tard,elle quitta sa tutrice pour sa mère au village et y resta jusqu'à son mariage avec AZOGA  Celestin.Elle est mère de trois (3) enfants dont 1 seul scolarisé.  Elle s'est mise à son propre compte avec l'aide financière de son mari et sa belle mère .Elle vend divers articles:charbons,condiments,huile végétale,huile rouge,pétrole.Elle sollicite un prêt pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Bernadette D. is from EKPE, a small village in Ouémé County. She is 30 years old and never attended school, though at an early age, she was placed with a tutor in Cotonou and helped her with selling various goods: fresh eggs and pagnes (colorful West African cloth). After a few years, she left her tutor for her mother in the countryside and remained there until her marriage to Mr. Celestin AZOGA. Today she is the mother of three children, one of whom is in school. With financial help from her husband and mother-in-law, she got started on her own selling: charcoal, condiments, vegetable oil, red palm oil, and gasoline. She is requesting a loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies: 40 sacks of charcoal, 1 drum of vegetable oil (25 liters), and a drum of gasoline (25 liters)
